review_body: My partner and I stayed at the Hilton Tokyo for three nights at the end of a trip around Japan, and overall, I think the best aspect of the hotel is the location. Otherwise, it is a standard Hilton that is huge and busy.I wanted to stay in Shinjuku to see that part of the city more. The hotel is connected underground to three metro stations on two different lines, which was very handy to get around parts of the city. Almost anywhere is convenient to Shinjuku station. I would recommend this hotel purely because of the location!The hotel is 38 floors, so there are a lot of people staying here. Most of the rooms are just standard, since this is a big box hotel. We got an upgraded king room, which wasn’t anything special for the price, but you’re in downtown Tokyo. The room had more storage space for luggage than I originally assumed, because underneath the closets was a lot of room for storage. I appreciated that design element.The bathroom was rather small. The bath and shower area was quite large, but I could barely even open the shower door and sit out. A larger person would have more difficulty even using the shower that way.The concierge was very professional and helpful with securing dinner reservations at restaurants for me. Having a good concierge is key in Tokyo because of the language barrier at the restaurants as well as the time difference.This hotel is very crowded. We had access to the executive lounge for breakfast and for the free cocktails in the evening, but it is rather difficult to take advantage of those benefits because of how crowded the lounge is. In all the Hiltons I have stayed in, this one had the biggest issue with space. And that is not to say that it is a small lounge, I guess just so many people have status with Hilton who stay here, I showed up at 5:55 for a 6pm happy hour and there was already a line and the lounge was full. On a different day when I showed up at 6:15, there was a wait for a table. All I saw were people streaming out of the lounge carrying three or four beers a person. Kind of random.Overall, the hotel is good for location and service, otherwise it’s just a standard Hilton with nothing remarkable about it.

Very impressed with Hilton Tokyo not just great location and easy to access to shopping and subway.It also offer free shuttle service both way to Shinjuku station. Staffs are helpful and professional. The Gym pool and hot bath area are nice and clean, a great place to relax. The club lounge has fantastic view of the city. The staffs in the lounge are polite and very friendly, particularly thanks to Waki, he go beyond his duty to make sure we have memorable time at the hotel. Highly recommended.

I got in love with Tokyo, just because od this super hotel. In the very end of my business trip I had time to visiit nearby siteseeings. The hotel administration helped to do a short but very positive trip to the bets places in Tokyo. The rooms are clear, full of lights and great smells. Service is higher than any other Hilton branch. Thank you so much for the days spent there. Love Eleni

I meant to write this review earlier, but now with COVID pandemic, able to stay at home & write this. Reminiscing about our the wonderful 5 days stay for Thanksgiving. The location was great. You can go underground & connect to two different subway station. They have a free shuttle bus, went to Shinjuku shopping & dining. Also, huge train station, where we caught the Romance train to another Hilton resort in Odawara (with hot spa).The guest relations check in person was Monica Meng, friendly, warm, & professional. She told us about the Romance Train, and how we can catch it. Even promised to get us the train schedule, I didn't think much about it, since lots of hotels don't follow thru. To my surprise, I found an envelope slipped under my door when I was out, and there was the schedule. Got upgraded to Premium Twin beds, with soaking tub. Great after a day of shopping. Breakfast in the Executive lounge was great. View of Mt. Fuji, Fresh squeezed OJ from a large machine. Cooked to order eggs. Then had Champagne or wine at night, with snacks. Enjoyed my stay so much, I highly recommended it. And plan to go back, next time in Tokyo.

It was my Japanese customers who invited me to this wonderful hotel, generally I sleep in simpler hotels,large room with large bathroom, super quality of bedding, large television, beautiful view, magnificent breakfast, lots of choice, fresh fruit juice, quick check in and they speak English very well,

What a great stay the hotel was excellent in everything stayed for 9 nights We had 2 rooms and both excellent housekeeping Did a great job Executive. Lounge one of the best Concierge sorted trips and transfers with easeAll the staff great very friendly One of the best Hilton’s we have stayed inThanks to all that made our family holiday So good Shame so far away for us otherwise we stay every month ! But next time we visit Japan it will be in the Hilton

Great hotel. Staff professional and friendly. Stayed in Premium Room with Access to Exec Lounge. Great view. Room clean, comfortable and good size. Buffet offered in main dining hall (exec buffet closed) was excellent. We enjoyed drinks and appetizers in Exec lounge. Japanese restaurant in hotel very good. Food amazing. A bit pricey but worth it. Close to public transit. I would definitely stay here again.

Booked for 3 nights, allowed early check-in which was well appreciated after 6 hours overnight flight. Had to check out urgently 3 hours later to return home country due to Covid-19. They offered straight away to reimburse 2 nights.

We stayed here on two separate occasions. As a Hilton Honors Diamond member, I was upgraded to an executive king room for my first stay and a junior suite for my second. Both rooms were comfortably furnished, although the bathroom in the suite was huge by comparison. We were given glasses of champagne as a welcome amenity, as well as having access to the Executive Club Lounge. Evening canapes included soup, salads, two hot offerings and a selection of desserts. There was also the usual free flow of beer, spirits and wine including Chandon Brut.All members of staff we met, from front of house to waitstaff and housekeeping were friendly and professional. Staff in the Club Lounge went above and beyond, even going so far as to wait patiently on hold while ringing airlines in South Korea to cancel our flights due to the Corona virus.Pre-stay emails were answered promptly and all requests granted.

Great location and services. Bikes available for check out at no cost. Free shuttle to/from hotel & Shinjuku station. Wonderful staffs. VIP lounge food can use improvement. Good value if you have diamond status with Hilton and can get access to the VIP lounge for free and free room upgrade.

On our return to the US from Vietnam, we had a day between flights and needed to change from Narita Airport (on arrival) to Haneda for departure. The Hilton Tokyo is one of the Airport Limo Bus stops for both airports, so it was the perfect solution for us. The hotel is beautiful and comfortable and the staff members were lovely. We made good use of the Executive Lounge and enjoyed the morning breakfast buffet in the hotel lobby. We would highly recommend this spot.

We stayed in two executive rooms for one night and the hotel is great - check in was fast and quick and we were given two smart rooms that were comfortable, modern and with good technology. We used the executive lounge for a quick bite and the staff were helpful. Breakfast was fantastic - we had it downstairs. Its busy and big - but well run.

Great location. Easy to get to from airport via limousine bus. Shuttle to/from Shinjuku station ran every 20 min. Easy to get to anywhere we wanted to visit from there. The Hilton accommodations, service and amenities were excellent. My sons loved that 7-11 and Starbucks were so close. I will stay here again next time I visit Japan.

We had a wonderful five-night stay at Hilton Tokyo towards the end of February. The two rooms we booked were adequate in space and amenities. This was our second time at this hotel and it has maintained its quality. Staff are overall helpful and accommodating, especially those at the Executive Lounge.Check-in was quick and our rooms were ready. Executive Lounge has a nice spread during cocktail hours, although it can get crowded so better be there before the 6-8pm cocktail hours. The staff are able to manage the queue by having the guests grab some drinks to go and waiting for them to be called from the room.Breakfast options are available at the lounge and at the main restaurant on the ground floor. We mostly had our breakfast at the lounge since it was sufficient and less crowded.Shuttle to Shinjuku station runs until late so it's easy access, although one can walk to nearby train stations.Lastly, shout out to Monica Meng for the thoughtful card and cake for one of us who was celebrating a birthday during our stay. It is staff like her that impresses guests and makes this hotel our choice of hotel when we have long stays in Tokyo.

Perfect location for exploring, offered spa and shower as our room wasn’t ready so early. Great room size, room service was nice. Food was nice at breakfast, a perfect spot. Christmas decorations were lovely all throughout the hotel

I would highly recommend this property! I stayed during my birthday and had a wonderful stay. Where Hilton fell short was more to do with the points program than the actual stay itself. Great location and easy access to public transportation.

I have stayed at hotels all over the US and Europe, this property is either the best or second best I've stayed at. The bad the restaurants are pricey but the bar prices are about what you pay in Las Vegas for lesser quality whiskey. The good the staff goes over the top to make you feel welcome. From the moment when we entered after a long day when the staff got our bags to the departure where the staff made a mistake and apologized proffussly, the staff is an example of how you should treat customers. Being Hilton gold we did get an upgrade to an executive room. Something not expeced but appreciated. The breakfast while a buffet was excellent and tasty. The lounge could get crowded mainly because of the cheapskates grazing on the free food. The shuttle to the Shinkuku station helps save the legs. On a clear day you can see Mount Fuji from the executive lounge, we had one partly clear day. I would not hestitate to stay here again I highly recommend this to hotel to anyone. You will hear sirens at the night, but no other noise. For those tightwads there are excellent restaurants downstairs in hiltontopia. The Italian is good and the Indian is very good with prices comparable to the states. Remember you don't tip.

We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The staff is excellent and always helpful. Our suite was so comfortable and had great views. You can walk to so much from here as well, which is very appealing. We are looking forward to returning!

Like most hotels in Tokyo, the prices vs hotel room sizes are mind blowing. I normally stay in another hotel but the Hilton were offering great rates. The restaurants are pricy but great food. The train station is right under the hotel and next door is the Park Hyatt (I like the bar there from Lost in Translation). In the train tunnels, there's lots to explore like shops and eateries. I just returned from a quaint little sushi joint for lunch that was playing jazz. The only downfall I have, and even as a loyalty customer is they put me on the 8th floor where my view is a wall and the tennis courts. I guess for the price, this is the type of room you get. It's a shame because I'm here for 9 nights. The rooms are comfortable and the bathroom is fantastic - I even have a bath tub! But my favourite is the Japanese toilets. Beds are comfy and large, room is spacious. I'm here for work, so spending quite a lot of time in my room and the TV stations are limited in English. There's basically only one English channel that's Fox Movies and most of the movies are over 20 years old or B and C grade movies. I picked "Very Good" rating for the room size, the price and the location.

Appreciate the hospitality from Miyu in Exe lounge, she was also nice to other guest when even on the busy evening, it’s was very impressive.Overall are wonderful, i will definitely recommend my friends to stay in Hilton next time, thank you!

We were there for our 38th wedding anniversary and they made it really special for us with some little special touches.We paid extra to be upgraded.The first Junior Suite room we were allocated smelt strongly like cigarette smoke and we asked to be moved, they moved us to a much lower floor, this was disappointing. We thought this was a non smoking hotel and one of the reasons we booked it (serious lung disease). The Junisoh restaurant was such a bitter disappointment. Expensive food and extremely small dishes, tasteless food and poor service, we were left alone while other patrons received exemplary service (we assumed they were locals), we would have ordered more drinks but nobody came to our table and we had to actually hail a wait staff to ask for water who then seemed very put out that we hailed them! We went for our anniversary dinner and it ruined the night.Other than this, the hotel was really lovely and we would stay again, just not visit the hotel restaurants or pay for an upgrade before inspecting the room, save the money-there are a lot of really great places to eat in Shinjuku.

My husband and I stayed at Hilton Tokyo for 3 nights in late January. The location is great and an easy place for a home base while touring Tokyo. We are Diamond members, and we got upgraded to an Junior executive suite on our second and third nights. This room was FAR bigger and better than the standard king room. The staff is very helpful and courteous. The rooms are clean. The executive lounge is a nice perk and serves a buffet style breakfast. Excellent view of Mt Fugi from the executive lounge on a clear day! The lounge reopens in the afternoon for snacks and beverages and has cocktail hours in the evening. The hotel is very close to the E line subway, and it’s quite easy to navigate to any train or subway line from there. Would definitely stay again!

This was our second stay here, and we enjoyed it just as much as the first time.The room was fairly spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is in a great location about 10 mins walk from Shinjuku, but there is a minor train station which can be accessed from a tunnel under the hotel. There was also a shuttle bus to Shinjuku from the hotel.There is a beautiful park almost opposite the hotel which is lovely for early morning walks. It always feels safe to walk around the area, even late at night, as there are so many people around.We could have breakfast at the executive level dining room, (which was usually quite uncrowded with wonderful views, including Mt Fuji) or the main dining room which was very busy but with a larger choice of food. We enjoyed both options. And of course the Executive Lounge was available for snacks and drinks at other times.The staff were all very friendly and helpful and Ernesto gave us some good advice.The only negative was a design feature of the room where there was only a glass wall between the bathroom and bedroom (right up against the bed). Part of it had a blind but the other half was frosted glass so when anyone used the bathroom during the night it lit up the whole bedroom.But we would not hesitate to stay there again next time we are in Tokyo.

Just came back from a great stay at the Hilton Shinjuku. What I like so much about it is it's location --- 40 steps away from a Starbucks and a Denny's (which you must go to, it is very different from the American ones). The biggest plus is that if you go to the lobby, and then take the parking elevator down to B1, you end up in a mini-shopping mall. It has a beauty salon (very good), barber, book store, fabulous cane store, clothing stores and best of all a convenience store where you can buy food at all hours of the day. I love to go to the convenience store and buy all sorts of funky Japanese foods -- hard boiled eggs in the shape of a tube, jelly vitamin packs (great), tamago egg package...it is really fun to explore. Take some time and go to the mall, there are some very interesting items there.My hotel room was on a lower floor, it was a very nice size, housekeeping was impeccable. The service at the hotel was also very good. There is a taxi stop in front of the hotel and it is always easy to get a taxi.I would stay here again, and heartily recommend that you try it out.

Very convenient location with limo bus from the airport and with free shuttle to the station and shopping areas and Walking distance to there. Even though to get a taxi the fare is less than 1000 yen. Lots of varieties in restaurants and bar. Friendly staff and informative concierge. Room is spacious enough for two people and lots of shopping.

Great location! The hotel is dated but well maintained. As Hilton diamond received the upgrade on the 2nd night (4 day stay). Got bumped to 29th floor - executive junior suite. Lots of other diamonds stay there so getting an upgrade is not a gimmie. Standard room is tiny. The staff is very friendly. Concierge is helpful. Complimentary shuttle is available to the nearest jr station. Metro is 2 minutes away. Overall - pleasant experience.

The hotel located near the heart of shinjuku and they provide shuttle bus to the near station. To get here from NRT is very easy, taking limousine bus from airport was our choice. The hotel is big with great lively ambience. The room we stay was big enough (when in Tokyo) with large windows allowing us to see the view of the park! one of the things I like was the toiletries of Crabtree & Evelyn which is high quality products. We were staying during Typhoon Habigis, most of guest decided to stay in. However, the hotel provided high cares to every guest including giving discounts to all restaurants in hotel and kept updating the news about the typhoon. Breakfast is big, lots of foods! I stay total 5nights without getting bored of the foods. The St. George Bar is exceptional and great atmosphere. The executive lounge is a perfect place to be; many selection of wines, beer, juice, canapes or snacks. Every staff was nice and polite. It will first come up on my mind when searching for hotel in Tokyo for my next visit!

First class hotel in the heart of Shinjuku district of Tokyo. Easy access to the metro station and local dining choices including multiple restaurants in the hotel. Staff provides a welcoming atmosphere and excellent service.

Our August, 2019 stay at the Hilton Toyko was excellent. Starting with check-in at the Exec. Lounge, where we were upgraded to a fabulous, spacious suite. This was enormously appreciated, as this visit was part of a month long trip throughout Asia, SE Asia and AU. The room was amazing, with a very comfortable bed and plenty of room for yoga practice in our room, which is always a bonus for me. For breakfast, the Exec. Lounge was so busy and unpleasant that we chose to enjoy the lobby restaurant buffet. Here the crowds were even larger, but the staff cheerfully welcomed us each morning & proptly ushered us to seats. The food selection was just unreal. I've never experienced such a bustling breakfast buffet, but it worked as the staff kept replenishing items and clearing tables. The gym was also super busy, even early in the morning, but again, the staff made all the difference. Cheerful, helpful and efficient, they kept up with the towel supply and managed to maintain a clean, enjoyable workout room. The cardio machines were in good condition as well as the weights and weight machines. The location worked well for my husband and his business events, and I was able to explore the area (which was very safe and well lit) by foot. Shinjuku Chou Park is a short walk from the hotel, and offers a peaceful, gorgeous green oasis in the middle of the city. We love Japan, and especially Tokyo and look forward to a return visit.

We had a great stay at the Hilton Tokyo. I had booked 2 rooms for our family and when we arrived we were greeted by Yuh at reception who was fantastic and super helpful. Our rooms were on level 27 and had great views. It seems that the hotel has only been very recently renovated as our rooms were contemporary and everything seemed new/unscratched etc. I found the mattress a little too firm for me. I managed to book the rooms during a Hilton flash sale and consider our stay to be very good value. There were also no problems for a late checkout. The staff are of a very high standard. I would definitely stay here again.

Yes it is a very good hotel primarily because they have the best staff in Japan. Also they have renovated their rooms recently and the location of the hotel is great. On the other hand I must say that I tasted the worst and the most expensive hamburger in my life which costed me 38 dollars in that hotel. I could not even eat half of it. It is a great place to stay if you do not like hamburgers.

Loved our stay here. Big thank you to Yoshiki Kondo who went above and beyond in helping us save major dollars for Sanrio Land! As well giving us some great perks like late check outs!Regarding the location if anyone is wondering. You aren't in the "heart" of Shinjuku but near the business area (I think) so its a bit quiet. Its about 10 min walk to the main station. And of course there is subway stations near by (5 min walk). Like all things in Tokyo, as a noobie, you will be amazed by everything.

Probably will not stay here again. We have stayed here 4 times before and enjoyed our time, but the last visit was annoying and with so many other great options in Tokyo will likely stay elsewhere. Started off with room not being ready. Not a problem as we were there at 2. An hour before check in. They stayed they upgraded us to an executive room, but those are the same rooms as the regular rooms, and actually on a lower level than the one we looked at ore selecting on the app before we were upgraded. They said the room would be ready in 15 minutes which was nice although we were disappointed to be on a lower floor with no view from what we were expecting. Our view was of a white wall from a medical building next door. Anyway, our room was not ready in 15 minutes and they told us another 15 minutes. We asked again and they told us another 15 minutes. Finally after an hour our room was ready - this was after the check in time of 3. It was frustrating watching other people go directly to their rooms who were not Diamond members and on floors higher than us. The staff was not as friendly this time. No welcome gift in room compared to other Hiltons in Japan. No bathrobes in rooms.On the plus side, the WiFi is nice, air conditioning works great and the location is nice. About 15 minute walk to Shinjuku area. Overall the hotel is fine but we just had a disappointing stay especially after such nice treatment at Hilton Odaiba, Fukuoka and Osaka before we came here this trip.

This is one of the nicest Hilton property's I've stayed outside of the Conrad Tokyo. Very clean, staff very attentive and the vibe was that of a high end Vegas hotel without the casino. The rooms were spacious and had great views. They have a free shuttle every 20 minutes that takes you to the Shinjuku Station which from there you can explore lots on foot. There's also a subway station on the basement floor to get you around to other parts of the city and the Tokyo Station. The breakfast buffet alone is worth a trip! Loads of great Japanese and Western foods! We started our trip in Japan here and we're glad we did. It was a great hotel to start your trip around Tokyo and Japan and would recommend it.

The location, amenities and staff are excellent! We stayed at the executive lounge and used the swimming pool, spa, fitness center, lounge access daily and so far it was great! The Japanese Teppanyaki restaurant was great but make sure you resave your teppanyaki table in advance! We accessed the lounge bar as well and it was good with a pianist. They also give you umbrellas if you need it during your stay. Everything is walking distance from this hotel and the view of the city was to die for from the executive lounge floor!!! :)

great hotel with larger than average bedrooms for Tokyo. in the business district so some way from attractions and restaurants. free bus to Shinjuku station however. most of the hotel restaurants were extremely expensive. had a reasonable buffet restaurant which was fully booked with outside groups coming in. do wish they could hold some places back for residents. all in all an excellent hotel though.

The hotel is about 15 min walk from Shinjuku Station, but there’s a free shuttle bus that comes every 20 minutes. Rooms are fine by Hilton standards, with some Japanese elements to it such as the “paper” windows. Washroom was a bit small but has a tub and a shower. The afternoon tea attracts a lot of people. Overall a decent stay.

Ernesto provided a smooth checking. Aya and Makoto provided a smooth check via the executive lounge. And were very informative regarding points of interest. Rooms were very clean and bed was very comfortable.

We booked 2 rooms in the property for 5 days. My partner has Diamond status which gives us access to upgraded rooms and the Executive lounge. The hotel was full so the upgraded room was not available however the staff was profusely apologetic and offered us several other little amenities to compensate. Unlike most lounges where the offerings are sparse and repetitive, the offerings at this Hilton were creative and generous. The room were comfortable and cleaned efficiently. As far as the location goes, it as centrally located as it gets literally sitting on top of a train station. Despite its size, the staff managed to provide a sense of intimacy and personal service

Took the family to Tokyo again and this decided to stay at Hilton Tokyo in Shinjuku, Stayed in a Junior Suite in the tower and it was spacious and clean. Staff were very accommodating and helpful. Hotel had a free shuttle bus to Shinjuku Station and used it a lot, great service. I would happily recommend the property. Restaurants were great.

I wish I got an upgrade due to my diamond status, but didn’t. The location is a bit of a way to all the places that I need to go. The bus to and from airport was helpful. The lobby is grand and the room is clean.

This hotel is a hidden gem in the city. The whole experience here was amazing. The hotel lobby is impressive and the rooms in great shape and larger than I would have thought in Tokyo. What sets this Hilton apart is the professional and friendly staff. We stayed though the New Year and the hotel was at capacity. I am sure the staff was stressed a bit but you could never tell. It was impressive to watch the team rise to the occasion and deliver the same quality of service.

I spent three weeks here at the end of 2019 and it was incredible. Staff were friendly and couldn’t do enough to help. The rooms were spectacular and had everything you could want. The breakfast at this hotel is quite possibly the best I’ve ever had and I thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. The gym was also a real bonus as it had all the equipment I needed. Swimming pool was small so I avoided using that.

The hotel is in a business district and right near the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building (don’t miss the observation deck). Also, do not miss a stroll through the lovely small park nearby, the Shinjuku Chuo Park. The hotel has a free shuttle service to Shinjuku station which is a big plus but if you are used to walking, you can practically walk from the hotel to all the tourist spots of Shinjuku (ie Kabukicho, Piss Alley, Golden Gai, Shinjuku Gyoen). There are many restaurants with great views right inside the gargantuan buildings nearby (Nomura, Sumitomo, Hyatt etc.) which are worth a try but at business expense prices. The hotel lobby is always crowded and the rooms are clean and spacious but certain areas need updates. The elevators can be slow because it is a big hotel with many occupants competing for elevator space. But overall, a great stay in a great location at a somewhat reasonable price (nothing comes cheap in Tokyo). I have no major complains.

We didn't know what to expect on our first trip to Tokyo. Stayed here for 6 days and could have stayed much longer. We did have a comfortable and large corner suite so I'm not sure how big a standard room is. The room was very close to the elevators which we were a bit unsure about but with the construction going on higher up, we decided to give it a go. We didn't hear a thing the whole time we were there. Bed and pillows very comfortable, layout good with a good amount of storage. The only downside was the bathroom, shower and bath are excellent but the doors between are Japanese sliding doors which allow light through - if one person is using the bathroom the whole bedroom is lit up. Sink and toilet area is a bit cramped but manageable. Overall the room was excellent. They gym on the 5th floor is adequate, has a strange layout with cardio in two different areas and weights in a another area which is too small (only 2 people can work out at a time doing weights) - it can get very busy. There is a pool etc which is all maintained very well. The reception and lobby is always bustling - everyone very helpful and welcoming even when there are long lines. Breakfast buffet is great with lots of different items to choose from and open early til 10 on most days. There is a shuttle to Shinjuku station but we found the walk to Nishi-Shinjuku easy via there underground pathway and took the Maranouchi line often - either transfer at Shinjuku or stay on that line.

This is a big property and sometime can be very busy. The executive lounge always busy and even the lobby can be busy due to the tour group or the airlines staff are usually staying here. Get upgraded to the suite with my Diamond status and the suite are huge. However, the toilet is small . The whole room are very dark . I prefer the Hilton odaiba than this property.

Fully booking in my stay period ,the executive lounge were terrible everyday and night.Long line for wait to get seats,no food either because supply can`t satiety.High price and low value.Hotel even do nothings to respond those problem.

I enjoyed staying at this hotel. Not a lot of hotels in Tokyo offers a King Bed and if they do, they're usually very expensive. I like the free shuttle service to Shinjuku Station, but most importantly it's nice that we can walk to a train station thru a tunnel connected to the hotel.Would stay here again if I go back to Tokyo.

Located 10-15 minutes away from Shinjuku Station, I liked the neighbourhood though not so for the location. Ample dining options around the hotel. Our room was reasonable for Japan standards, neat and clean...service is good too. Breakfast was surprisingly good, more than filling and we found favourites in our 3 night stay. The japanese corner particularly is delicious (the zushi course, pickles....and fruit!).

We were upgraded to suites executive room due to long stay, however due to accessibility, we didn't want bathroom with bathtub. The check-in staff was very accommodating to find us another executive room with walk-in shower bathroom, even though the hotel was going through renovation and peak period with limited rooms available.

Great location in Shinjuku area... there’s a subway under hotel. Nice to be greeted every morning by name from Ms Mami Yuguchi!!! Great hotel buffet breakfast. Great clean rooms and fitness center! Very friendly staff!

We spent five nights at the Hilton on our trip to Japan and the staff could not have been more welcoming. Unfortunately, we were in Japan during super typhoon Hagibis, but the staff did an amazing job ensuring our safety during the stay. The hotel rooms are quite nice and larger than expected, especially for Tokyo. The hotel itself is only a few blocks from the main Shinjuku Station, which contains trains for a variety of lines. You can walk completely underground to this station from the hotel. Also, the hotel is connected to a closer Tokyo Metro stop if you'd prefer not to walk. Finally, there are some great restaurants at the hotel and in the buildings nearby for lunch or dinner.

We have stayed here a number of times over the years traveling to Japan. We are always impressed with the level of service. We have always had a pleasant stay in the past and this one has been great. All the family love it.

We have been staying in Hilton Tokyo on every visits. Location is central and convenient to connect through subways and JR lines. Service is excellent but the only different noted during this stay (unlike past visits) is the bed and pillow. I used to love Hilton pillows and I could sleep really well but not for this time. Mattress is really hard and pillows are not fluffy. This led to intermittent sleeps and I did not enjoy the stay this time round.

Great hotel. Simples.1. Extremely friendly, courteous, gracious and helpful staff.2. Hotel rooms in Japan are notoriously small and here it is no different. However, the room is spotless and has everything you need and expect.3. The bed was extremely comfy and the power shower was definitely powerful with a deep bath tub.4. The dining room was spacious with a relaxing atmosphere and the breakfast spread was enormous and catered for all tastes and cultures.5. We didn’t eat at the various restaurants but they all look great and always seemed busy. 6. There are regular shuttle buses that take you free of charge to Shinjuku every 15 minutes which takes only 10 minutes.I would definitely recommend this hotel!

With just 10 minutes walk to the nearest metro station, the hotel is situated in the commercial area of Shinjuku rather than the vibrant part with lots of night life and tourists. Room is nice and service is good. The options of breakfast can be more diversified.

Shinjuku station is five minutes away from the excellent Tokyo Hilton, and the hotel has an efficient shuttle free service from the train station every 20 minutes to and from the hotel which makes travel and shopping or visiting nearby central restaurants so easy. The staff, service and facilities are absolutely excellent. There is a proper and included gym, swimming pool and Japanese sauna included which is very welcome ( Another hotel in Tokyo I stayed in tried to charge £35 for a swim no thanks!) Plenty of restaurants and bars to choose from. One learning point for the Hilton, try to reduce the music and band noise down to normal levels. People paying £8 to £18 (ground floor bar in the Hilton) for pint of Guinness would really appreciate being able to talk to each other without shouting! When I visited in October, there were so so many people that walked into your first floor bar, turned around because of the obscene noise levels and left. You lost a tonne of business over those 4 days because of the ridiculous noise levels and your staff refusing to allow people to buy a drink and move 50 metres away from the bar on the same level, so they could talk away from the ear splitting attack on our ears! Finally, we attended an event organised for the rugby with around 600 attendees. It was simply the best buffet i have ever attended with superb Hilton service for the whole evening, really really well done! (And to rugby travel Ireland for hosting)

Stayed here for 6 nights in Dec for family holiday. The hotel is very modern and nicely furnished. Room is decent size for a Tokyo hotel room. Staff is helpful and the airport limousine stops in front of the hotel. There is the M line subway station that is close to the hotel, However, it is about 20 mins walk to Shinjuku station, they have a shuttle that takes you to Shinjuku that runs 3 times an hour but stops at 9:40pm. It would be nice if the shuttle runs a little later.

We stayed at HIlton Tokyo, which is located in NIshi-Shinjuku area of the city, for two nights during our visit to Japan. This was our second stay there. The hotel is located west of Shinjuku, rather away from the busy shopping/entertainment/transportation hub near the Shinjuku Station, but in an area full of business offices in skyscrapers. It is equidistant from two metro stops, Tosho-mae and Nishi-Shinjuku. It is convenient, but the downside is that the underground passages are somewhat sketchy looking and some may find that concerning. When we arrived there on a Thursday afternoon, the lobby was busy, but not crazy busy. Check-in was efficient, though this property appears to have become a bit stingy about Hilton Honors Diamond upgrades.Our room was clean and well designed. The decor is a bit dark, but that's what some people like, I suppose. The bed was comfortable. We had breakfast at the downstairs restaurant on the first morning. This was not the most pleasant experience. It appears the hotel attracts a few less than sophisticated guests who really did not understand common courtesy. The place was a total zoo. The breakfast in the executive lounge the next morning was much better. The bar on the second floor is nice, but there, too, is infested with ill-mannered guests. I'm afraid this hotel has become a bit too popular with certain types of guests.Despite this, the staff at HIlton Tokyo were very helpful and friendly. The bus to both Haneda and Narita Airports stops at this hotel, which is a big plus in terms of convenience.

Check-in staff was polite and gave us a room on the same floor as the lounge. Children can access the lounge and they provide beverages all day. We took breakfast from lounge and restuarant, and found that the breakfast spread from the restaurant is better then the lounge. We had our dinner at the lounge that last night as we were too tired to go out, it was simple but considered it is complimentary, Hotel is generous, we are a family of 4, they provided 5 sets of towel and more than enough toileteries for the entire stay. Swimming pool is heated, 1.3m deep. Hotel provide free shuttle to Shinjuku area every 20 minutes, very good. We got a room that can see Mt Fuji! This is our first time with Hilton and we're loving it!

the location of the hotel is good as it's not too far away from the tube station and there is shuttle bus service between the hotel and jr station. The breakfast is good and tasty. The staff is helpful and has good command of spoken English. The rooms are of good size by Tokyo standard. Rooms are clean and look new to me.

This was my first trip to Tokyo and I wanted it to be special. In researching hotels, I chose the Hilton Tokyo. It was the right choice! Even before I arrived, the information provided by the hotel was so helpful. I was arriving at Haneda and they offered the suggestion of using the Friendly Airport Limousine Bus. It was a perfect solution!When we arrived, our Front Desk lady was wonderful! Helpful and kind! The hotel is very modern and our room (3511) Twin beds, was so great! Clean, quiet, modern and a first class view of the city. Waters were provided along with tea and coffee maker. We were so grateful to have this room after our long flight from Los Angeles!The hotel staff are wonderful, including very helpful housekeeping, restaurant and general information, shuttle information, etc. Always a kind word and went the extra mile.The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas!My grown son used their fitness center and said it was so very nice!We stayed for five evenings and made arrangements to take the Limo Bus back to Haneda.The check out was flawless.Truly the staff made our experience Impeccable!I am SO glad we chose the Hilton Tokyo!We will definitely be back! Thank you so very much!Lisa H/Florida

I spent 4 nights that this property in the Shinjuku ward of Tokyo. This property is in a short walk to many high end shopping areas. It also in close proximity to several subway lines (Shinjuku Station). This Hilton property has several restaurants on premises should you chose to dine at the hotel. Each restaurant has it's own theme. If you are fortunate enough to be on a high level floor and there is clear weather, you are able to see Mt. Fuji. If traveling thru Japan the Bell station can arrange to have your property forwarded to your next location. I am very pleased with this property.

Stayed for a few days after a business trip. Great location and facilities in particular the executive lounge and large gym, with cardio and 2 weight areas.The breakfast is also great. Good variety of food.

We enjoyed our stay at this Hilton property. Our only regret is we were not able to stay for a night or two more. If (or when) we make it back to Tokyo we would definitely stay here again.Check in was quick & welcoming. As Hilton Diamond members we received an upgrade to a premium room on a high floor. Our room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. We made use of the executive lounge for a light dinner each night and breakfast each morning. After touring through Tokyo during the day the lounge was a very nice place to come back to for some relaxing time.For breakfast the lounge offered plenty to get the day started including made to order omelettes. On a clear day Fuji is in view - such a wonderful way to start the day!We found the location to be convenient as there is a train stop station right under the hotel. They also offer a shuttle to Shinjuku Station as well as to Haneda and Narita airports. We were very pleased with our stay!

Hilton Tokyo besides the service and location, has much more to offer. From the airport there is a limo bus to take you to the hotel door. The door to the nishi shinjuku station is inside the Hilton Hotel. 24h store, bar with live music, patisserie, and a japoneses, a Chinese restaurants inside the hotel. Great breakfast, staff very helpful, specially the concierge TOMOHIRO who help us with reservations and hints. The best hotel to stay in Tokyo!

Lovely hotel situated close to Shinjuku station which was easily reached by the free shuttle bus. Really well organised with plenty of staff to help with any queries -special mention goes to Pedro. No queue for check in when we arrived and we were upgraded to a lovely room on the 21st floor. The Executive Lounge is very comfortable and although not large was never overcrowded during our stay. Can highly recommend.

The hotel was featuring some sort of cake buffet in their restaurant and guests (mostly locals) had formed a ridiculously long line which snaked through the cramped lobby. Check in on a weekday afternoon stretched my patience. Regular guests such as airline crew should have breezed through, but complications left me standing alone in the Hilton Honors line for a good 15 minutes before being helped. I'm lowly Honors Gold but if I were Diamond, I'd have had a fit of epic scale. Rooms are clean but tired. Executive lounge was tastefully refreshed but over-crowded at breakfast so I opted for the restaurant downstairs. Great food selection. Packed to the rafters. Navigating the tightly laid-out buffet and returning to my table with a plate of food was nothing short of harrowing with all the instagrammers chronicling their morning meals. I would have expected this hotel to get a makeover in time for the Olympics but it doesn't appear that they will be renovating the dated lobby area. Clearing the away clutter (cheap holiday decorations, gift kiosk, inefficient seating area, etc.) would create a much more spacious feel.

I didnt feel Hilton brand at this hotel. The bathroom was small and in lobby's wc there was no paper also it was not clean enough. As a international brand, they should improve their service aswell. It was dissapointed for our partners.

Throughout my 2-week trip, beds here were the most comfortable. We had access to the executive lounge on 37th floor which tended to be quite crowded at breakfast. The opening of a new section created more space which helped made it more comfortable. Quality of food was good. Especially enjoyed the sliced roast beef during the evening cocktail period. Machine providing instantly & freshly squeezed orange juice was a nice touch at breakfast. Good idea of Hilton to provide takeaway cups for guests to bring a coffee out.

I want to like this hotel.. I really do, but it's just not hitting the right buttons.It looks grand on the outside and the common areas on the ground floor all look very luxurious. Staff is super professional and courteous.But, the wait times for check-in are horrendous without clear reason why just that every check-in apparently takes 10 minutes. There's also little things like being consistent which are off and shouldn't happen in a hotel like this. During check-in we were promised some Wine (inability to upgrade room per membership tier) but this never materialised over 2 days. Don't get me wrong, I don't care about the wine at all... but don't say one thing and then simply don't follow through with it. The lounge on the top floor was just refurbished and had its grand opening on one of our nights. Oddly enough it was much too small compared to the number of rooms in the hotel and the number of people in it (overcrowding is a thing). Note this was not during the opening itself but during breakfast in the following few days. And although it had just been re-designed completely it didn't feel modern at all.

Staying at the Hilton Tokyo was a very grand and luxurious experience. Our room was very spacious compared to most other hotels I've been to in Japan. The room was well-maintained. The toiletries were Crabtree and Evelyn. The breakfast and lunch buffet selections were varied. We had dinner at the restaurant on the 2nd floor where we had such superb steak. It's located quite some distance from the Shinjuku station but you can go on the free shuttle that goes there every 20 minutes until about 9pm. There's a nearby park and the Tokyo Metropolitan Government building is almost just across the street. There are shops at the basement, including a convenience store.

I am currently staying at Hilton Tokyo for the third time. The first two times were enjoyable. This time not so much.As a gold member I asked for an upgrade, after they gave me the room type I booked. Fair enough, even though it would be better if they offered the upgrade, since it obviously was possible for them.The breakfast was average for a Hilton hotel. There was a lot of noise from connecting rooms/hallway. Didn’t get much sleep and asked if we could change rooms. They asked if we could try another night, since people in connecting rooms were checking out. The noise continued, but I just didn’t have energy to ask for a room switch one more time.We tried to visit the executive lounge, but it was full. They did however call when they had capacity. Asked for a late check out at 3pm. Was offered 1pm. Better than nothing.

Always feels like going home when I check in at the hotel. Never fail in keeping up the services and hotel ambience... convenient location to subway and suitable for business travellers to relax and have meetings!

I have been coming to the Hilton Tokyo for years. The staff has always kind and nice as always in Japan. This time was a bit different as I have a small problem to solve and with the help of Samuel Peter and Leo Frankel, and Yutaka Shishikura (Hilton Tokyo Bay) it was solved. Back to the hotel itself, what a way to wake up and enjoy the site of Mount Fuji. the food is excellent, from breakfast to dinner. The lounge extremely and efficiently well managed. The rooms are clean and comfortable.The location is as great as one can ask. The shuttle bus, the metro and other trains make transportation extremely easy and convenient.I would like to show my appreciation to Yuh Sasaki, Anna Osanai, and the crew of the lounge composed of Mari, Makoto, Aya, Chihiro, Misato, Sachi and Hikari. Thank you to all of them for the kindness.Until next time.

We are Diamond members and were shown to the lounge to checkin. We arrived during the evening cocktail time and the lounge was packed and people were waiting outside. Our impression during checkin was poor. We were offered to eat while they processed our checkin but had to share a table with others. Our upgraded room was very nice and room service also good. We went to the gym at 1am (jetlag) and at that time could not find a restroom that was not locked. If the gym is open 24 hours there must be a bathroom too. We’ll go to a different property next time but the Manager did apologize.

My wife and I spent four days at the Hilton Tokyo at the start of our honeymoon, and we loved it!! The hotel/ room was beautiful and as Diamond member, I received an upgrade at check in. It’s in a perfect location, with a free shuttle to Shinjuku station, that allowed us to easily explore the city. The staff was also incredible, as they helped me with anything I needed and made our experience in Japan that much better. Also, the breakfast is huge and delicious!!

We had a magical stay at the Tokyo Hilton. The location in Shinjuku cannot be beat. They have a shuttle from Shinjuku station 3 times an hour, its a few mins walk from the hustle and bustle of Shinjuku but just removed to be calm oasis in middle of all that activity. There is an underground subway station that is connected to the hotel. The staff is top notch and they know how to treat their Hilton Honors members right! The breakfast every morning at the first floor and executive lounge is top notch. The breakfast choices spoil you and selections taste fresh and great. The rooms are very nice and the beds were super comfy. The bar and restaurants are good. The views from the lounge are sweet. Thank you to all the staff of the Tokyo Hilton for making our Tokyo stay unforgettable. We cannot wait to come back!

The hotel was beautiful and the staff really tried to make our stay wonderful. The rooms were clean and updated. The breakfast buffet was amazing and this hotel is in a safe area. They have a free trolley to the local shopping area and subway station. The tours we booked picked us up and brought us back to the hotel itself.

I stayed here for 5 nights last week ( Saturday to Thursday) having booked a premium room as a Hilton Diamond member ( I would get lounge access with status) I was able to check in at the lounge and was given room 1829 . The room felt smaller than when I last stayed here in April 2018 ( i was in a xx24 room then) which was larger due to the shape of the hotel) but was still large and very comforable with a great shower and bath, large king bed and good views of shinjuku. The gym and pool were very good. I felt slightly disappointed that there was no mention of an upgrade ( and put on a relatively lower floor) but the hotel looked vey busy on the saturday night especially.) I was given a voucher for a welcome drink from the HH Diamond menu in the bar and chose a Kahula milk which was excellent and had a huge perfectly spherical ice cube in it which was a unique experience.The lounge on the 37th floor was excellent offering great breakfasts ( including a made to order omellette station and a fresh orange juice machine) , afternoon tea and snacks and evening snacks and drinks. In the main lounge the food was on 2 table which could result in a bit of congestion at peak times but it was ok and there was another lounge close but that was used when there was high demand ( I was invited to use that lounge once during my stay on a particularly busy evening)The main lounge had a number of counter chairs also which made good use of the space but not a comfortable as the tables. All the staff in the lounge were excellent and friendly and provided great service.I did have one minor incident as when I returned to my room one afternoon, I found a note from housekeeping apologising for breaking my Nivea roll on deodorant during housekeeping. I mentioned this in passing to the lounge staff who were very apologetic and took details of the brand and offered to get a replacement deodorant.I went out for the evening and on my return to the room there was a replacement japanese brand deodorant ( western brands would be very difficult to find I expect) , a note from the housekeeping manager and a small box of chocolates which I greatly appreciated. The lounge staff were apologetic the next morning when I went up for breakfast also.I loved the christmas decorations in the hotel and it is in a great position in Shinjuku.Checking out in the lounge, and the staff enquired about the rating I put on the survey (8 out of 10) and noted my minor comments and gave me another box of chocolates.I arranged for the bell desk to take my luggage downstairs and for a taxi to take me to the Hilton Tokyo Bau but ended up approaching the Hilton Odaiba ( we went over the Rainbow bridge as per normal but only realised we were heading to the wrong hotel as we turned inot the road leading to the Odaiba hilton with the hotel being visible. The taxi driver was apologetic and were were soon back on the express way to Tokyo bay ( the detoour only costing a few minutes and probably a thousand yen maximum in addtional travel distance which I was not that worried about)Overall a very good stay in a very busy hotel with excellent executive lounge staff to help make the stay memorable and look forward to returning in 2020.

This is our second time staying here, first time five nights on club floor for five nights and this time in a deluxe room without breakfast for six nights. We are very happy with the staff who were so polite and helpful. They all could quite fluently communicate in English. There were lots of eateries around Hilton. There was a free Hilton shuttle bus plying between Hilton and Shinjuku Station in every 20 minutes. The last bus was at 21.40 from Hilton to Shinjuku and 21.50 returning from Shinjuku to Hilton. It was a 10 minute ride by bus and 20 minutes on foot. There were two subway stations nearby Nishishinjuku Station and Tochomae Station, which were only five minutes’ walk away all the way underpass. As earlier, Shinjuku Station was 10 minutes away by Hilton bus. Narita Airport limousine bus plied between Narita Airport and Hilton at ¥320 per person, almost two hours journey. The first bus would leave Hilton for Narita Airport at 05.30. The housekeeping was superb. They always ensured that we would not run out of toilet paper, hand tissues, towels and other vanity units. We will give it 8.6.

The location was perfect. Free shuttle bus to Shinjuku station every 20 mins.That's was very convenient as most of the places we would go visit will need to transit from this station. There also are airport limousine buses drop off and pick up in front of the hotel.The staff were very polite and friendly. Would love to come back again.

The Shinjuku Hilton is a very nice, clean, and modern feeling hotel. It's very close to a couple of Japanese subway lines and walking distance to Shinjuku station. My wife and I spent a week exploring Tokyo and found the location convenient. It was nice to have this place to come home to after a long day of exploring. Since the hotel caters to business and international travelers, everyone speaks English and we thought the hotel was a good way to ease into Japanese culture. The fitness center is clean and well-provisioned and there are cold and hot pools + dry saunas in the men and women's locker rooms. Rooms are expensive, but we felt that we got what we paid for, would stay again.

Really enjoyed my stay here. Busy, bustling hotel about a 15 minute walk from Shinjuku station, 5-10 minutes by taxi or the complimentary shuttle. Staff was extremely friendly and attentive. My room was great - very large by Japan standards and extremely comfortable. There are several good restaurants on site, and places you can walk to nearby. I took the Narita Express train from Shinjuku to the airport but the airport limo bus has a stop here as well. I will definitely stay here again.

Hilton brand is a property of choice, great service, good location, attentive and dedicated team.Tokyo Hilton Shinjuku was no exception, we enjoyed our stay, the rooms were immaculate service with a smile.

The hotel is lovely and the amenities are great. However, this is not the hotel to stay in if you want to feel like you are in Japan. The breakfast buffet was more like a Disney cruise line than anything else. Upgrades for Hilton Honors members are very good here.

Location not exactly near the station area. In fact, it was a pretty long and winding walk towards the bus interchange and JR train station.But there is a subway metro station just at the basement...Love the room, love the breakfast, love the warm reception and check out.

I stayed three nights at the hotel and it was a great from check to room selection and the executive lounge is top notch. The executive king room was great with great view of Shinjuku. The office staff is there y to help you.

We stayed for 2 nights in Nov 2019 in the Hilton Tokyo. For the price, I definitely wouldn't recommend. The two biggest issues are the rooms and the location.The hotel is located to the west of Shinjuku station, closer to Nishi-Shinjuku station. This isn't very convenient as many trains don't stop there. So you either need to transfer or walk west for approximately 15 mins from Shinjuku. More of the restaurants, bars, and shopping are also located on the east side of Shinjuku station making them closer to a 20 min walk from the hotel.The rooms are getting pretty dated. It's clearly in need of a refresh. This was most apparent with the bathroom, furniture, lighting, and switches. The bathroom was the worst of them. It looks like they painted over the tub and there was still hair stuck on when they did it. For how old the rooms are, they really cannot command $250+ a night (average shown online). I'd recommend skipping and staying at one of the newer hotels on the east side of Shinjuku or in Tokyo Station/Ginza area if you're looking for something more clean and modern.

This is my “go to” hotel while visiting Tokyo. Convenient location, easy access to subways and JR, and many restaurants and cafes nearby. What makes this hotel so outstanding, however, is the attentive service of Executive Lounge staff. They provide support to ensure my stay was comfortable, and made reservations for restaurants and activities I requested with short notice. Breakfast at Marble Lounge was outstanding as well. Overall another great stay at Hilton Tokyo. I will definitely come back.

I love this hotel. Our corporate offices are located nearby and easy walking distance. The staff are always smiling and accommodating. As a diamond member they have a great executive lounge for a full breakfast and light dinner. Getting to and from the airport is a no brained via the airport limousine bus or the Narita express train which comes right into Shinjuku station about a 12 minute walk and houses just about any type of food and shopping you can think of. The hotel is modern and well kept. Can’t say enough about how good it is. You won’t be disappointed.

Fantastic hotel; fantastic location; perfect location for business or leisure. Excellent and efficient check in (Leslie Ota) made our trip so enjoyable with a great start.Great housekeeping. Facilities are well maintained. Looking forward to my next visit.

I used to love this hotel! Conveniently located near Shinjuku station with lots of amenities and very professional staff. The problem, I think, is that it’s too busy, often oversold. As a diamond better I can’t even get an upgrade 90% of the time.I wonder if those who get it are permanent residents!!! They used to have a nice gym which is now merely a mini weight room. You cannot have more than 2 people at a time working out! Instead a Hilton management decided to have the bigger room for treadmills and bicycles! Brilliant decision, NOT! While I understand that being busy is a good problem to have for Hilton it’s a bad problem for guests, especially those with higher status. I have been very disappointed. Last night I went to the bar for a quick drink and the staff was so busy they didn’t even see me for a few minutes! Again, this is a great hotel but just so busy that there’s hardly any attention to detail anymore.

I stayed there for a acdemic conference. Great place for short stay. The room has everything we needed, Breakfast are great. People are very friendly.we enjoyed everything there, only not a lot them can speak English.

From the craziness of Shinjuku going back to the hotel is a relaxing break. The newly renovated gym has all the latest equipment to release some stress from the busy day or to start your morning. Also, we noticed that they have avdessert tea party from 2:30 - 5:30 which is really popular with the locals. They start lining up a 1/2 hour before 2:30.

I had a very nice stay, in a very nice suite. The food was very good even though the wine was a bit expensive. The weather was wonderful on that day, it was perfect to enjoy Shinjuku area and the property itself. Thank you.

Very nice and comfortable hotel, walking distance to the subway. The breakfast choice is enormous and very fresh, personel is very friendly. There are sport facilities which are open during long hours.

A lovely hotel with a great location. The hotel is connected via tunnel to a metro station so is very convenient if you’re looking to use underground.As diamond Honors members we were upgraded to a suite.The executive lounge has a great view but unfortunately (as seems to becoming more and more common), it was filled with loud tourists who see the evening canapés as a chance to get a free dinner. Instead of being a nice place to relax, it had the feel of an all you can eat buffet. This isn’t a fault of the hotel but is disappointing nonetheless.Overall, a great experience.

We stayed here during the 2002 FIFA World Cup and couldn't believe that 16 years later we're had the opportunity to stay here again with two teenagers, sadly only for 2 nights. The location is very convenient in that the airport limousine bus (after picking up luggage, head out to your left passed the tourist information booth is the orange ticket machine for airport limousine bus) from Haneda Airport stops directly in front of the hotel. We booked an executive jr. suite and with executive level privilege, there's separate check in area but we did not need to use for this purpose. Checking was smooth and upon learning that we have kids in tow, housekeeping the brought extra towels, bottled water and toiletries without asking. With executive room, Executive Lounge access with complimentary breakfast and evening cocktails were provided. We can either had breakfast in the executive lounge or the sumptuous buffet on the ground level. Both were fantastic with many choices of fruits, juices, Asian or Western flares. There're other restaurants on site as well but we did not have a chance to visit. If you're craving for ramen and local cuisine, there're several malls within walking distance. We walked over to the building next door and had ramen at Hakkata Ippudo and it was fantastic! While the Shinjuku shopping malls and department stores (Keio, Takashima, etc) can be reached on foot, the hotel provides shuttle service to the shopping mall areas which is a much needed reprieve from the sweltering summer heat. At night we also walked to Shinjuku Golden Gai's narrowed small alleys and tiny shanty style bars in contrast to the neon drenched "gambling" clubs and bars of the Red Lights District of Shinjuku (commonly known as Kabukicho). Even with teeagers in tow, we did not have any problems walking around the Red Lights District. We're more at awes at the neon flashing lights, the numerous vending machines (pasta in a can??), Robot Restaurant, and eventually stumbling into Piss Alley (Omoide Yokocho) which is lined with tiny restaurants frequented by locals after work.Sadly, our time only permits 2 nights at Hilton Shinjuku. The day before checking out, the executive lounge staff (Marie?) helped us finding our ways to Nishiyama Onsen Keiunkan (taking and connecting multiple trains) and arranging to have our luggage transferred to Conrad Tokyo. The staff was at all times very courteous and helpful, all speak English (which is a huge improvement from what I remembered 16 years ago) and housekeeping keeps the property clean and is very responsive. Room is spacious even with such expensive Tokyo real estate. Location is convenient and within walking distance of malls, major attractions, restaurants, laundromats, etc. We would not hesitate to return and recommend our friends and family to stay here.

We were 5 days in Tokyo for a city trip. Great city, very safe, even the red light/gay district is worth visiting because of the colourfull views! The hotel: great hotel, very nice views (we had an executive room at the 38th floor). Perfect breakfastbuffet and very friendly service ! But 1 Thing/big remark: do not! use the restaurants and bars. All is way overprized (big time) and the quality is reasonable but certainly not top for the price you will be paying! For the price of a glass of champagne you will be eating very good (drinks included) food at the local restaurants! The area is full (Around Shinjuku station) with the best Tokyo has to offer! But all in all a great trip to take and a very nice hotel! (Use Emirates business to fly, top!) Enjoy! Peter

I’m currently diamond status and have stayed at a lot of Hilton’s around the world and this was one of my favorite executive lounges. I never had to buy food since they offered so much. Everything was delicious. I appreciated my upgrade to a high floor and loved the view. The shower area was more like a sauna which was nice after long days of walking and exploring the city. The distance to to train wasn’t far but I liked the option of the shuttle.

Hilton Tokyo does live up to its name! What a beautiful hotel and it does have excellent service!Getting to the hotel is a breeze as the Airport - Hotel Friendly Limousine bus transfer stops right in front of the hotel making the transfer an absolute joy after a long flight. The checking in process was quick and the counterstaff was friendly and helpful!We booked a junior suite and it was a fairly sizeable room with access to the Executive Lounge which was nice to have plce to go chill after a long day out. They have drinks and even a happy hour from 6-8pm with free flow champagne! Highly recommended to get a room with such access.

A very well situated Hotel. Very clean. Staff very helpful and friendly. We arrived at 9;00am after travelling for 16n hours and checking was not until 3:00pm. Although we could have just left our bags and returned later we decided to get an early check in. The additional charge of 70.00 seemed very high but it was something we needed as we were very tired and jet lagged. Breakfast is great, plentiful with a lot of choice. If you can, get a seat by the water feature. Very relaxing. Room was a good size, shower very good as were the toiletries. We were in an King Executive room. Note: most Hotels have twin bedded rooms and it is not always easy to get a double or king so be specific if this is what you want.

If you're shopping for a hotel with a concierge that can secure those notoriously difficult Japanese restaurant reservations, Hilton is a great one to go with. They were patient and easy to communicate with via email. We had a lot of back and forth over the course of 2 months leading up to when reservations open. They were open and honest of their ability to book so that was helpful in managing my expectations and adjusting my plans accordingly. They were able to get a reservation at Sushi Yoshitake, a 3-star Michelin sushi-ya! It was one of the highlights of my trip.The breakfast in the lobby was great too! Lots of choices and plenty of staff to keep the items quickly turned over. The Executive Lounge is quieter and has a great view but much fewer choices.The location is pretty convenient as there is a metro stop underneath the hotel but it's a bit of a walk to the actual tracks. The signage in the metro stop is also a little confusing as well.

We love the Tokyo Hilton. We had some issues when we first checked in. The next day our issues were resolved. The GM Mr. Williiamson is the bomb. Not only is he this way but the AGM Mr Peter's and Front Desk manager/front office manager Ms Kumagai are as well. All I can say is that they are a caring 3. I will always stay at the Tokyo Hilton. I was very impressed by my room for my husband and the room for my elderly mom and sick daughter. I just loved it there and felt so special. A home away from home. I ran into Ms Kumagai in passing in the lobby and she still had a sweet demeanor. The rooms were clean..the breakfast was awesome in both locations. We paid for the executive lounge access and it's well worth the upgrade. The ladies at the desk in the executive lounge were also very kind and vhf professional. All of them were, even the food preparers. Everything we encountered with the staff was outstanding. THANK YOU HILTON TOKYO...YOU ARE THE BEST. It's a must stay at hotel.

Large convention hotel. Free shuttle between the hotel and the Keio Department Store and the Metro. Several restaurants on premises. Large rooms decorated Japanese style. Screens at windows and between bathroom and bedroom. Large soaking tub with separate shower. Kettle and a French press in room. Lots of electrical outlets for recharging. Comfortable. Lobby has minimal seating. If you need to wait after checkout and can’t stand for an hour there are seats in the business center down the hall.

We stayed at this location after a few weeks of travelling. We had one of the premium king rooms and this was a perfect rest-bite to the long journey at a reasonable price.The room was spacious (rare for Japan!), had an amazing bed, beyond powerful shower and bath. The internet was fast and free, and the gym (although in 3 separate areas) was well equipped. The breakfast is a must and the staff are attentive and personable throughout. We will definitely be coming back.

Stayed here for 4 nights, check in procedures was very smooth. All staff can speak fluent English. the executive suite we stayed is very spacious and clean. The breakfast has many choices that you won’t complain. We tried the executive lounge once and the view is good. Only 5-10 mins walk from the metro station.

Well, what can I say. Checked in went to elevator and EDDIE Jones (England Manager) walked out. Went to room. Very spacious on 22 floor. Overlooking tennis courts and many buildings. 2 big single beds. Tv. Fully stocked fridge. Bath and shower in separate cubicle. Toilet with loads of buttons that we don’t have at home. Breakfast top notch. Unbelievable amount of variety to choose from. Bar decent but pricey. Restaurant food tasted great. Food fop bar top quality. Celebrities walking around all week. Overall great hotel. Great location. I’ll be back.

Perfectly decent product.Decent breakfast but can be extremely busy.Good location. Friendly staff.Was visiting during the super typhoon and the hotel was super busy but handled a lot of customers in the bars and restaurants very well.Happy to return.

I wasn't staying at the hotel but I went to the Hilton a couple of times for the breakfast, £30. The hotel I was staying in only served sushi for breakfast and soup and I fancied a good old fry up! It was as you would expect from a breakfast buffet at the Hilton and hit the spot.

The hotel is very clean with good ambiance and big lounge and resting area the reception is so swift and food very nice taxis easy to get and rooms very clean with all amneties service was fanstastic kudos.

Great Central location and somehow manages to be quiet and spacious, amazing choice and variety of food at every meal. and very dedicated helpful and friendly staff create a unequaled vibe in this trendy high class establishment where everyone wants to be seen

The location, service, accommodations, and cleanliness are all top notch. The shower water pressure and bed firmness are second to none. The breakfast has an outstanding set of choices and you cannot walk away hungry!

Spent 4 nights in Hilton. Excellent hotel with great location only a block from metro station. Good size room and great view over neighborhood. Restaurant on first floor quite expensive - but highly recommended.

Fantastic hotel in a great location.We stayed for 6 nights at the start of the rugby world cup and after touring around Japan we had intended to stay in a different part of Tokyo later in the tournament, we enjoyed our stay so much that we cancelled the other location and stayed 11 more nights.Yes the hotel is that good, we could not a fault a single thing, everything from the staff to the food was excellent. Special thanks to Sakura and Miyu in the executive lounge for outstanding service.Do not hesitate to book this hotel, you will be happy!

The hotel had everything we needed, from quiet to busy bars, very local shops, the most amazing breakfast fusing East and West, entertainers that really entertained, room service of the best level and the most helpful concierges. The metro stations are a few minutes walk, with a direct underground link as well as a frequent shuttle bus. Although at first glance expensive, it was not that much more than the local restaurants of a similar quality. The room was large and comfortable. As it was on the 8th floor, we also got to see the trees in the roof top garden which broke up the views over the many massive office buildings. We felt very safe duringTyphoon Hagibis, even when there was a small earth tremor.

This is a good quality hotel - at the top end of 4 star. There is a range of restaurants which were good quality, if more expensive than venturing out. The breakfast buffet was very good, with a wide range of Japanese and international breakfast items. It did however get busy at peak times, when queuing to get in was necessary. The bedrooms are well-appointed and reasonable sized, although the twin beds in my room were not large. There is easy underground access to two different subway lines. I would certainly consider staying again when next in Tokyo.

Status: I have Hilton diamond status and it proved to work out well here. I was lucky enough to be in town during the World Cup games and let me tell you. This hotel had it down. It was the place to be. I actually went out several nights but waited to come back to the hotel for drinks, dinner and to meet other travelers. Rooms: I already booked a suite but was happily upgraded. The suite was wonderful. Very clean. Shoe shine service. Dry cleaning arrived on time. Room service was good. Views were great and the bed was comfortable. I was able to work comfortably and relax amongst the hustle and bustle. Floor 35Executive lounge was good:Champagne in the evening with light snacks. Great views of the city below. Charming. Restaurants:Such a selection. Wow!-True tepanyaki -Sushi bar was very fresh and authentic -Jazz king is with live singer every night And they fully stocked the bar with PROPER PINTS for the games and large ice cube balls for scotch on the rocks. Wonderfully organized. No ruckus. Only fun and great company. Well organized for the logistics. We did have to wait in line for awhile for a single drink but the group just bought bottles. -Lobby buffet style place good -cigar bar - didn’t go but nice they had it -classic Chinese restaurant. The only thing this place was missing was a spa and personal car service. It would be nice if the hotel has a couple of owner limps to do short runs for customers. It would add a lot. Taxis are expensive. And regular car service is the same as taxis unless you do the limo bus. Great location as well and walking distance to businesses and the hot spots in town. I have already recommended this hotel to 3 people and I would definitely go again. Keep up the good work guys!

This is a true 5-star hotel centrally located and with wonderful restaurants and bars. The service here is amazing too. From concierge to the Japanese restaurant and the St George Bar (the bartender and the 2 waiters when we were there were the best! I believe their names were Yuki and ...starts with a T...). The jazz singers were different each night, all excellent. But what I remembered most regarding customer service happened one week before I had even arrived. I had made a mistake on my online reservation and I called the hotel in the middle of the night (Tokyo time) and the gentleman who answered the call was the most polite and professional, helpful and patient, humble and thoughtful hotel employee I’ve ever had there privilege of interacting with. I wished I had asked for his name because he deserves all the recognition in the world. I believed it was the night of Sep 16 (maybe around 2 am Tokyo time sep 17).

Stayed here for the Rugby World Cup 2019 and cannot find any fault. The room was very comfortable- great bed and super comfy pillows-spotlessly clean, incredibly helpful professional staff who spoke good English, food was very good and catered to western tastes as well as traditional Japanese. Super close to the subway. Stayed here during typhoon Hagibis and the subsequent earthquake and the staff were fantastic. There was no disruption to arrive despite the fact the staff must have found it a struggle commuting. I booked an excursion through guest services and whilst the excursion wasn’t great, that was down to Gray Line who I wouldn’t recommend and no reflection on guest services who bent over backwards to accommodate my short notice request. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. 100% for service. Thank you Hilton Tokyo!

The Hilton Tokyo was a really great hotel with excellent service. Much better than the other Hilton we stayed in in Tokyo. The bedroom was a good size as was the bathroom especially by Tokyo standards.The hotel was extremely busy for the rugby World Cup but the service was very good considering. There was a queue for breakfast but it moved along quite quickly. The selection for breakfast was better than most hotels we have stayed in and of a better standard. The roof garden bar on the seventh floor was a great idea. Unfortunately it was closed for our first two days due to rain which put more pressure on the other two bars. The food in the hotel was extremely expensive. £25 for a club sandwich and £80 for a steak.

This is a great hotel--not quite as luxurious as some other hotels in its price range, but the convenience, being in Shinjuku but still feeling a little bit apart from it with the park close by, is why I have stayed here a few times. The restaurants are excellent--pricey, but the food is exceptional. The grill deserves the highest star rating possible--it is casual and intimate and the steak cooked on cherry wood was the best I could imagine. The staff are pleasant and helpful and efficient. There is a sense that nothing goes unnoticed by them, but they also stay in the background, so the hotel appears on the outside to just run itself. The bathroom was good. Large by Japanese hotel standards and very clean with excellent bath products. The hotel itself was hosting World Cup of rugby visitors it still didn't feel full.
