My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Tokyo in Shinjuku for 4 nights and had her brother's family for one night with us. They loved their room which was huge. The breakfast is off the charts. It's great with both Western & Asian food. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Stayed here as a family for 6 nights and didn't want to leave. Great location in Shinjuku, a short walk to a metro station. Tons of restaurants nearby. Very clean, comfortable, modern and top-notch service. The executive level club happy hour is the absolute best we've ever experienced in any Hilton hotel world-wide. Great food and selection of drinks. It gets a bit crowded and we were traveling with 2 young kids but the staff made us feel welcome and found us a place to sit.Concierge was very helpful in finding nearby restaurants and general directions. All staff spoke perfect English and were very professional. This is obviously a very well-managed operation and the GM deserves kudos for this.

Stayed as a couple and couldn’t fault anything. Room was fairly spacious, very comfy bed and great shower. We used the gym facilities which were great for a hotel standard, two large cardio areas and weights. Great Onsen style baths in the changing rooms (separate for men and women). The hotel offers a shuttle bus from the hotel to Shinjuku Station and back every 20 minutes (you could also walk in 15-20 minutes if you wanted to). Also 3 mins walk from Nishi Shinjuku Station if you would like to get the train and visit other areas. The breakfast is excellent, buffet style but very fresh, choice of everything you could think of (eggs, Asian breakfast, pastries, fruit, pancakes and waffles as well as cereals and yoghurts). We would definitely stay again if we returned.

Walking distance to train station and Kabukicho. So there is plenty of things to do.There are not many restaurants around the hotel though. So make sure you have your dinners planned. Go out at night stroll around..Hotel itself is clean and comfortable. Rooms sizes are decent and the breakfast is amazing.

I am regretting not taking photo of our room because it was very nice so here are some photos of the strawberry buffet that we had on our last evening in Japan. There were definitely lots of people who werent hotel guests who specifically came for the buffet. Originally when we arrived we tried to book for our third night to have dinner here but was told the only place available was side table sitting side by side. We didnt think this was ideal and the staff went above and beyond to get us a very nice table for two in the end. Very impressed. Back to our actual stay at the hotel... when we arrived, the place was definitely buzzing but not overly busy that we have to wait for long. This was for our last leg in Japan and we had stayed in other hotels around and we found Hilton has the best bed and pillows! It is no surprise as our family always trust the Hilton brand and stayed with Hilton whenever we travel. In the first night, there was plumbing issue that cAuse a lot of inconvenience. The toilet were rattling every time so often which interrupted our sleep significantly that night. Engineering was called around 11ish and they couldnt replicate the problem because it happen so randomly (and loud) that u just cant wait for it unless it happen, i did took a video to show them the issue so that it didnt look like i was imagining it. The reception offered to move our room right away but we refused because it was very late and tbh im super exhausted and wishing this will go away(it didnt). And surely enough the pipes keep rattling loudly all night at random intervals. By about 5am i was fed up and went to the lobby and decided to take up their offer of moving room but i said i need time to pack up first. I then tried to catch up on some sleep time as much as i can (no luck) until we have to go to our activity at 8am, by that time our luggage are now fully packed and we are ready to move room. So the staff said that i can come pick up our new room key later this afternoon and our luggage will be moved to the new room while we are out and about. Nice.In the evening, we were moved to a corner room at a higher floor which is bigger than the original room we were given and no plumbing sound. I do appreciate the bigger space though i specifically go for Hilton hotels for their bed mainly. We were sleeping so comfortably that night and the following night.I think that while issues do come up here and there, what makes a hotel great is their ability to resolve their hotel guests problem. And in this very case they did and we were very satisfied with the result despite the interrupted sleep on the first night. Overall i find the staff very helpful and speaks english very well.Also, location wise this hotel is connected to the nishi shinjuku station so i can catch a train down from basement, i also walked to shinjuku station (catching pokemon) without much effort in terms of distanxe. There is also a hilton free shuttle every 20 minutes to and from Shinjuku station which makes this hotel very convenient. There are also a lot of dining options outside the hotel so we were very well fed through out our stay here. Definitely will come back again.

We stayed here for 4nights and quiet happy for our choice.Firstly location of the hotel is quite convenient and very close to Shinjuku train station and Tokyo metro which is direct underneath the hotel.many restaurants and specially Indian restaurants and shops are close enough.shuttle bus to Shinjuku town central is very helpful.service at hotel is excellent and staff are very friendly and polite.checkin desk and concierge staff are very helpful.Breakfast buffet is absolutely amazing with various varieties.We enjoyed our stay in Hilton and we prefer this for our next stay also.

I stayed here due to the proximity to the starting line of the Tokyo Marathon. It is pricy, but worth the peace of mind. The restaurants are very good, but expensive for what they offer so be sure to ascend the staircase just by the entrance to the buffet, to an underground tunnel that takes you to iLand- where there are many better and much more affordable and authentic eateries.

We stayed here as a couple and from the very beginning of our stay, we met only nice, warm and welcoming staff members. We stayed in a junior king suite which was just amazing. Big (even compared to Japanese standards), spacey and with a nice sofa and work desk. The bathroom was nice with a window to the rest of the room, making it really light. There were lots of amenities and the bed was huge and so comfy. Breakfast was absolutely amazing despite the fact that the hotel is renovating their executive lounge and the executive breakfast was therefore moved temporarily somewhere else. However, the big variety of food, freshly made omelets, pancakes, fruits, freshly pressed orange juice etc. was delicious. The regular breakfast buffet was just as amazing with a bigger sortiment, however perhaps a little less good quality - but still Hilton standards! Shuttlebusses run regularly to Shinjuku Sta. - which is also only 15 minutes walk away though. My best recommendations for Hilton Tokyo and a great thank you for a lovely stay - and our very best stay in Japan.

We stayed here recently for 5 nights and booked 3 suite rooms through the Hilton website.Firstly, the location of the hotel is quite convenient. It’s close to some restaurants and shops and there is a iLand building nearby that has some restaurants (eg. Udon and ramen, Japanese and western food). There is also a free shuttle bus to take you from the hotel to the middle of Shinjuku town central. The hotel is not in the middle of a happening area - so there is still a need to take the shuttle if you want to get into the main bustling Shinjuku area (about 10-15 mins bus ride).Service at the hotel is good and I especially liked the house keeping staff. Polite and friendly and I noticed that they do take away the cups and glasses to be replaced or washed. Even though we booked 3 suite rooms and all were on the same floor - the rooms were different. Some were larger with smaller bathrooms and one was smaller with a larger bathroom. The biggest complain we have would be the breakfast - although the spread was okay with some western choices and Japanese / Asian choices, it wasn’t as good as some other 5 star hotels that we have been to. In addition, there was no variety. It was the same thing on a daily basis. Maybe we have just been spoilt by other 5 star hotels and the expectation on this is higher.The strawberry buffet for dinner was very good though.Is this a good hotel for a stay in Tokyo - I would say that yes it is if you wanted a good hotel in a quieter location in Shinjuku.

Great location. Great service. Great food nearby. Great shuttle service. I've stayed at this hotel twice for 5 to 6 days. The customer service is exceptional. Wine and champagne is too expensive for the brands provided. However, in the iLand building, there is an awesome place that sells great variety of wine and champagne by the glass and a wonderful dinner too.

We really enjoyed our stay at this wonderful hotel. From the minute you arrive the staff are there to welcome you and make you feel comfortable. The check in process was seamless and the room had an great view of the Marathon start from the 21st floor. Not to worry about the language barrier they are more than able to get you where you need to go. They also have a free shuttle bus to Shinjuku Station that runs every 20 minutes.There are also great dining options.

Super busy hotel in an excellent location. We stayed in a junior suite which was ok but bathroom tiny. Friendly, helpful and professional staff throughout the hotel. The Executive lounge was closed but excellent breakfast and cocktails were served on the second floor bar which proved perfectly adequate.

Enjoyed all aspects of the hotel. Breakfast buffet was amazing. Great location and easy access to the metro lines. Staff very friendly. Beds very comfortable. Shower great. Loved the kimono bathrobes in the rooms too.

Excellent upgraded rooms with fabulous walk-in showers. Very well located for public transport with decent staff service and nice breakfast. Fitness centre exists but could be more spacious. The lobby and downstairs restaurant gets very busy at weekends.

A large modern hotel that ticked all our boxes. The foyer and front desk were constantly busy as you would expect in a popular modern hotel. Our check in was both quick and welcoming but unfortunately our check out was not quite as quick and we had to wait in a queue for some time. Our room was located on the 27th floor with great skyline views over Shinjuku. The room was spacious, spotlessly clean and modern. Sliding rice paper screens on the windows gave the room a distinctive modern Japanese feel. The king size bed had crisp linen and was very comfortable. The bathroom was modern and well appointed with modern fixtures and fittings. The frosted glass door and wall gave the appearance of rice paper walls, they looked great. A small negative was that there was no provision to hang anything in the bathroom. Breakfast was very good with a large selection of Western, Japanese and Chinese foods. While the breakfast area was incredibly busy there wasn’t a time when we had to wait for food or service. This was a very well run operation. The hotel has a free, regular service shuttle bus to Shinjuku Station. We used this service a couple of times and found it to be on time, every time. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We will definitely consider staying again the next time we are in a Tokyo.

Really had a great stay at this hotel. Location is great with a free shuttle to the shinjuku station. Great breakfast and exceptional service. Would highly recommend. If you're heading to Tokyo give this Hilton a look you won't be disappointed

This hotel lacks personal service. It was crowded every single day. They ran out of roll a way beds which required us to upgrade to a suite at approximately $700 a night. Since the suite was not immediately available, we had to accept staying in a small cramped room with a small bathroom. There were no issues with housekeeping. No issues with the suite. The lounge was small and busy but served decent food and drinks. Service was not at a level that I have experienced at club level lounges in other hotels. The hotel has a free shuttle service which was nice. They also have an underground access to a subway. The buffet at the restaurant in the lobby was good. There was nothing exceptional about the Chinese restaurant and it is pricey. The hotel does make pretty tasty chocolates. While this hotel is convenient, the rooms, lack of service, & busy feeling will keep us from returning.

This was my second time in Tokyo in just over a week. I had previously stayed at another hotel, visited another part of Japan and returned for a night. The experience I had at the Hilton vs the first hotel I stayed at was incomparable. From the second we arrived at the Hilton no one helped us with out 6 large bags and we were met with an unfriendly and disinterested check in lady. Compared to the unbelievable service and lovely people we had come across in Japan this was surprising. We were shown up to our claustrophobic rooms that had terrible and outdated decor. The bathrooms were even smaller, you’d not be able to fit more that a person in there, for what you are paying/the reputation a Hilton hotel has this is not what I expected. Spend your money elsewhere!

This Hilton is on par with other five star international hotels, in room size, amenities and service level. It was very convenient to access the subway from the hotel and easy to get to either Haneda or Narita airport as the Limousine Bus stops at the hotel.

A one night stay on our way back home !!I thought it would be fine It’s terrible !!!From the smell in the lobby that is like a cheap aftershave / toilet spray Bring Panadol As it’s pure headache material  Possibly the worst bathrooms and toilets in the whole of japan It’s extremely disappointing as this is not a cheap hotel Won’t ever look at a Hilton again

Amazing service and staff cannot do enough to help. Room was on 34th floor, clean cosy and very good views, i would stay again in a heartbeat. my only fault i found was too many groups of large parties making the lobby very busy at times

My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Tokyo on our first trip to Japan. The hotel was perfect for a number of reason:1. Great location. A 5 minute complimentary shuttle to Shinjuku Station and a couple minute walk to Shinjuku west metro station.2. Incredibly clean. Our room was spotless with a very comfortable bed.3. The staff were all very friendly and spoke English well.4. The breakfast buffet was one of the best I have ever seen. Delicious and with so many options!We were very happy with our stay at the Hilton Tokyo and would highly recommend staying here while exploring Tokyo.

The hotel is 15 miniutes walk to the Shinjuku station but runs shuttle bus to the station frequently. It was very busy during our stay due to Chinese New Year but the hotel staff were always friendly and helpful.

Suitable for family. We upgraded the room to suite for our family of 2 adults and 3 kids. Shuttle bus to and from Shinjuku is very regular. Very convenience as the metro is just few mins away. It’s location is also near to the Tokyo observatory.

It’s somewhat disappointing...We were appointed on Room 3418. It’s “huge” considering it’s in the Shinjuku area but we felt that the room was sparse and could have easily fitted a sofa and a side table. The toilet is probably a few years overdue for an update too.To be fair, housekeeping is fantastic. They remember your needs and preferences for the five nights we spent. We never get to see the housekeeping staff and they are simply the silent heroes. Our room is always kept immaculateFront Office service is also professional and efficient We utilized the Concierge services daily mostly for restaurant reservations and locale advice... they are probably one of the most effective concierge services we have experienced We had an excellent stay and the room decor and furnishings pulled us back for the five star rating - Sorry

This is a bit of a late review as I stayed at the Hilton in November 2018. The location in Shinjuku is a little bit further away from all the bright lights and action but I found this a good thing. One of the best things about this hotel is the FREE shuttle bus it provides to Shinjuku station which made it very convenient and it ran every 20mins so you never waited long. You can walk the 15-17min to the same destination but this was a great option when it was cold or I was too tired. The Hilton does everything a major hotel does well – great breakfasts, good service, comfortable beds, clean rooms, etcI believe I booked a King room and it was large for hotel standards and very large for Tokyo. Hard to fault this place and I would come back to stay.Other helpful pieces of information:• The Airport Limousine Bus from Haneda stops directly in front of the Hilton which makes it wonderfully convenient. This is the most economical option and it was very comfortable.• There are actually two train stations close to the Hilton: Nishi Shinjuku and Tocho Mae (on the Oedo line). • Good quality gym with quite a few cardio machines and good size swimming pool• It is right next to the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building which is a great place to go for views of the city that are free

I’m a Hilton diamond and stay very often at Hilton hotels worldwide. This Hilton is a top notch property with amazing service, great amenities and an excellent staff. The rooms are comfortable, clean, spacious. The gym and pool were great features. The breakfast was fantastic. I will definitely stay here again when coming to Tokyo!

Hilton Tokyo is located in Shinjuku, the heart of Tokyo's business, shopping and entertainment district, and is an ideal place to experience modern Japan. We took the complimentary shuttle to the hotel from Tokyo Metro subway. Great place to start your exploration of the fantastic city. Highly recommended!

Always a great hotel with extremely helpful and friendly staff. Breakfast is always good although too crowded since the executive lounge was closed. Disappointing was the shower. I’m supposed to have an upgraded room but this was clearly a standard room with a standard bathtub and shower. Earlier in the week I had an upgraded room with a walk-in shower.

When I first arrived in Tokyo, I went straight to the Hilton.They had been brilliant offering amazing customer service even before I arrived, as they pre-booked my taxi from the airport, and added it to my bill.The hotel is big, but the lifts were never packed, the service was impeccable. The staff really went the extra mile, to make sure I had everything I could ask for. In particular, Ernesto, the assistant front office manager, was incredible! Warm, friendly and really making me feel taken care of. As a woman travelling alone, and in Japan for the very first time, he offered fabulous advice to help me make the best of my trip.Without a doubt, this would be the hotel I return too. It's in walking distance of so many wonderful places. And the staff will gladly offer maps and advice on where to visit and how to get there ( I actually walked miles, and I am so glad that I did as I saw so much by opting to walk)The breakfasts in this hotel were amazing, a fantastic choice!I stayed in 3 hotels during my stay in Tokyo, and this was by far, the best for food and customer service.

Had a great stay during our first trip to Tokyo with the family. Breakfast buffet is great. Stayed 4 nights in a Jr. Suite. Amenities like Kimonos and nespresso machine provided was nice touch. Location is a little far but there’s a metro station below the hotel. Thank you Keynon for arranging our room accommodation.

Stayed for 4 nights on business and found the Hilton to be very convenient and clean. They have a very good breakfast buffet. Rooms are clean and comfortable, but walls in my room must be a bit thin as I could hear the people next door talking when I was trying to sleep - not bad, but more than I would expect.The WiFi service kept disconnecting every time my phone went into standby - had to reconnect constantly, which was a bit annoying.Also, the shower door opened out and there was very little room to enter the shower - would have been better to have a sliding door. Shower itself was very nice!

We stayed here for 4 nights in January, we had 2 rooms.We are diamond members which included free breakfast, which was five star, nothing was too much trouble. The variety was very good.The rooms were compact, especially the bathrooms, however clean and sleep quality was good. The rooms are pricy around $400 AU each per night.Staff were helpful and friendly.Food in the restaurants are expensive, there are better options elsewhere.A complementary bus to Shunjuki station makes the hotel more assessible but it is not close to much.

Stayed in the Hilton for 2 nights pre hitting the Japanese Alps on a ski trip with one of my sons and 2 mates.Rooms are nice.Gym is fine but strange outlay around the pool.Breakfast was included in our deal and was AMAZING!!Dinner in the sushi restaurant at the Hilton was the most overpriced meal of my life! Average quality and micro portions and my vegetarian friend had to do with a miso soup and some lettuce.Appalling service and the 4 of us left hungry and £560 poorer! Avoid eating dinner in the Hilton at all costs!Kind regardsBo

I have stayed at the Hilton Tokyo many times in the past 5 years for work, but won't be returning. the challenge is that the hotel has a special where children stay for free. For me, this meant children crying till 2am, three of my four nights. There were also people singing at 3am in a room near me in Chinese. What a shame.

This is a huge hotel so lot of groups, crews etc. We were hoping for more personalized service. A little far away from the action but the shuttle bus helped. Would prob stay somewhere else next time......

Sadly I had limited time in Tokyo (2 nights) so I chose Hilton Tokyo due to its proximity. It was an excellent choice! Not only does the Airport Limousine Bus drop off directly to the hotel from the airport, but it is also a short walk to the Shinjuku train station. The hotel staff is extremely nice. The breakfast selection is excellent. I will definitely return whenever I come back to Tokyo!

Stayed for 4 nights at start of 3 week family holiday in Japan and again for 1 night at end. Family of 6 (kids 8,12,14,15)Booked via Hilton Honors app for two rooms to accommodate our family, thought I had booked both rooms as triple shares, but as found out app had not recorded this. The hotels reservation staff picked this up and emailed me straight away and amended booking and arranged to have rooms on same floor side by side. Very helpful. Rooms are quite large and accommodated all six of us and luggage no problems at all.Hotel is well located, walking distance to Shinjuku train station and Tokyo Metro subway lines direct access under hotel.There’s a regular shuttle bus operating all day and into evening between hotel and Shinjuku station also. We used the service every day.Breakfast buffet had excellent variety and was perfect to start each day for kids to a have a big feed before heading out for day sightseeing.Checking in desk and concierge staff very friendly and helpful with sightseeing suggestions and guidance on which train to catch to get around. Nothing was a problem.Shopping arcade below hotel has a large convenience store to get snacks, toiletries and drinks etc. Plus a great Indian restaurant and coffee shop.Overall staying at the Hilton Tokyo made family travel easy and took many of the stresses of traveling for first time to new a country with kids away.

Quite different to the Westin and Ritz Carlton Tokyo (where we also stayed). Rooms were clean and quiet at Hilton however the common areas were noticeably busier. Breakfast was very busy...coffee machines rather than a barista like Ritz and Westin. The hotel had quite an American feel which I was not in Tokyo for. Will I be back? If I was a corporate guest.

Thanks for the Hilton hotel staff, very good and hight quolity of service. In the hotel they have good tennis court! If you like sport, you need to try play tennis with good coaches and after relax in hilton spaBest regards.

We spent three nights here in total. The first in a beautifully renovated room and 2 (on the way home) in an unrenovated room - apart from the decor being a little dated it was immaculate.From check-in to check-out we could not fault our stay. The staff were friendly and helpful and could not do enough for us. A free, very regular shuttle to both Shinjuku train station and also the 2 major airports (for a small fee).We didn't eat at the restaurants as they were a bit pricey, however we did have breakfast (included in our room rate) and it was delicious.Also in a great location - an easy 10 minute walk to Shinjuku train station.Would not hesitate to stay again.

I don't think the Hilton brand name needs extensive elaboration of the service quality they offer. The experience they offer is a testament. Location, room, service is nothing short of excellent.1. Location - Hotel shuttle service is available for pick up at Shinjuku station (to and fro), which makes it convenient for travellers.2. Room - Clean and nice3. Service - Very polite, informative from Front desk to concierge

Other than my initial disappointment that as a diamond member with a standing request for high floor and we ended in the lower half of the hotel, I would say that this was a good stay.This was a vacation trip for myself and my daughter, so I did not spend any time in the executive lounge or other areas for gold and diamond members. The facilities themselves are very good, all the common areas were clean and although quite noisy, they were very nice and well decorated. The rooms as well were clean and nicely laid out, the bathroom (at least in our room) however was very small and it was difficult to squeeze between the shower door and bathroom counter when trying to get in the shower.The staff at the hotel in general were very nice and friendly, although we had few dealings with anyone, when we did it was pleasant.The breakfast buffet is excellent! There is so much variety of food there that it really becomes hard to choose. From the traditional Japanese breakfast to traditional western breakfast food, it was about perfect. The variety s extensive and you have to stay a few days just to try it all. Definitely worth eating at, it was a prefect spot for my daughter and I to fuel up before setting out on the days adventures.The area has an immense amount of places to explore, heading out on foot in any direction is an adventure.The hotel is very close to numerous subway lines as well providing quick access to anywhere in the region.I am very sure I would stay at this hotel again when I am in the area.

My wife & I stayed at this location for pre-cruise visit in Tokyo & we stayed on the executive room that provided great access to the executive lounge. Delicious breakfast with plenty of choice at the executive lounge but recommend the breakfast at the restaurant downstair. Sufficient amenities and the gym, although small, is very nice and includes a pool. The free shuttle bus for Shinjuku station was very convenient. Would definitely stay again as great services & close to Shinjuku for shopping.

True to Hilton brand, this hotel provided a great place from which we could explore Tokyo. Easy access to Shinjuku and subway, with parks nearby. Wonderful fitness center and lap-swimming pool. Staff were gracious, professional, and exceedingly helpful.

This hotel is ideally located for anyone flying in and out of Narita who wants an easy way to access the city. Just minutes from Shinjuku Station. They offer a free shuttle which is always on time and accessible (not 24 hours, but good enough). The shuttle picks up and drops off at bus stop 21. The best part of this hotel is the fitness center. It includes lots of equipment, very clean, staff is super. Best of all there is a “mini onsen” with dry sauna, hot an cold baths. Really an added plus for the weary traveler. The breakfast is also superb. I love this hotel.

This was just a lovely, comfortable and friendly place. We are pretty low HH status but were greeted by the duty manager, who was friendly and engaging with our kids. Everyone was super-attentive, friendly, and competent. The breakfast buffet was quite good, the dinner buffet was superb. The formal dining was good but extremely expensive, still there are tons of options underground and nearby so you can easily give them a miss.The music in the bars was excellent. The whiskey selection in the St George bar was superb. Beds were comfortable. But the best part was everyone going out of their way to do their job as well as they could to make it a good experience for guests.

There is nothing bad to say about this hotel - from the free hotel shuttle to Shinjuku Station to the Executive lounge staff, front desk, concierge, and cleaning staff, it's A++ all the way! If there is anything the hotel could improve, it would be the elevator service - staying at the 38th floor takes a long long time, especially if the elevators are full! Strongly recommend using express and non-express elevators. The rooms and amenities are extremely well-kept and clean.

Having stayed at the Hilton Tokyo in February 2018, I had nothing but fond memories from my initial 5 night visit. However, I wish I could say the same about our return 2019 stay.From start to finish, the hotel just didn’t deliver. We are Hilton Honours members but booked a Luxury Escape 5 night club room package on this occasion. We arrived at the hotel to be told our room was ready, however 10 minutes later that changed and we were told we would need to wait 2 hours. We headed out and returned back later in the afternoon, only to wait over 60 minutes for bags due to miscommunication (three times!) between the front desk and the concierge team. To top it off, we were informed that the Club Lounge was “shut for renovation” until April. The hotel created a make-shift lounge in one of the bars but it just wasn’t the same and the ambience was terrible.The room could best be described as “ok”. It was certainly nothing special, the bed was firm (we asked to switch but were told it was the softest bed they had) but for the money we paid, you couldn’t help but feel disappointed at the size and layout. The positives were water pressure in the shower and the amenities. The restaurants are over-crowded and despite a wonderful breakfast selection, the breakfast period was like feeding time at the zoo with far too many people. We tried to make reservations several times for dinner (in the morning, not at the last minute) and were told we could not be accommodated. We leveraged a teppanyaki dinner included as part of our Luxury Escapes dinner but were left feeling hungry and disappointed once more at the quality of the dishes. The location of the hotel is good - it’s still a 10 minute walk to the nearest subway and probably 10-15 minutes to Shinjuku station, but we enjoyed the walk. We left the Hilton after 5 nights and both agreed that it was a disappointing experience. The hotel just couldn’t seem to get the little things right. There were a few outstanding team members who did their best to rectify the issues but it just wasn’t a great stay. For the money, you can definitely find better hotels in Tokyo!Sorry Hilton Tokyo, I really wanted to give you another great review but there is plenty of room for improvement this time around!

Good service, staff were comfortable speaking English, and food was delicious. The restaurant was always packed with guests and locals alike. Would be great for hotel shuttle to have multiple stops to make it mor convenient for their guests as Shinjuku station is quite massive. Would be okay staying here again but desire a hotel closer to the station.

Maybe it was the timing, being the New Year, this place was so crowded. We arrived just after 3pm which must be peak check-in time. We went up to the Executive Lounge to check-in which was slightly less crowded. We booked the King Jr Suite Executive. We probably didn’t check it out properly but it turned out that this suite does not have a separate living area. Our bad but we were out most of the time anyway. The Executive Lounge is small, dark and crowded. If you are not the first ones in there, you will probably have to queue or go to another restaurant for breakfast. Thankfully they offer to phone you when a table is available for canapés. Staff are very professional and English proficiency is high amongst staff. One of the best meals we had on our entire 2 week Japan holiday was at the restaurant Junisoh. We enjoyed the sets and different cuts of steaks with sake at the teppanyaki section. It was excellent. The hotel has a bus to Shinjuku and back but we did not use it as the shops closed early on NY eve and closed on NY day. You can walk to a couple of train stations from the basement of the Hilton but it can be 10 to 15 minutes. Tokyo train lines can be confusing so do ask the concierge for help (they are very helpful) or whip out your phone and find the best way using a map. Otherwise, just take a taxi.

I have called Hilton Tokyo my home because of the warm welcome I have always received from their professional and guest-centered staff. They extend HHonors Gold and Diamond member privileges, including room upgrade, lounge access, and free breakfast in the lounge. Rooms are impeccable. They have an excellent work-out room with a traditional Japanese bath and sauna. Easy access to the subway system, as well as direct service to either Haneda or Narita airports on the Limousine Bus is big plus for travelers. Perfect location. Gracious Hospitality. Exemplar of HHonors Excellence in Guest Services.

Nice hotel, good rooms with 10min walk to Shinjuku station. Disgusted as HH member - paid small fortune for 2 rooms for 7 nights - given rooms at rear of hotel and just above conference room level, with views of hotel maintenance facilities. Upon check in, hotel registration attempted to charge me for them upgrading my room.

We spent four nights at the Hilton over New Year in a three person room. Whilst the room had three beds it was still roomy and comfortable. Check in and out was very efficient. The breakfast buffet on the first floor was a bit of a zoo but that was to be expected over the holiday period. Lots of selections but a bit cramped. Despite that we only had to wait 10 minutes for a table as the staff were very efficient clearing and resetting tables. Breakfast on the second floor was quieter and more relaxed, with a good selection of japanese and western food. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Shinjuku station, 5 if you get a bit of pace on. We’d stay here again.

Had a great stay in twinroom. Delicious breakfast with plenty of choice. Sufficient amenities and the gym, although small, is very nice and includes a pool. The free shuttle bus for Shinjuku station was very convenient. Would definitely stay again or atleast come back for one of their awsome-looking buffets!

The hotel is well situated near Shinjuku Station and a whole lot of excellent bars and nightlife. The lobby bar and mezzanine bar are great though as well if you don't want to go too far. Breakfast is extensive and excellent. The rooms are large (for Tokyo), quiet and comfortable. The only challenge we had was due to the size of the hotel and how busy it was (rugby was on) the elevators could take some time. Otherwise it's great!

We stayed at The Hilton over Winter Break. It is conveniently located by three different subway lines. It's a beautiful property that is well maintained. Check-in was smooth but took a long time. The rooms were well-appointed with comfortable beds, room darkening curtains, flat screen tvs, etc. The bathroom had nice amenities. Housekeeping was fantastic- we always had adequate amounts of toiletries each day and our room was always spotless. We didn't eat at the restaurant because it was very expensive. Luckily there were coffee shops in the tunnel attached to the hotel, leading to the subway.

From reservation to check out all was great and met all expectation every positive way which is very important for me when I stay in a hotel.Food quality was exactly first class I must say . Best wishes to the hotel

Arrived here very tired after a long flight, were warmly greeted and quickly checked in. Lots of fabulous restaurants, spoilt for choice. Breakfast the following morning wasterrific, lovely area, great choice. Stayed in a beautiful room for 2 nights - would love to go back soon. Located over a train station so easy for moving about.

Very nice hotel and welcoming staff. Breakfast selection was great during December stay. Also accessible to Executive lounge. Concierge very helpful with directions to destinations and subways. Reservation staff was able to book me dinner reservation and purchase my Disneyland tickets

We enjoyed our stay 100%. The Tokyo Hilton in Shinjuku was the perfect location for our 1st trip to Japan as a family. The location, hospitality, accommodations and staff were all wonderful. Traveling with a 2 year old can be challenging especially international travel but the staff made us feel welcome and went out of their way to make sure we as a Family were happy and comfortable. They surprised my Daughter with balloons, and Christmas treats every time they saw us come and go.Our room on the 36 floor was a good size room with a great view of the city. The Breakfast Buffet was also a treat and it worked very well for us b/c we were up early each day, so we were able to beat the crowds. The lounges and bars were very pleasant and decorated for the holidays.The location was spot on, super close to the Shinjuku station(5 minute walk), restaurants and sights(metropolitan water building).We look forward to visiting again.

For the price, you'd think it's nice. The location is pretty good too. But...that's it. It's like they stick all the foreigners on one floor and you got a lot of guests that are super loud and obnoxious in and outside their rooms and they don't care because the foreigners aren't their problem. House cleaning spilled stuff on our carpet TWICE and just left it there. Once was when we took an overnight trip and came back and saw it. The next was when we went out for a few hours. Additionally, if you want brunch in the hotel--good luck. The lobby is filled with outside customers who are given preference. They sat us at a trash filled closed bar when there was tons of open tables. The whole situation was disrespectful and terrible and I do wonder if they think it's cuz we don't understand but both my sister and I are fluent in Japanese and it's like...ridiculous. I've never stayed at a hotel chain before in Japan because I've lived here or stayed with friends but this experience as made me never want to do this again. The reason I gave two instead of one for the rating is because of the location and proximity to Shinjuku station. That' sit.

Location is okay but not very close to Shinjuku main station which need transfer provided by Hotel. We were assigned to 36/F which was expected to be an wonderful experience. However, it is a nightmare to us as 37/F is an executive lounge where I can hear clearly people walking, running and moving upstairs when we sleep at night and after 6 in the morning. Room itself is big enough and staff are nice.

First of all, this hotel isn’t cheap. So our expectation of the brand and level of service is different. Hilton Tokyo is a disaster. Location is far (walking) from any nice restaurants and commercial areas. Always a long subway ride and walk away. Second, the front desk is horrible in giving the WiFi password and checkin anyone in. Lines are too long. WiFi is slow, too. To the room, the furnishings is old and outdated. Tv is old, the desk has bad design that will stub your toe and the worst part is the toilet we had did not have a seated seat. Even the mall toilet or the lower star hotel we stayed in had a heated toilet seat. But not the toilet in Hilton 36th floor. The gym also is like a tiny 10 sqm of free weights. It’s pretty much like a treadmill and elliptical room and swimming pool. A joke to be called a gym.So that’s the main issues location, room and services all with failing marks. Please for the sake of value for money stay in a better hotel.

As we went to check in at the ground floor there was a sign saying the executive lounge is on the level 37 so we decided to check in there. Executive check in was professional. We were served drinks whilst we waited for check in. The lounge had views across to the mountains and tokyo sky line. As we checked in around 11 they had sandwiches, cakes and pastries on offer, with juice, soft drinks, tea and coffee available.We had an executive junior suite room 825 on the 8th floor, quite close to the lift. Despite this we didn’t hear a thing and didn’t see any one else get on or off the floor, it was as we were the only ones on the floor. The room is quite big by tokyo standards. A roll away bed was put in place for our son and we still had room with a large couch setting. We were surprised to see a nice card and some biscuits from the hotel celebrating out wedding anniversary. The staff in the lounge remembered us each time we went there.With lounge access we could choose from the lounge, the marble restaurant on the ground floor or the Japanese breakfast on level 2. the executive lounge staff were more than happy to book the Japanese breakfast for us as they only run at 7, 8 and 9. The Japanese breakfast comes in a tiered bento boxes with a great deal of thought put into the presentation. It wasn’t as filling as a buffet breakfast but is definitely worth a try. The marble lounge was quite busy on both mornings we tried it. It had a mix of western and Japanese dishes like the standard fair of baked beans, hash browns. Juices were limited to orange, apple and grapefruit, however there was a smoothie station at the back which was a nice surprise. We like the made to order ramen and egg stations, they even had soy lattes you can order, However, the marble lounge and executive lounges seemed to be quite hectic. The evening canapés were a bit mixed, the pasta salad and rice salad were nice. The make your own salad was also great, but there wasn’t much of a Japanese flavour to the food on offer. Each evening changed though there were the same basic salads etc. the only thing lacking was a desert corner. The chandon, wine and hard liquor were busy corners of the lounge. Tip – go here before 6 to get a table. Saturday night was busy and we had to go back to our room to wait for a call when an empty table became available. The lounge layout is divided into 2 sections. The section on the right has windows facing mt fuji. We were lucky enough to see my fuji early one morning from the executive lounge.We used the pool and although it was small we were fortunate to time our visit where there wasn’t any one there so our son enjoyed the pool to himself. The staff at the fitness centre checkin was friendly and spoke good english.The shuttle service to Shinjuku station is quite handy and very efficiently run especially on cold mornings and evenings. The hotel is also connected via an underground walk way to both underground stations - nishi-shinjuku and Tocho-mae (about 3-5 mins away for both).There was no turn down service as you might expect from a five-star hotel.We like the Evelyn and crabtree verbena and lavender bathroom products. The heated toilet seat was lovely during our wintry stay. Complimentary water was provided everyday which was great given the dry wintry air.Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would come back again

Wonderful stay at the Hilton, Tokyo.Service, as always. Was amazing. From the restaurant staff, to the front desk staff, to the housekeeping staff, everyone we interacted with was beyond helpful and friendly. THIS is the main reason we will continue to visit this property each time we come to Tokyo. Rooms: Beds are very comfortable, and amenities are great. Yes, the bathrooms are on the smaller side, but they serve theirpurpose.Restaurant: Breakfast buffet has everything you could possibly need... huge selection. And, if you go early enough you can beat the crowds.Executive Lounge: Not impressive, but currently getting ready to undergo renovation. Location: Excellent. Rather than relying on shuttle from hotel, get a Suica card and use the metro located directly under the hotel. Limousine bus from hotel to airport is extremely convenient and cost efficient as well. Well done Hilton..... another great stay!

Pros:1. Room is spacious2. Regular complimentary shuttle to Shinjuku station3. Satisfactory range of International breakfast4. Good Japanese breakfast5. Those who have paid for lounge access can check-in and out at the executive lounge. The staff there assisting the check-in was quite friendly.Rooms for improvement:Executive lounge - The executive lounge is relatively small and crowded towards late afternoon so one can forget about having some quiet time. The range of food at the executive lounge from noon to evening was limited and of average quality. There was a staff who went around refilling the guests' glasses and having small talks with them and these guests happened to be of the same race. It was probably because those were regular guests or maybe they just happened to be having the same drink.Buffet dinner - Range of alright, could be better. Tips:If you wish to try the buffet dinner, make your reservation earlier, say a day in advanced.Do try the Japanese breakfast if you have the option.Is this the best Hilton? Not too sure about this since we have seen better elsewhere. However, it has served its purpose. The complimentary shuttle and room size are plus points. Executive lounge......can give it a miss. Did I mention about the Japanese breakfast? Try it if you can.

Surprisingly beautiful Hilton in Tokyo. I not a big fan of Hilton’s that can be very good or average.The Hilton Tokyo is a wonderful hotel in a great location.The food experience is fantastic and rooms are nice and clean.I will defiantly go back again.

Excellent location, amenities, staff service, food (best breakfast!!}. Would gladly return. Shuttle to and from main downtown hub is a great benefit. Exec lounge and front desk staff are amazing. Will be back!

Spent christmas here with family and had a thoroughly enjoyable time. Staff super helpful food and drink in club lounge great. This should get even better when the new lounge opens in 2019. Thank you all!

The service here is simply unsurpassed by any Hilton we have ever visited. From check in to check out, the staff is very attentive and helpful. The rooms have beautiful views, the food is excellent, and the proximity to Shinjuku excellent. The only negative is the executive lounge gets very crowded and busy at every meal time, so crowded, that people are eventually escorted down the hall to a small room that serves as an annex of sorts. Despite that, it’s a beautiful lounge with a nice variety of selections during breakfast and happy hour.

Nice location, with shuttle service to Shinjuku station in front of Keiko department store. Service was good in general, though they gave a wrong room contrary to our reservation and took sometime to accomodate our need ( an extra bed).Good extensive Breakfast buffet, both western and Japanese styles. As a matter of fact, we came back to breakfast buffet when we stayed at another hotel in Shibuya a week after. Executive lounge is good for tea and bar in the evening.

Wonderful Hilton in perfect location. Nice appointed rooms and superb dining experience. Staff friendly and knowledgeable. St. George’s bar is amazing. Best selection of Japanese whiskeys and top jazz music.We were a family of 4 and we felt like at home.We could not recommend more. Well done to the General Manager Mr. Samuel and his team that is doing a fantastic job managing the hotel. We will surly be back.

Wonderful check in experience and Kisuke-San was very helpful, and proactively check for a room available upgrade for my HHonor Gold membership without been prompted which I appreciate.Room is large and spaciousxand I enjoy the bathtub after a cold day out.Powerful shower is appreciated.Japanese breakfast is a must have, with three seating at 7,8,9am. The Kaiseki style breakfast is fantastic and I can have it everyday.Lounge was great although it close early at 9am. Chiharu-San was very helpful with my request.Now usually I will love to spend my time out shopping and sight seeing, but Hilton Tokyo makes me just want to stay in and enjoy the facilities.Oh yes, there is a convenient store in the basement and the shuttle bus to Shinjuku makes everything so convenient.

We spent 4 nights at the Hilton and loved it. We booked a junior suite with club access and the room was the largest we ever stayed in in Japan.We have stayed in Tokyo several times before and we prefer this hotel . We even saw MT Fuji from the club lounge.There is a small onsen which was delightfully relaxing after a long day. The hotel is busy but our room was quiet. We elected to have breakfast in the club lounge as the restaurant was busy .Handy to everything as the hotel is located on two metro lines (get a Suica Card) and a 10 minute walk from Shinjuku Station and the NEX to Narita. The hotel offers really useful free shuttle service to the station leaving every 20mins .

Long time traveler to Tokyo. Shinjuku is an odd mix of high end shopping and red light district. This means there are numerous amazing diners for sushi, ramen, and yakiniku alongside massage parlors and peep shows. Shinjuku is home of the famous Golden Gai small bars and yakitori alley which can't be missed. 3 blocks away from it all is the Tokyo Hilton. An updated 80s classic. The hotel features 2 bars, Zatta and St George. Both offer live music. Zatta is a modern bar open to the 2nd floor. St George is an English style pub with live weekend music. They have an excellent Scotch collection and mixed drinks. The drinks run expensive but are quality.The rooms are spacious for Japan. With Diamond, we were upgraded 2 days after arrival to a "special room". This was no joke. Probably the best room we have stayed in at a Hilton. The room consisted of an entryway, hallway, master bedroom/sitting area, and two green marble bathrooms. The room was extreme in its size and finishes. Can't recommend it enough. If you get offered room 3708, take it!!The exec lounge is set to be renovated in early 2019, but it was a cozy environment with sweeping views of downtown.The staff, as always in Japan, is the shining gem. From the concierge who was crucial to navigating the right and wrong places to go in Shinjuku, to the cleaning staff, and the wait personnel. everyone was extremely helpful. A Convenient shuttle runs every 20 minutes to the train station and downtown shops. You are also a brief underground walk to the Oedo and Maronouchi lines.I can't recommend the Tokyo Hilton enough. If you are looking for a fantastic room, in a great location, this is the place for you.

We stayed here the first 4 days of our first trip to Japan. Most staff speak English and they are all friendly and helpful. The included breakfast was also quite enjoyable, with lots of fresh and local foods.

I recently stayed here and it was really nice. Service is top notch and location is great. There is access to the subway from inside the lobby, which I liked but then I also liked to walk a bit to the Shinjuku station which is also close. I had a nice view and the room was bigger than I had expected. My only issue, is I could hear the people above me and when someone was in the room next door I could hear them also.

I travel to Tokyo with my girlfriend for the holidays during Dec 2018. I pick Hilton because of their reputation and location and was not disappointed with this stay. I would recommend rooms on higher floor to get the best view of the cityscape. It's one of a kind!

The Hilton Tokyo is wonderful! The hotel itself is 5 Star and the location is great, but the staff and amenities are really what sets this hotel apart. The executive lounge is wonderful and always well stocked. It has an incredible view of the city, and the staff was even kind enough to walk around and point out to each guest when you could see a glimpse of Mount Fuji off in the distance. The concierge on the main floor were amazing. We stopped by after checking in and got a number of recommendations for our time in Tokyo, and they even booked us tickets for the Robot show in Shinjuku that very same night. Every time we stopped by, we received excellent service. If you are a Hilton loyal traveler, definitely pick this hotel for your stay in Tokyo. It is the best location, and gold and diamond members get a lot of perks like free WiFi, access to their amazing executive lounge, and an incredible breakfast buffet in the lobby every day for no charge. We were also upgraded to a higher category room on a higher floor.

We spent 5 nights at the Tokyo, Hilton in November. As a Diamond for the past 25 years I have stayed at lots of Hiltons around the world-this property would rank as one of my top 3 Hilton's globally. With an amazing check in thanks to Ernesto and Monica at the front desk, we were upgraded to a great jr. suite and executive floor access. The exec floor at this hotel is spectacular-the service and offerings as well as proximity to the subway make this a great place to stay in Tokyo . The gym is great too. Also-if you are an exec floor guest you can make a reservation for the Japanese breakfast which is truly elegant and an experience not to be missed. Thanks Hilton Tokyo for a stay we are still talking about.

Fantastic hotel, service, and exceptional room. Upon an very early 11.30am check-in I am upgraded to a King View Suite which is huge - one bedroom with separate lounge room. Minimalistic in design, it is the quintessential modern Japanese-style I love.During my stay I use the gym and public bath area a number of times, and also enjoy a free drink in the Zetta Bar on the 2nd floor. This is on top of lounge access as a Diamond member for afternoon tea. I skip evening cocktails as I am only in Tokyo for one night and go out with friends instead. A very early and complimentary breakfast the next morning completes my stay. A great overnighter.

Stayed here 5 nights let’s start with the positive. Nice bed, clean, amazing view, not too far a walk to Shinjuku but they also offer a free bus shuttle to and from, the staff are very nice and speak English. Things that annoyed me. There is a mini fridge and they rip you off if you drink anything in it. Walk to the 711 around the corner and buy the same stuff for normal prices. That 5 yen can of coffee is 1 yen in the 711!! Also we were so jet lagged and exhausted that we said screw it and ordered room service 3 times. Dinner fish and chips ,pizza, hamburger and fries, pasta with a side salad and for breakfast two omlettes and they were nothing fancy. 200 bucks!! The hotel I’m in now is 100 yen a night you get a mini fridge free toiletries clean room nice English speaking staff and free breakfast. Way better than Hilton!! And no snotty stuck up dicks walking around looking down at you.

This is a terrific hotel located very close to the main train station in Tokyo. There is also a free shuttle bus that runs every 20 minutes. The hotel has several restaurants to choose from....don't miss the breakfast buffet. You won't have to eat again until supper time.

They provide basic services with some small add ons but not well planned to facilitate ease for travellers. It is quite far from the train station. Bus transfer provided but ends early like 9.45pm.Breakfast spread is the same each day for 8 days! usually crowded.

Visited between 18th - 22nd October. Arrived at Narita and caught the limousine bus directly to the hotel, 3100 yen, It does stop at several other hotels prion to the Hilton. Overall hassle free there and back using the bus. You can book a return ticket back at the hotel.I booked an executive room on the 28th floor, with lounge access, nice view of Shinjuku and the Executive lounge was excellent, nice snacks every night and the staff helpful.Check in wasn't to friendly, but efficient and the room was very nicely appointed, space age toilet with all types of gadgetry, the shower was very good and relaxing, wall hand type shower.. I didn't think much of the "plastic type" bath.The service from staff was wonderful, the young lady at the Concierge desk was a pleasure to deal, helpful and informative. The executive lounge staff were also very helpful, on my final morning one of the female staff was kind enough to let me know that Mt Fuji could be seen, a beautiful view!There is metro access at the hotel or you can catch the shuttle bus that runs on a regular basis to Shinjuku station, but be warned sometimes it gets full.Room service meals were top notch, I was one happy camper and recommend the hotel to anyone.

On the surface this is a lovely hotel, however the customer experience is less so.The Club Lounge is small and crowded and they try and charge you 6k for each person you meet, as I was here for meetings 6k for a cup of coffee when no one else was there was ridiculous especially as I was here alone so they were making a saving on me not having anyone with me full time using the lounge benefits. The room costs the same whether there are 2 of you or 1 of you but that is then not reflected in the club lounge charges and it should be. People who are by themselves should be able to have free club benefits for others because the costs would still be less than having a second person in the room and them having breakfast, afternoon tea, drinks, beer/wine and dinner every day v's a cup of coffee!I had to negotiate with them that their excuse that it gets busy was not based on reality as the lounge was empty after breakfast and before dinner when my meetings happened.The lounge is being refurbished apparently. It needs it.Not especially customer focused though as I am sure the extra charges will still apply.The gym is very limited. There is no cycling of any kind only running and cross trainers. The weights section is very small, only 2 people at a time can use the limited number of weights and there is no additional equipment.The rooms are small and bathroom is not well designed.I know it's Japanese culture but cutting all the windows in half is bizarre when most of your audience are not Japanese. It makes everywhere much darker and means less people can see the views.Some of the staff in the lounge were very nice and very helpful, others more jobsworthy.The cleaning was also bizarre, the room gives a teapot with strainer but no leaves so I put a teabag in and the cleaners didn't empty...maybe they thought I liked cold stewed tea!One of the great things about the Hilton was the range of bars and restaurants which is extensive and to suit all tastes. The Japanese one is especially fantastic.

Just spent 5 days at the Tokyo Hilton. The room was very nice, staff was exceptional, and choice of food outstanding. The location is close to Shinjuku Station yet in a quiet area. Access to taxi, bus, subway was easy.

Go to the imperial hotel if you are a tourist. This hotel is MOBBED. It was not even in the same league as the Imperial Hotel that we stayed at earlier in the week and the price point isn't that much different. It was really loud in the room. Felt like the walls were cardboard. Furnishings a bit tired and the concierge was overwhelmed by tour groups. Location was meh.

The hotel was a bit of a mixed bag for me. Room size was alright and Wifi was decent. But the property as definitely showing its age. It provides the usual Crabtree & Evelyn's Verbena & Lavender toiletries which I am not a fan of as I feel that their own inhouse Peter Thomas Roth's selections were better.The hotel is in a relatively good location and they provide a complimentary shuttle bus to Shinjuku Station every 20 minutes from 8.12am to 9.52pm and back at the same frequency from 8.20am to 9.40pm.Its Executive Lounge was incredibly busy with a small selection of not-so-great food. Besides the poor selection of food at Executive Lounge, we would also provided with the option to have Japanese Breakfast or the large buffet at the main restaurant, which we had over different days and concluded that both which were far better options than having breakfast at the Executive Lounge.

This is a WOW! Every aspect was exceptional, and not a complaint to be made. This is the level of accommodation and service I'd become accustomed to while on Corporate duties (and not my dollar/yen). For personal use, really glad I was able to use HH Points to make it affordable.

Had this booked some time ago via Luxury Escapes, Executive floor, Club access. We took the Limo Bus from Narita and was dropped right at Hotel Door. Check-in quick and pleasant and luggage immediately prepared for transport to room and delievered shortly after check-in by a nice young lady! Our room on 25th floor was super, Large, clean, all facilities worked, brilliant shower, large toiletry area in bathroom for our needs. Coffee either plunger or instant. View was towards Sinjuku downtown, and we we could make out landmarks for when out walking.Breakfast in Club room was very, very good, large selection and very attentive staff. On the first clear day we were able to see Mt Fuju from here! And staff happy to make up 'to go' package for those who have to leave very early on checkout. Huge bar area on ground floor. Concierge very helpful when needed, and if you are going to take the Limo bus to Narita and have not booked a return ticket, ask here for them to book you in as you HAVE to have a pre-booked ticket. Immediately outside and left of front door there is an entrance down to underground walkway to at least 3 subway stations, from where you can go virtually anywhere in Tokyo or, indeed, Japan!. And anyway, hotel within walking distance of the massive Sinjuku station, serving both subway and Japan Rail, where the Narita Express is available. Sinjuku downtown very easy walk and abuzz with lights and activity at night and a huge selection of eateries. The the Metropolitan Gvt Building Towers, from which there is a spectacular view, are just one street away. And the Keio Plaza Hotel, from where many tours start is easy to find only two streets away. We absolutely loved this hotel and everything it offered. And yes, we wholeheartedly would recommend it and would certainly stay here again on any return to Tokyo.

Third time we have stayed at this Hilton Hotel. Hospitality of the staff is always excellent, location of hotel provides easy access for sightseeing, shopping and transportation. Dining experience is always a treat that we look forward to sharing with our family and friends.

Enjoyed my stay at Hilton which is conveniently located in Shinjuku. Direct airport shuttle is plus. My premium room was of decent size including working desk for late office conference call. Few decent restaurant in basement mall including Indian restaurant. Breakfast buffet is usually crowded but good selection available.

You feel like a treasured family member when you visit the Tokyo Hilton in Shinjuku. Wonderful rooms, great shower and tub and amenities, fabulous restaurants, great dessert buffet in the lobby, delicious afternoon tea. It's all great!

Excellent location and great Marble Lounge breakfast which is combination western/Japanese is a great way to start the day.10 minute walk to Shinjuku JR station makes this extremely convenient location to anywhere in any direction.

More of a business hotel, it is a short commute from the “happening” parts of Shinjuku (8 minutes by free shuttle bus or 15 min/1km walk). Great gym and a 24 hour mini mart in the basement. Airport transfer via limo takes quite long cos it is the first stop (I think) and the bus will make several other stops before heading to the airport.

We stay in a lot of Hilton hotels so despite some concern over the location of this property we didn't question where we would stay for the first leg of our Japanese holiday. Prior to our visit we had a few emails with the manager Albert, which was really helpful and he was very kind to assist us. The location actually turned out to fine, the shuttle bus was easy to get and there were two smaller stations super easy walk away and the walk to the main Shinjuku station was only 20 mins. We got the airport limo bus, which I would highly recommend, as it drops you right to the door and staff help you with your bags immediately. We had been tempted to get the train, but so glad we took the hotels advice and booked the bus. Stress free and comfortable easy journey. Check in was smooth, our room wasn't quite ready which was fine, but Ernesto a manager was on hand and went out of his way to get a room that was ready for us. This was really appreciated. We were pleased with our room. We had an upgrade to a junior suite and it was specious and modern. the bathroom was particularly great. We also ordered Yukata robes for use in the room, which was so comfy I really wish I'd bought one! As diamond members we had use of the executive lounge. In general this was good. There was a good selection of food and drinks in the evening and a lovely afternoon tea in the afternoons. Breakfast there was also great. In fact we only did the main breakfast room once in our stay, preferring the executive lounge the rest of the time, which is usual for us as we have very different breakfast tastes we usually find we need the main lounge to both get what we like! Staff in the lounge however were quite mixed. We didn't find those on in the afternoon or evenings particularly friendly. They clearly know who the regulars are and spent a lot of time chatting to them and helping them. Only giving us limited help when we asked and moving on to others they knew. I can understand this to some extent, however it does make you feel like a second class citizen in a hotel you've paid a lot of money for. The only exception to this was Waku who worked the morning breakfast shift. He was so friendly and helpful and chatted to us, giving us tips and making sure we were comfortable. We didn't eat in the restaurant apart from breakfast, so can't really comment except to say breakfast was delicious. We also had drinks in the cocktail/jazz bar one evening which was great.Overall we enjoyed the hotel and would like to return, but we did stay in a significantly cheaper hotel in an easier location for our second tokyo trip. Whilst the hotel was not as luxurious it did give food for thought. Would I stay again? Probably if I got a reasonable deal.

This was our first time in Tokyo and we stayed at the Hilton for 5 nights.We had booked thru a great deal on luxury escapes that included one dinner to the value of around Aus $150 ,plus full breakfast each morning and two nightly drinks at the lounge.Well worth looking out for these deals!Also part of our Excape deal was a deluxe room.Rooms were very clean,comfy and quiet.Another bonus was a couple of English channels on TV.Hotel staff were very attentive and friendly.Location wise,very good and easy walk to Shinjuku for great eats and sights and not far away are convenience stores .Subway was a stones throw away from the hotel.We would definitely stay here again if we are fortunate enough to one day visit this wonderful country again.Downsides? Can’t think of any

We spent a week in Tokyo on vacation. Tokyo is a huge city so deciding where to stay can be a daunting task. We were fortunate that the Tokyo Hilton fit the bill. The hotel is located in the Shinjuku district of the city. It’s is a commercial, retail and entertainment hub with countless options located within walking distance. The hotel is directly connected to a metro line and Shinjuku Station is less than a 10 minute walk. The hotel is a stop on the bus lines that run directly to both Haneda and Narita airports. A great option. The hotel itself provided an upscale experience. I would not call it luxury as it did not have an air of exclusivity, but it was nice. Check-in was fast. Our room was on a high floor and offered a lovely urban view. The room was nice, and clean. We had a city view junior suite. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The linens were nice. Temperature control of the room was easy. The room had a Nespresso coffee machine which was restocked daily. The bathroom was a little small but it had everything we needed. It also had one of those high-tech Japanese toilets that requires a tutorial if you plan to try out the many different functions. I have two areas of dissatisfaction with the room. The first was there was no comfortable chairs for sitting. What was there lacked backs and they were too deep. They looked stylish but were not functional. My second issue was the lack of sound proofing between the rooms. I could hear EVERYTHING coming from the guest room adjacent to my bedroom. I do not expect that in an upscale hotel. The hotel has four restaurants and two bars and is walkable to any kind of food and nightlife you would want. Of note, one of the bars is a smoking bar. Not complaining. Just saying. As a Hilton Honors Diamond member we had access to the Executive Lounge. As far as lounges go at non-US properties it was not one of my favorites. Quite simply, it is too small for how many people are using it. There were times at breakfast and in the evening when you had to wait for a table. The tables were also very close together. I also didn’t like that at 9pm the lounge is closed and you have to leave. For people looking for a convenient, reasonable priced upscale option in Shinjuku I would say the Hilton is a decent option. If you are wanting a luxury, exclusive experience, this might not be the place for you.

This has been my first choice hotel whenever I travel to Tokyo. After a tiring red eye flight, i reached the hotel for checking in at about 11.00am. It’s like a welcoming back home feeling at the front desk, as they assisted me to find an available room so that I can get some rest (the usual check in time was 3.00pm). It was really a nice gesture which a competitor hotel of a similar class across the road could not. Thumbs up for this!The room was nice with a glass walled shower room which you can also close it up with a modesty panel. The view of the room was overlooking the Shinjuku Chuo Park, you can see the red autumn foliage.I have access to the Executive Lounge. This place is really busy and because of the crowd, it might not be that enjoyable. During the pre-dinner cocktails, you have the selections of wine, and some food but the variety was lacking. I have been to better lounges under the Hilton brand elsewhere. Perhaps this needs some leveling up. Otherwise, the staff were all friendly and provided excellent service.Breakfast at the Marble Lounge was also a busy affair. It could be chaotic, but you can get a wide variety of food choices there. I like they specially prepare the fruity yogurt shakes in small glasses. Apart from that, the staff were all very attentive to your needs and had an excellent Chef at the eggs station who would make you the perfect sunny side up and omelette.All in all, it was still a great experience and I hope to be back for more little surprises when I come to Tokyo again.

Hotel was chosen because I have bmg to spend due to unpleasant experience at down down under, reading many reviews on how to spend it, then decide it should be spent on an expensive room with more points and flexible term.Before decide on booking, exchange a few chats with HH web representative on the proper way to use it.As usual upon arrival there will be an invitation on app to do check-in and choose prefered room, no luck on upgrade, it seem I really have no luck for upgrade even with hi tier, the hotel always fully book and higher type of room not available for upgrade, not in SIN, AKL, CHC, now not even in TOKYO, although many fellow dmnd have theirs upgrade, Hilton should really spend more for upgrade room for hi-tier member.A great concierge team handle our luggage well upon arrival, it is a very busy day, see quite a long line in check-in, Lounge check-in comes to mind, but as I walk thru reception counter, the line disappears very fast as there are 6-7 staffs, after 2-3 minutes waiting, I was served, greet as hi-tier member, I just present my BMG n stated first night will be using it, while 2nd night already prepaid long ago.Mr Yusuke was very polite explaining usually will upgrade for dmnd member but hotel is very full, I can see that on app also, so I will stay as exactly what I booked, again, no luck with Hilton, same old same old, same room, BF n Lounge was, of course, extended, as part of the stay, he insists we must at least try orange juice maker at lounge in the morning and insist at least have once Japanese Breakfast experience that need some booking which we do, also he help us to book transportation to airport on check-out day.Room is as I booked, sufficient n clean, no upgrade was given. with city view, window glass is not at the best, quite dirty, maybe not cleaned enough. Try Lounge on several occasion, many options for drinks, liquor, and refreshment.Japanese BF is delicious n efficient, while BF at the main restaurant has everything you need.Check out, was charged 80k+ yen, quite confusing, as I already paid everything, explain a little bit to check out staff, very fast within 10 seconds he corrected it.Very happy to received double triple points from this stay also, as compensation for upset at down down under.Hopefully, the next time if I ever came back, will get a better room.

My wife and I booked a three night stay in a King City Suite Executive for our first stay in Tokyo and we weren't disappointed. The Executive Lounge on the 37th floor was also a thoroughly enjoyable experience. Unfortunately, we never asked the name of the gentleman who was a staff member of the Executive Lounge at morning breakfast. He was very kind and helpful to us during our stay and gave us great tips for our Tokyo travels. He knows who we are as I being English and my wife a 'beautiful Thai lady.' Please commend him on our behalf for being a star asset to your team. We both loved him very much.Superb service throughout the hotel and the shuttle bus service to and from Shinjuku was always exactly to time, though we walked on occasion for the breather as only a ten to fifteen minute walk and takes in some interesting local shops along the way. If you're departing Shinjuku Station then it's bus stop #21 in front of Keio department store. All very convenient and easy to find and the bus driver will assist you with your luggage and needs no end.There's a small shopping precinct in the basement area of the hotel with a handy convenience store which was very reasonably priced as well as a 7-Eleven within a two minute walk of the hotel. Turn left on departing the main entrance of the hotel and it's on your left. We enjoyed every minute of our stay in Tokyo and The Shinjuku Hilton was a huge part of our most enjoyable experience.

My husband and I stayed here last October during our honeymoon. The customer service was EXCELLENT! We were generously updgraded to suite in lieu of our honeymoon and was given a small gift. I am currently a Hilton Honor member so I had access to the lounge which was AMAZING with great views of the city! DO NOT miss out on the buffet breakfast downstairs! Also very easy access to trains, can be overwhelming but the concierge will walk you through it.

I am staying during 14-19 Nov 2018, Room 1109I was disappointed with your hotel service as it seemed NOT to happen at your hotel. Your hotel staffs looked down at me as if I am an ET. Pls identify and improve your service promptly.

Traveled to Tokyo for business and sightseeing with my wife. Stayed at the Shinjuku Hilton since I am a HHonors club member. Upgraded to a Jr. Suite due to Diamond status. This hotel is among the best and especially the executive lounge service and amenities. If you are a HHonors member you will be treated royally.

As a Hilton Honors member, I always try to stay in Hiltons first. When in Tokyo I always try to stay at the Hilton Shinjuku. While its a bit of a hike from Narita, it's in a good area with easy access to shopping, dining and the subway system.The rooms are nice, the Executive Lounge is nice, the Breakfasts to die for.......If you can't find something you like here, you don't like anything!!Service is always good as well.

First time in Tokyo, we decided to splash out a bit for lovely spacious King Tower Suite...huge with access to the executive lounge where we were able to grab free breakfast each morning along with drinks in the evening.Staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel has a wonderful buzz to it.In house dining and drinks a bit pricey so stuck to the lounge and brought some stuff in from the 7/11.Location is good with the main station and shopping areas walkable (20 mins) or a quick taxi ride away or grab the free shuttle provided by the hotel.

I stayed here while visiting my son, who teaches in Tokyo. Very good business class hotel, with a good executive lounge for Honors members. The breakfast options were very good, all fresh, all presented pleasantly. In the evening, you have to be there 5-7pm for the happy hour to get pre-dinner snacks. These were OK, but not sufficient to allow you to skip dinner afterwards. The rooms were clean and neat, housekeeping did a great job straightening our mess. The hotel is close to transportation, shopping, and to the Shinjuku area, and it is also quiet and a little away from the action, so it isn't too noisy.For getting around, there is an underground shopping area access by stairs near the lobby restaurant. There is a mini-mart there for light snacks and any toiletries, and you can also access a walking tunnel to take you to the nearest metro station (you really want to take that instead of walking to Shinjuku station, which is large confusing and busy). In fact, there are tunnels connecting things all through the area of the hotel, which are god options to get around without worrying about traffic, crossing streets, etc.One last advantage of the hotel is that it is a regular stop for the airport bus to Narita or Haneda. Unless you want to spend a lot more, or be a lot more frazzled by using public transportation, this is the best option from either airport.
