I appreciated the offer but was honestly surprised as of how many times the hotel was offering these upgrades, perhaps it was because we reserved the room with points (?). I have stayed in Hilton hotels all over the world but never experience this constant offering, in fact, other Hilton properties we just received a free upgrade (which we never asked for by the way). The staff was very polite, the hotel huge and the lobby area quite busy. Our room was in the 20th floor and had a city view, this wasn’t a renovated room, but it was huge for Japan standards; it was just OK, nothing to talk about; we stayed in over 8 hotels during our Japan trip and all of them, including guest houses and temples, offered free internet and yukatas, not the Hilton. I know, this is not the end of the world but it gives you a perspective, basically you need to pay way more to have access to things that other smaller establishments provide to every single person that stay in their properties. The shuttle from Shinjuku was very convenient but walking to the station was not bad at all. Location is OK and very close to the Metropolitan Government, but the “heart” of Shinjuku is like 10-15 minutes away. There is a convenience store in front of the hotel in the basement of the building so take advantage of this.

We stayed in July 2018. The hotel was great. We had two connecting rooms. The rooms were big for Japan, and the bathrooms were beautiful. The air conditioning was excellent (especially as hot as it was when we were there). The service, as is customary all over Japan, was outstanding. The breakfast buffet, which we bought with the rooms (highly recommend) as part of the rate, was absolutely perfect. It had everything you could want (including made-to-order omelets), and then some. Very efficient and saved us a ton of time in the mornings to head out for sightseeing. The hotel has a very convenient internal access way to the subway station (just a 2 to 3 minute walk underground to the station). Would definitely stay there again.

I am glad we chose to stay at the Hilton Tokyo. We booked a Junior Suite which was very very comfortable for 3 persons and had access to the Executive Lounge for afternoon snacks and drinks. The breakfast was very good with both local and international dishes. Although a bit of a walk to the Shinjuku station, they do offer a complimentary shuttle at frequent times to and from. Very handy and we did actually use it more than once!

Second time I went here since the greatest plus point for this hotel is probably how short is the distance from the hotel to Nishi Shinjuku station. It is an underground walk.For the room itself, I did encounter some problems such as how the room size wasn't exactly the same with others (same type, but can be different size). Since I was a returning guest, something took a toll when they gave me a room with no space to walk because the armchair was blocking one of the side of the bed (the right side) so the person that came with me can't go anywhere, but their response was fast regarding this problem and they change the room that seconds. So TIPS, don't hesitate to ask for room changing if it does have the same problem as mine.Next, the restaurant is very nice (the sukiyaki and teppanyaki) I like them both very much.Definitely will come back for the location itself!

Nice hotel. Location is OK but requires taking shuttle to Shinjuku Station as it is far to walk. Staff was very helpful. Especially like that the hotel’s fitness center is available for guest use 24/7. Hotel restaurants are extremely expensive. There are so many better restaurants nearby at a much better price.

This hotel is just simply great and value for money! Was here for 4 nights. Check in was a Breeze and given an upgrade with lounge access due to Gold status.Room was clean and perfect decent size for couple given Tokyo pay-for-space Hotel notoriety. Toilet amenities were replenished daily and water pressure was really strong (which is what a tourist needed at end day after sightseeing). Daily breakfast at different places - executive lounge, main lobby dining lounge or 2nd level Japanese Restaurant (see pictures) was what needed to start the day right. Service was always friendly and kind. Hotel does provide complimentary shuttle to Keio Department Store (directly outside of main doorway) at every 20 minutes (to and fro) till around 10pm. This is helpful if you are 1st timer to Tokyo and wanting to save some cash due to expensive taxi rides. Check out service and was relatively fuss free with genuine smile always and feedback sought.Love this hotel totally. Highly recommended. Will definitely stay again if I’m back! Great job guys, Team Hilton Tokyo!

WARNING: you will not get your bed type. I have stayed at this hotel four times in the past two years. I have not once gotten the bed type I have reserved, even as a Hilton Gold member. Management doesn’t seem to care. My friends and I (which includes diamond members) are taking all of our repeat business elsewhere. Booked a premium king and am currently in a twin bed (am currently staying here... unfortunately!). The one pro is the easy access to the subway. Good luck...

There are a number of memorable features at the modern Tokyo Hilton, but the one that really stands out is the wonderful, powerful shower. I love a great shower experience, even if it means a bit of floor flooding (because of the way the shower is constructed). And the towels were so large and fluffy. Bathroom amenities are first rate.My queen size bed was very comfortable and I slept soundly each night, even being placed next to an ice machine. I never heard it. Room air conditioning is effective, which is really quite important given the steamy summer weather.The jazz bar on the second floor has great music and a wonderful bar menu and service.Service is simply sensational, in all respects. And the daily breakfast buffet is truly something to behold. I highly recommend the Hilton Tokyo, notwithstanding that it's a very expensive choice.

I absolutely enjoyed my stay and would return! I was upgraded to a King City Suite Executive which was huge and very elegantly laid out in a modern Japanese style. The bed was firm and very comfortable; I appreciated the pillow menu to order specialty pillows (foam, buckwheat, etc). The room was very clean and in good condition (perhaps recently renovated).The staff were very helpful and pro-active which I appreciated. The breakfast buffet was great and well stocked; although I highly recommend the traditional Japanese breakfast in their restaurant. It requires reservations but is excellent. The executive lounge was very convenient for coffee, bottles of water, and snacks.We didn't use the subway shuttle service. It is a nice walk to Shinjuku but longer than it seems on a map. The Tochomae stop is a few blocks away if you use the Oedo or Shunjuku lines to come back from a day of sightseeing.I have Hilton Gold status and definitely felt appreciated!

Spent a week at the hotel, and the staff were great, location is ideal and facilities were exceptional. Great variety of restaurants in the hotel and the hotel is located near a major subway station with complimentary hotel shuttle service. Highly recommend and will return in the late fall to the same hotel.

Our family had a great stay at the Hilton Tokyo. The rooms were nicely appointed and the shuttle bus to Shinjuku Station was very convenient for getting around. We really enjoyed the Executive Lounge. Our favorite part of the stay was the amazing breakfast every morning. There was a large variety of both Western and Asian foods as well as interesting juice options. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this property when we return to Japan. If you are traveling with two or more kids, you will have to book 2 rooms. Our rooms were not connecting, but were a few doors down from each other. As our kids are teens, we were okay with this arrangement.

Great location in Shinjuku. Even tho it's a bit away from the shopping area of Shinjuku, the shuttle bus of the hotel is very convenient. The business blocks and parks are around it. Hilton Tokyo defines what the service means in my mind, incredible all-sided service since I stepped into the lobby and lasted all the stay time.

My husband and I were celebrating our 11th wedding anniversary. Our first tip to Tokyo. We had great time and go back with lots of beautiful and wonderful memories. Yoshi from the Front Office was great. Very professional and helpful made our stay comfortable. Staff and the housekeeping was amazing. Hotel is walking distance to the metro and Shinjuku square. Perfect location. Highly recommended.

The Hilton Tokyo keeps up the Hilton standard and is a great hotel in a good location. A high standard hotel with great dinning options inside the hotel . Also rooms very good , roomy, clean and in good condition. The location is handy to many attractions , plus the rail station which Hilton offer a free shuttle service to. I would definitely stay there again.

Great Location, walking distance from NishiShinjuku station and its shopping, bars and restaurants of Golden Gai, and two metro lines have the station under the hotel.The hotel sells all the metro cards also. We needed some medicines and there is a pharmacy in the mall under the hotel.Breakfast is great, huge spread but it does get busy so we chose to eat all the other days in the lounge. Champagne is served with breakfast in the lounge.Rooms are big, we had a double room 3 days and then a suite for 3 days.Staff is very helpful. it has a small pool and gym area but nice tennis courts

The Tokyo Hilton is easily accessible from either Haneda or Narita by the Airport Limousine bus service which takes you right to the lobby door. Very helpful staff and good sized rooms it is a tranquil place to return to after the bustle of Tokyo. Executive lounge is excellent although it does get very busy at the weekend. The hotel runs a regular shuttle to Shinjuku station. They value Hilton Honors Gold members and we have always been lucky enough to receive an upgrade. We would highly recommend this hotel and place it as the best Hilton we have ever stayed at.

This is just an amazing place to stay while in Tokyo; the best location in terms of connection to trains and subway; beautiful rooms, fabulous view from 34th floor; option of smoking rooms; amazing buffet breakfast and restaurants on the 2nd floor; great gym and pool; even tennis court... there is no better than this! I highly recommend this hotel... and yes service par excellence!

This hotel was one of the best hotels I’ve ever stayed at around the world. Everything was in the hotel so you didn’t have to leave unless you wanted to. The hotel staff was the most polite and attentive to your every need from the begging to the end.

This hotel is busy busy busy ! This Hilton is luxurious and has plenty to offer ! I was a little taken back by the enormity of the hotel . It’s huge , in fact you can access the metro from the basement ! Totally cool ! The breakfast buffet was incredible , an array of American and Japanese breakfast items . My favorite was the juice selection . We used the executive lounge a few times and was blown away by their orange juice machine ?! Sounds crazy - google it ! Our room was very spacious ! They accommodated us with an extra cot and a fan( i need white noise!) there is a dessert buffet and different restaurants throughout the hotel . We did use the pool but thought it was weird that we had to use a swim cap . Not a big deal though we obliged . This hotel is walking distance from several metro entrances ! It’s perfect for touring Tokyo ! A must !

Great hotel. the staff was friendly and helpful .The rooms were large and nice and clean.The breakfast Buffett had Japanese and Western options and was good. They have a couple of bars and a fun rooftop beer garden too!

We stayed at this hotel in one of their top suites which had a great view. We had use of the executive lounge which was really good for relaxing drinks and nibbles after a days sightseeing. The hotel is well situated for accessing public transport with an underground connected via a basement tunnel running directly from the hotel. Very close to many restaurants in the entertainment district. We used the leisure facilities and although the pool was a good size it was fairly cold when we used it. We had breakfast in the main buffet restaurant which was huge and the foods on offer were plentiful and there really was something for everyone. The staff were very friendly and we actually booked another nights stay at the hotel as we enjoyed it so much.

Getting me to rave about a hotel isn't easy, but I'm going to make an exception this time. The staff were just amazing. The lady at Reception took the time to explain to us, as first time visitors to Japan, where things were. The waitress, Yung, who looked after us each morning at breakfast was just outstanding. We really were treated as friends and she even went out of her way to teach us a few words of Japanese (that were handy, as we found out).Star billing though has to go to the Concierge Desk. While I hardly ever rely on Concierge services in this case I was in an unfamiliar country and asked for advice on a couple of occasions. The level of detail and support, beyond anything I had specifically asked was terrific.While it was the staff that made it, the hotel itself is first class as well as being extremely well located. Below the hotel are underground walkways that lead to either or two different subway stations.If we are back in Tokyo there is no question at all that this is where we will stay.

Hotel lived up to all of the reviews I read. The airport shuttle makes it very easy going between airport. Also having subway stations nearby makes getting around the city very easy. Staff is very helpful

The staff goes out of their way for you and the amenities are tops. Loved the variety of food and shopping locations at the site. Great location with easy access to the train system and the government offices. There is no better choice in the city.

If you're looking for a boutique 5-star hotel, this isn't the place, but the Hilton Tokyo is great for location and comfort. The hotel generously upgraded us to executive lounge access because of gold status - the breakfast on the main floor was better in my opinion, but both had large spreads. Yoyogi Park is within walking distance, and the nearby Marunouchi Line connects you to all the major sites in central Tokyo. The staff all were fluent in English, and I saw more Americans at this hotel than any other I've stayed at abroad (for better or worse). I would stay again if business brought me to Shinjuku.

We stayed at Hilton Tokyo this summer during a family trip. The hotel is at a very convenient location. There are shuttle buses from both Narita and Haneda airports directly to this hotel. The check-in process was a breeze and everybody at the front desk spoke perfect English. The hotel is located in West Shinjuku where there are a lot of office buildings while most shops and restaurants are in the East Shinjuku area. There are shuttle buses every 20 minutes or so but it took about the same time for us to walk to the Shinjuku station area. Later we found there was actually a direct underground walk that allowed us to walk to multiple metro stations. The entrance to the underground walk is right next to the breakfast area. We really enjoyed our stay and would love to go back in the future. Thanks!

Located fairly close to the Shinjuku station, this is a tall luxury hotel that can serve as a good base for you to explore Tokyo and its surrounding areas. The staff is very helpful, the rooms are excellent, and they provide a free shuttle-service to and from the Shinjuku station at frequent intervals (20 mins, IIRC). The Airport Limousine service from the Narita airport can drop you directly at the hotel.We were upgraded to the Executive Suites, so we got access to the Executive Lounge at the 37th floor, which is less crowded, albeit smaller and having a limited spread, compared to the restaurant at the ground floor.The rooms were spacious and well-appointed with a superb view of the city below from the room. A nice touch was the yukatas (a casual version of the kimono) in the room. The room had chocolates and fruits to welcome us. The bathroom was good, and yes, had a smart toilet. The only weird thing was that the bathroom had a transparent glass wall that could only be covered by a sliding door _outside_ the bathroom - I have no idea about the rationale behind such a design.One of the highlights of our stay here was a traditional Japanese breakfast (it was complimentary for the Executive Suites, but you had to reserve a slot before 9 PM of the previous night).The staff at the hotel were all very courteous and very helpful. They made us feel welcome and our stay memorable. Thanks.

Hotel was great, fantastic service, very good location and delicious Breakfast buffet! Rooms are comfortable and staff was friendly and very accommodating. The hotel as a shuttle service that takes you to the center which runs every 20 minutes that is very convenient

I would give 5 starts but for the location. It is brilliant from Haneda Airport as it there is a shuttle bus straight to the Hotel over the road. We arrived from UK so were shattered with the time difference. We stayed in Executive rooms and the executive lounge was wonderful, with a good tea at 5 which served as dinner. We stayed 3 nights. Good pool, small gym, good internet. Pr/icey, but then all the hotels in March/April seem to be. Next time I would stay somewhere more central eg Ginza.

I have stayed in the Hilton Tokyo various times on business trips over the last years. It’s one of the stops for the airport limousine bus and the hotel has a free shuttle bus running between Shinjuku station and the hotel every 30 minutes. The hotel is excellent in every way: Rooms, Lounge, Staff, Services, Restaurants and Location. The rooms are spacious and extremely clean with great comfort. The executive lounge on 37 floor is wonderful with good breakfast offers and a wonderful view. The hotel staff is very attentive even to special wishes. Service is very professional and in line with Japanese standards. There are multiple restaurant options available within the hotel to support different tastes. In addition there are many great restaurants in close proximity of the hotel. Overall, this is a beautiful hotel that I highly recommend to business and leisure traveler.

Just departed from Hilton Tokyo where we stayed for six nights. Well appointed rooms, enough space for three with an extra bed. Very good choice for breakfast, special mention to the chefs who cooked eggs to order. Some much choice. Had one evening meal in the Marble Cafe, tasty food. Efficient check in and out. Helped by the Airport Limousine service calling at the hotel. Easy access to Shinjuku station, used the hotel shuttle a couple of times. Easy access to Tochomae subway station. Would definitely consider the hotel if I was ever to return to Tokyo. Stayed at the Keio Plaza hotel last time and to be honest I think Tokyo Hilton has the edge. Thanks for a wonderful time.

First time staying at the Hilton in Shinjuku. Location is very convenient to Shinjuku station and easy to get to from Haneda via the Limousine Bus. Since my requested room type was unavailable due to my late check in time, I was immediately upgraded to the club floor with all the amenities. Breakfast in the Club Room was excellent and the staff was very attentive. I will stay here every time that I visit Tokyo for business from now on.

We stayed for 8 nights in the executive suite. Very happy with the hotel, staff/service, and location. We had a great stay! The only criticism was the bathroom situation. It was relatively small for a large suite and was setup in an unusual manner. Would also have been better to have an additional half bath, as with other hotels.

Perfect way to start and end a vacation in Japan. Has the Japanese touch in excellent service but also perfect for the transition from and to western breakfast. Great reception service, and rooms were perfect. It's very close to the metro stations and also has a great shuttle to Shinbuya, which is a perfect place to start any day trip. Walking distance to a lot of great restaurants.

Was recognized as a HH Diamond member and given an upgrade to a suite, its spacious and comfortable, the only thing I was not impressed with is the size of their bathroom, found it too small and cramped. Nojima Chiharu did an excellent job with the directions we needed, went the extra mile in printing out directions, well done, much appreciated! Good location, free shuttle to train station.

Without reference, just looking comments through Internet, We spent a week in this hotel and it was really great experience: excellent location, very close to Tokyo Subway and JR, close to 3 parks and points of interest, very, very good service, clean, modern and beauty rooms and a splendid breakfast (we took a look for lunch and dinner and it was same impression). If you book with time, you can even find good rates.Totally recommendable.

We stayed last week at the Hilton Tokyo with my family. We stayed here 20 years ago and had great memories of the views and hotel quality. It did not disappoint. We requested an adjoining room since my parents were traveling along with us. The rooms are nice and have been updated. My parent's bathroom was more "updated" than ours, with a glass window that you could see into the room. Ours was more traditional with a glass partition. The bathrooms were on the smaller side compared to what you would expect in the US, but very nice for what you would get in Tokyo. As a diamond member, we took advantage of the breakfast buffet down in the lobby and it did not disappoint. We stayed at the Westin in Kyoto and the Conrad in Tokyo and I would say that the breakfast buffet offers more of a selection and better fruit bar than the Westin in Kyoto and Conrad Tokyo. The hotel is on top of an access point to the the subway and is easily accessible to anywhere else in the city. The hotel also offers a free shuttle to Shinjuku Station at :55, 15: and :35 on the hour. As usual, the Japanese service at the Hiltons brands is exceptional and we look forward to returning!

Incredible hotel, the staff was incredibly accommodating. Ernesto went above and beyond and made this such a great stay for me and my boys. Tokyo was made just a little bit smaller by the quality of the people and the rooms and the attention to detail. What a great stay! We will never stay anywhere else in Tokyo.

I chose Hilton Tokyo to stay during my visit to Tokyo because the hotel offers shuttle service to Shinjyuku every twenty minutes from 8am to 9pm.It is very conviniente. Standard rooms are Ok for a couple. Not fancy, not luxury.Small bathroom.It is a very busy hotel.Localization is good. Near to a lot of restaurants (walking distance). The neighborhood is calm because there are a lot of business buildings. So there are not all the visual pollution as other areas of Tokyo.I do recommend to have breakfast at the hotel. It is not cheap but very good with option for japanese menu and continental one too.

The hotel is beautiful, the bars and restaurants are lovely. The rooms are small and tight for a family of four. However, location is amazing and very central to everything . Shuttle bus to town was very helpful.

I had three rooms for a family vacation. The hotel was very accommodating with all of us in a row with a connecting room for our children. As a diamond member, I was able to have everyone use the lounge which was a nice break for everyone. I usually stay for business and sometimes the service is hit or miss. The family visit was great. The gym has been expanded since I stayed last and can handle a lot more people.

Excellent property.Staff wonderful, very friendly and helpful. We ate at the Japanese restaurant and had Teppanyaki, it was magnificent best steak I have ever had, pretty expensive but then we are in Japan. Bed very comfortable and the room was very clean

Absolutely awesome hotel. Visited this year on a work convention and the place didn’t disappoint. Great location, excellent rooms, amazing views from the rooms, staff are incredible and go over and above to help you and the breakfast is top class. I would recommend to any one!!! Will definitely be returning here one day.

From the Front Desk to the Executive Lounge. Everyone we encountered was wonderful. Concierge & Bell Staff are also great! When you're in Tokyo, stay at this top notch Hilton hotel located in Shinjuku!

Traveled to Hilton Tokyo after arriving at Haneda Airport. Took Airport Limo Bus which was convenient since it dropped us off right in front of the hotel. Check in was a breeze and since we were Hilton Gold members we received free breakfast buffet each morning which was nice. They apologized that the Executive Floor was too busy so we couldn't get upgraded but nice to know that even Gold members can sometimes get the Executive Floor benefit. I'm betting the food selection at the buffet on the first floor was better than the Executive Floor since the buffet was pretty impressive. Easy to get to Shinjuku station or subway. Took the Shinjuku shuttle a few times, but its also an easy walk from the hotel. Very quiet area on the weekens because no one is working in the Shinjuku business district. We had a room on the top floor so the view was very impressive on the 38th floor. I noticed the carpet on the floor was alittle dirty from age but that was the only thing I noticed that was a minor complaint.

From check in to check out, the staff was phenomenal. The breakfast buffet was delicious with both American and Japanese breakfast items. The location was conveniently located close to shopping, close to train station and nightlife. Everything was grand!

We are Hilton Diamond, so check in is at the executive lounge. Ms. Mami was there to check us in. She was friendly, helpful and professional. A real asset for Hilton.We had the junior suite. The room was big, nicely appointed and there was a free shoe shining service for staying in the junior suite which we used.Breakfast was great. Numerous selection, quite big even for Asian hotel breakfast standard.If there is a negative is that I find the pool to be on the smaller side. But that is a very small negative for this property.It is a good and absolutely decent hotel in Tokyo Shinjuku area.

Spent 3 nights with my family and our stay here was awesome .Staff was so nice especially Ms. Rina (not sure of the spelling), she is very helpful and very accommodating and also very friendly. Also the people at concierge didn’t get the name but she is definitely helpful during our stay..Will definitely recommend this hotel.

My family booked two rooms in June 2018 and stayed for 5 nights. This is a lovely hotel in the perfect area! The room was large, clean, with an amazing view of the area. It is very close to public transportation, making city exploration easily accessible. The staff spoke English and were very attentive to our needs, making dining recommendations for our family. There are many good restaurants located in this hotel and a lovely bar where we met up several times for drinks after a long, hot day of exploring the city. I cannot wait to visit again. If you have a chance to stay here, please do - you will not be disappointed!

The staff at the Hilton Tokyo provided truly exceptional service to my family and I. We had misplaced tickets that we’d purchased for a Giants game that same day. The staff worked tirelessly to help us find the tickets as we were frantically searching for them as the game was the same day. Fortunately, the friendly staff located the tickets in or room from our previous stay and we were able to go to the game. The staff was not obligated to work so hard to help find them - but they did nonetheless. I truly recommend this hotel for it’s friendly staff and top notch accommodations in a great location. A truly wonderful stay!

The room is clean and have a lot of space and great views. Big room and the bathroom is great. Very good service. מלון מעולה החדרים מאוד גדולים יחסית לטוקיו מיקום טוב שירות מעולה. אפשר ללכת ברגל לתחנת רכבת

Overall very nice stay, within walking distance to Shinjuku. While I generally prefer convenience of taxi to bus in most large cities, the fact that taxi cost is more than seven times more expensive, and with little time difference, I decided to try the bus. It was surprisingly easy and pleasant. Simply let the ticket booth person you want to take the next bus to Hilton Shinjuku, and ask where the bus stop is. It’s really nice that International Terminal is fiat pick up stop so bus is mostly empty. And the Hilton is first stop back to Haneda. Hilton front desk can book your return and include it in the hotel bill. I booked on a very full weekend, and the guest service manager was quick to come up to welcome me as a Diamond member and apologize for lack of free upgrades, and offered other amenities. From my experience this is one of a few high demand hotels where one should book the room they really want, and hope for an upgrade. But don’t bank on that. This was an overall pleasant stay and will stay here again

Service amazing .The relationship manager Mr.albert took soo good care of us and the staff they will provide any help u want . Being a vegetarian they specially prepared dishes for us and the taste was amazing. Thank you Hilton tokyo staff for taking soo good care of us . Will surely recommend everyone to stay here and feel the care these people provide .

The hotel is centrally located, and offers a shuttle bus every 15 minutes until around 10 pm to and from Shinjuku station. There is also an underground path in the basement of the hotel which will lead you to 2 subway lines, which is about a 3 mins and 7 mins walk respectively. The hotel staff was particularly helpful and courteous, and we always felt welcome there. We had a very comfortable stay there and would recommend this hotel as a base to first time visitors to Tokyo.

To kick off our Globus Tour of Japan, we were put up in the Tokyo Hilton for 3 nights. We came from a more economical hotel, so by comparison, the Tokyo Hilton’s rooms seemed enormous. Everything was fantastic - the buffets, the staff (perfect English), the location The rooms were relatively big and well appointed. The only reason I don’t give it 5 stars Is price. We tried to extend our stay but price was double the Nearby Sunroute Plaza ( reviews separately). If travelling with teens, you will need two rooms. There’s no way to get 4 in a room.

Good property, located in a quiet area, not a "downtown". metro is close to the hotel, breakfast was average, fast in-room dining service was my favourite part I guess ( never took more than 25 minutes). However, the hotel was way overpriced, 380 US Dollars for an average room without breakfast is insane IMO. After Hilton, I stayed in another 5 stars hotel with better location, service, room, breakfast and was a much cheaper price.

This hotel is just ok for me with a big lobby. The lobby have a restaurant and other gift shops but it is super busy and super noisy. If you're there for business then it's fine, but it's definitely not for those that are on vacation. If you're looking for a more Japanese feel and service then this hotel isn't for you. The room is fine and more western but the bathroom is tiny with not much counter space. The only pro about this hotel is the location where you can catch the train from the hotel without having to go outside. Overall, I wouldn't stay here again. I will just go back to the Grand Hyatt.

Great location and service. I managed to get an odd-sized room, which was larger than the standard rooms, so it was spacious and very comfortable. Weather was hot this year (Jul 2018). Be sure to request for a hand fan at the front desk when checking in. Cleanliness was very good, but could be improved.

We are a family of four with two primary school aged children who stayed at this property for five nights in interconnecting rooms.Firstly, the check in was good, with attentive staff. The common areas are a bit noisy as it did tend to echo a lot (one of the main dining areas is right next door to the reception with no partition or wall separating diners from others).The rooms were also clean and reasonably spacious (for Japan). Beds were comfortable, and rooms maintained well from one day to the next by the housekeeping staff. Pool and gym were also good. We had one meal in the hotel at the slightly pricey teppanyaki, but in return for spending almost USD700 got an absolutely outstanding meal.The location is not the best as it is too far to walk to Shinjuku station and surrounds with the kids (the hotel recognises this by having a shuttle bus that goes between the station and hotel every twenty minutes or so). There is nothing wrong with the hotel, but with young kids you might be better served staying closer to Shinjuku station itself, or perhaps even in the entertainment district proper if you prefer. By doing either of these you would open up the sightseeing and eating options a fair bit by not having to plan your excursions around hotel shuttle bus schedules or the weather.

Great location within the Shinjuku district. Hotel had beautiful rooms which were well laid out and excellent friendly staff. The breakfast was really huge with variety to cater to all tastes. The area around the hotel is also filled with restaurants. Highly recommended

This hotel was exceptionally clean, warm hospitality, wonderful helpful staff. We had beautiful Views of the city from our rooms. Excellent room service breakfast, food well presented. There is a small shopping mall on the lower level of the hotel. With a variety of restaurants & shops. Hotel very centralized to the city centre & subway. Free hotel transfers to the City Centre. Visited Odaiba, Toyota factory Kaikan, Mount Fuji. Arranged all tours with the concierge at this hotel was very friendly & helpful. Used the maps and the trains services to get around which was fantastic.Five days was too little. Wished we had more time.

Hilton Tokyo is an upscale full service hotel that has excellent amenities, a great location close to shinjuku station, and a great concierge staff that secured a Michelin 2 Star restaurant a month in advance. An overall great experience.

This is a follow-up review in regard to my most recent stay at this hotel. I fully stand behind my previous review but I feel like a few things need to be added.First of all, when I say that I have stayed at this hotel over one hundred times, that is no exaggeration. I began staying at this hotel when it first opened in the 1980s and I have continued to stay here ever since.For the first couple of decades of this hotel's existence, very little changed. In recent years, however, they have launched a redesign and upgrade campaign. The thing about change is, however, it does not always make things better it simply makes things different. And, I believe this is the case with this hotel. Yes, their restaurants and their cocktail lounge have moved and changed a bit but have they really become better? I don't really think so.In terms of the rooms, they have re-designed the interior space. What they have done, in terms of design, is that they have placed new furnishings in the rooms that are somewhat reminiscent of 1980s high-tech furniture. For example, at my most recent stay I had a desk in my room that had a glass top and very extended chrome legs. I cannot tell you how many times my wife and I stubbed our toe's on those legs because they are sticking out so far into the main area of the room. I actually thought of posting a photo of my bruised foot, due to this table, but I thought that would be in poor taste. But, they should really rethink this furnishing pattern because it is actually very dangerous. I am certain I am not the only person to have stubbed my toes on these extended legs.Another problem I find is that they have redesigned their bath/shower areas. They have installed these very limited shifting glass pieces that do not extend the entire length of the tub. I have seen the same glass pieces installed at other Hiltons and I always question why. They are just not very functional. Moreover, if you hope to take a shower with your partner, it becomes virtually impossible because water sprays all over everything. Again, this is a new design that I believe they should really rethink.In terms of actual hotel service, I did have a problem on my most recent stay. I return to my room at approximately 2:30 in the afternoon and the maid service had still not cleaned my room. I walked in, and I was in a literal disbelief. I was forced to call to actually have my room cleaned. For a hotel of this caliber, this kind of poor service should just not exist. Then, I had to go down to the cocktail lounge and have a drink while I waiting for my room to be clean. Simply unacceptable!One of the other problems I find is that, in times gone past when you needed to do currency exchange, you would go up to the main desk and there they had a section of their main reception area dedicated to currency exchange. An actual person would exchange your money for you. Now, you go and stick your money in a machine over to the side of the lobby. This is just way too impersonal of an experience for a Hilton of this caliber to offer. It is simply lazy. The entire reason that one stays at the Hilton is so that they can have personal encounters with the staff if and when needed. Thus, in my opinion, this was just a bad business decision to make money exchange via machine the only option.Overall, I still love this hotel. A few things to keep in mind, however. You really need to be very specific about the room you reserved. The higher the floor, not only the better the view, but the better the overall experience.Great hotel. I just believe that they need to rethink some of their new redesign ideology.

From the moment we arrived, we knew we made the right choice for a weekend getaway. Very warm and welcoming staff. Quiet and the buffet was awesome. Recommend going on a Saturday fir the buffet since it’s about ¥1500 cheaper with same food.

We’ve been at the Tokyo Hilton 3 times with our children. We choose the Hilton because of convienence. It’s one of the stops for the airport limousine bus. It’s decent considering the spaciousness of the hotel room and the on site amenities like pool and sauna. Location is decent and the hotel has a free shuttle that runs to shinjuku station. It’s be great if the hotel can offer 2 queen beds instead of 2 twin beds like other Hilton hotels. Once the kids get older 2 twin beds is definitely too tight for a family of four.

This hotel was in an easy location since near the train station. The rooms were very nice and clean. The staff was helpful and made dinner reservations for us. Our kids especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet.

Will sound unbelievable for most people but we decided to venture on a vacation to Japan at very last moment. While searching for great deals it was clear that this going to be an expensive trip, so we just said to ourselves why not make it a trip of lifetime, we are spending money anyway. A brief research on tripadvisor we figured out Shinjuku was the best bet to stay in Tokyo. We always like to stay at international chains because they generally dont go terribly wrong as their reputation is at stake. In many options I zeroed in on Hilton Tokyo and boy I was too damn right. Things were perfect as soon as we stepped into Hotel. A very friendly lady helped us out with our luggage and escorted us to checkin area. Again a very friend person at counter helped us he even accepted my request of higher floor. They helped us with luggage to our room. The rooms was very spacious and very well arranged. Beds were very comfortable, bathroom spanking clean, they had slippers, bath robes, all the amenities including shaving kit, toothbrushes, night gowns, and so on. Best yet, since we got the executive floor they have light snacks every evening and great breakfast in the morning. The breakfast host was amazingly friendly with bringing made to order omelette or coffee or orange juice at your table, talking and explaining things in a very friendly manner. I can go on and on, made our stay in Tokyo very pleasurable and indeed making it a trip of a lifetime.Location wise this Hotel is perfect, has subway line right below in basement Marunochi line which takes you to Tokyo and Shinjuku and E line. Or walk to Shinjuku station is like 10-12 mins.There are many restaurants in the basement.Thanks Japan and Thanks Hilton Tokyo.

Hilton Tokyo was a perfect location in Tokyo, it was the city center and the hotel staff spoke good English. Rooms were spacious and well maintained. Our room was on the 19th floor and it had great view of skyscrapers from the window. Bathrooms were super clean. Breakfast was great with something for all tastes. Shuttle service to Shinjuku station was free and punctual, several times a day so it was so easy to go for shopping and to other places in the city. For airport drop, Limousine coach was available to pick you up right outside the hotel so you can choose the time (and pay reasonable 3100 Yen / person). Overall, it was expensive but worth the price and an excellent choice to stay in the city of Tokyo.

We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights as part of a longer trip to China. The location is perfect for a quick trip and seeing some top sights in Tokyo. Everyone was very friendly and helpful which I appreciated greatly as this didn't occur at our other hotels. Our room was average but I liked the shower and toiletries. We also utilized the shuttle to Shinjuku station. This service was punctual and had AC. The breakfast had many options but wasn't anything spectacular. I would say the best item on the menu are the made to order omelettes.

After two stays here, and at other Hilton properties in Japan, the Hilton Tokyo is absolutely #1. The customer service is outstanding, the executive lounge is incredible, and the rooms are beautiful and immaculately clean. As almost every review will say, the location could not be better for access to the train station and walking the city. We have stayed here twice, once for business in September and a second time during Christmas. Both stays were consistently a best example of what a top notch Hilton experience can be. I’ve seen comments about the breakfast in the lounge not being sufficient for some people, but we were more than happy with omelettes made to order and the variety of both western and Japanese choices.

I have come to expect great things of non-US Hilton properties.Was largely unimpressed by this one.I happen to have diamond status, which one would think would engender a solid review. However, the rooms are outdated and the executive lounges lackluster. The service is fine but not particularly outstanding.The lobby IS impressive and fitting of a major city Hilton. And the traditional Japanese breakfast option for diamond guests is a nice touch.It should also be noted that this is in the business area of Shinjuku, as opposed to the entertainment section. Terrific if you are looking for space from the craziness.

We booked this stay through Luxury Escapes to start our 3 week holiday in Japan. It lived up to all that was promised in the package. The room was large and smartly appointed with a very comfortable king bed. Buffet breakfast had a great choice and beautifully presented. The hotel provides a free shuttle buss to and from the Shinjuku rail station/shops every 20 mins. Punctual and efficient. Really well positioned within walking distance to many points of interest.Friendly and professional in all respects.

I stayed at the Hilton Tokyo last month and was blown away by the awesome staff. I wasn't pleased with my first room and they were incredibly helpful and offered me an option of an upgrade at a reasonable cost for the following morning when the room was available. They moved my things to the next room, but I realized A FULL DAY after, that I left my diamond ring in the first room. I searched my room frantically and realized that it must've rolled off the side table when I took it off before bed. I rushed downstairs and spoke to the front desk and gave a description of my ring and low and behold, it was right there waiting for me. My faith in humanity restored! Hotel bars are typically cheesy, but there was an awesome jazz singer from Michigan that we really enjoyed watching perform. We always got great recommendations on restaurants and really, the location of Hilton Tokyo is as good as it gets! In fact, our plan was to spend 4 nights there and try a different part of Tokyo for the 5th and I regret that. THANK YOU, HILTON TOKYO!

Spent four nights here and was thoroughly impressed. As a Hilton Gold member I was upgraded to the Executive room on the same level as the lounge, which was very convenient. The lounge can get crowded however though we never had a problem getting a seat. We were also presented with three dining options: the lounge, the main restaurant in the lobby, and Japanese restaurant that must be booked in advance. We tried all three options and can say that options in the lounge is okay but limited. There is much more variety in the lobby restaurant but it can get crowded, and the Japanese breakfast was simply amazing (see photo). Definitely worth reserving.The rooms are large by Japanese standards but the bathroom feels very cramped. And the 40 inch television is somewhat unacceptably small for this caliber of hotel. Location-wise the hotel was perfect with limousine connections to both Haneda and Narita airports, and we used the free shuttle to Shinjuku regularly since there is not much to do around the hotel. The location was also a short walk to Keio Plaza Hotel as it has a JTB Sunrise Tour office and tours starting from Shinjuku start there.All our interactions with staff were very positive and their standard of English was very good. Overall, a very good stay.

Visited in May 2018 and we are already planning our second trip. This hotel has a great location. It’s walking distance to a ton of restaurants, sites, the subway, etc. And they have a free shuttle to and from the Keio department store, which is super easy and convenient! The room was clean and modern. Comfy bed, nice tv, great view, and high tech Japanese toilet! I had an awesome green tea martini at the bar by the lobby. The service was great as well - easy check in/out process at the front desk. They also helped us coordinate the shuttle to the airport. Our fave thing about the hotel is the 24/7 convenience store in the base. Extremely convenient and the snacks and drinks there are amazing!

We recently stayed at the Hilton Tokyo for 6 nights on our first visit to Japan. After scouring the internet for the possible best places to stay-based on location/subways, price point, connecting room (for our family of 4) we decided to stay at the Hilton. We try to stay at at more local/boutique style places usually, but given our first visit, significant jet lag and traveling with our 2 boys-ages 6 and 11 we couldn’t be happier with our choice.Pros- Very friendly staff (Japanese hospitality we encountered everywhere)Connecting rooms (not easy to find in Japan, especially at an affordable price)Very good executive lounge breakfast, with option to eat at their main buffet (which we did several times), which has even more choices. Great help from Concierge (we tend to be fairly independent travelers, but did appreciate their help with restaurant reservations, luggage transfer setup etc)Subway accessible through their underground tunnel (luckily we didn’t encounter much rain even though we went during the rainy season, but we used the underground tunnel consistently anyway)Most places to visit within a few subway stopsBeds in rooms probably the most comfortable of all the places we stayed in Japan and nice sized rooms for Japan ( we stayed in city suite executive connected to twin executive)Rooms were quiet and A/C worked very well (June in Japan tends to be hot and muggy)Very prompt room service-as the first couple days we were too jet lagged to go out for dinner (within 20-30min each time, healthy choices, and not ridiculously expensive)Cannot comment on their restaurants-as we did not eat at them, apart from the breakfast as mentioned aboveCons- really can’t say there were anyWe would stay and recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Tokyo!

We had a very pleasant stay at The Hilton Hotel at Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan. Their most impressive asset is in the excellent assistance from their staff. The gym and swimming pool areas are a bit small, and not as up to par as other Hilton properties we stayed at. Otherwise, food, service, room cleanliness, concierge,are all great

I used to always stay at the Keio Plaza Hotel opposite of Hilton so I decided to stay for 5 nights. I would definitely have to choose Hilton Tokyo from now on! Although Keio Plaza and Hilton Tokyo are near each other location wise. Hilton the best frequent shuttles that runs back and forth from the entrance of Shinjuku Station. This service made it so easy to travel conveniently and get food in Shinjuku as taxis are quite expensive. The service was also wonderful as we were offered an upgrade and provided us with help in ordering the airport shuttle. The room was very spacious, had a great view and the bed was so comfortable. Have been impressed and will definitely stay at the Hilton in Shinjuku every time I visit without a doubt!

What a good surprise ! As an American when we hear “Hilton” we think “meh” ,mainly because of their different sub brands , but abroad it’s a different story.This hotel is a solid 4 stars Check in was a breeze , Hilton status was in the system and they offered us a free upgrade to a executive room that included lounge access and free breakfast either at the lounge or at the main buffet .Hotel feels new , clean, love their shower pressure !Room has a decent size and is comfortable.Food was excellent both at the lounge and the breakfast buffet.Only negative is the elevators, it’s a busy hotel and sometimes you have to wait a long time for the elevator but no big deal really.I definitely recommend and would not hesitate to stay there again !

This was our second time staying at this property and again during peak tourist season. The hotel is very conveniently located with access to metro station via shuttle service, many restaurants, markets and shopping. While the property is somewhat dated, they do their best for outstanding service in the breakfast buffet, bar/lounge, and executive lounge. Tokyo is not an inexpensive city to visit or conduct business so one might think it's expensive for what you get. The Hilton offers a very good and wide range of services that are highly competitive with the market.

I only stayed here for one night but it was comfortable. The bathroom was small and deteriorating but the room was huge. All of the staff was friendly and everything was very clean. Nice views as well.

Tokyo was excellent and highlighted by my stay at Hilton Tokyo. It even started with at Hilton shuttle. The staff was professional and very courteous. The service and facility was five star. Location was prime for rail and shopping. We were given special benefits as diamond members and it was priceless.

I had lunch with my husband at Metropolitan Grill & headed to Zafta for drinks after. Looking at the menu I ordered a cocktail Sunday BBQ - From the photo it had a mini burger perched on top of glass rim. It looked interesting so I decided to order it mainly coz of this burger. However the staff said it was not possible to have this drink as it would take 30 Min to make the mini burger. Since it is not possible for customers to order this drink then why is it even on the menu ? It just reflects lack of professionalism & laziness on the part of staff. I would suggest to take this drink out of the menu if U do not wish to have customers disappointed.

The hotel is a great hotel, the facilities very good, but at a price. The only complaint I have is the food and drink is VERY expensive. A burger and fries at around €40, cheapest glass of wine €20... hmmm... Best approach is to use the hotel, the eat & drink out.

I have never been denied my Diamond status when my room is registered in my name but paid for by my company. The front desk stated that since it was a discounted corporate rate, my Diamond Status would not apply. I see no correlation as to the price of the room with my ability to use the amenities that my status is suppose to offer. I guess it doesn't matter how many nights you stay or how much money you have spent with Hilton lifetime. It is all about how much your room cost on your present stay. I am also a Platinum Marriott member and I can assure you they would never pull a stunt such as this.

It's a huge hotel so it can get busy but we loved our stay here. The staff are excellent and very proactive and always willing to please. The rooms are large with great views. It's very convenient with a shuttle bus to the train station and with a train station just below.This Hilton did not disappoint and I would choose this hotel again.

If you are staying in the Shinjuku area you have to stay at the Tokyo Hilton! This has been my 6th stay at the Hilton and I won’t stay anywhere else. It is like a home away from home. Very fine and luxurious with delicious food and many options for winding down after work. Rooms are excellent. Restaurants in lobby and on the second floor have all variety of foods. The Executive Lounge is also an option for light meals. Staff is top notch and always ready to serve. I can go on and on about this hotel. As far as transportation, the Airport Bus drops you off at the door. You can take a cab to Shijuku station or walk. Beautiful hotel! Beautiful city! Wonderful country!

Staying downtown is the key to this city. It’s safe and you are in the heart of the city. Great for taking tours. Great walk score to a varity of things. We did adjoining rooms for the kids to stay in and would stay here again

Stayed here two nights after a cruise. Excellent location - close to Shunjuku station (but not too close!) Drinks in the bar can be a little pricey but the atmosphere is nice. Room was clean, a nice size and the bed was very comfortable. The concierge staff was very helpful and friendly. Interesting and fun citylife is just a short walk from the hotel in the Shinjuku area. Couldn't recommend this hotel enough.

What a great hotel,last destination before heading home. Our stay here was so good after New York Hilton,the front desk staff were so accommodating nothing was problem. Our room was was very good and bathroom excellent good wifi in room and foyer,oooolocation is good with shops and station underneath the hotel. The amenities gym spa sauna and pool I believe there are tennis courts available all were spotless and staff in the reception area of above friendly and helpful . The only negative is there were seminars being held in hotel and on several occasions we could not get a lift as they were full so we had to go back to our rooms and wait 30 to 45 mins

This is an exceptionally well operated hotel and one of the best Hilton’s we’ve stayed in. My wife and I stayed in a Junior Suites for 4 nights in June and found it to be near faultless. We had a spacious tastefully decorated and furnished room with a super comfortable bed and excellent bathroom. The staff we met were all delightful and couldn’t be more helpful. There are some excellent restaurants, bars and coffee shops both inside the property and immediately below the hotel in the public areas. The hotel is in a convenient part of Shinjuku with close proximity to the subway and shopping. We’ll be back….

We spend 4 nights in this hotel. Location is good. Walking distance to Shinjuku station and all the shopping area of shinjuku. If you don't fancy the walk then there are 2 other option ..take the shuttle bus or the underground metro which is just few meters away from the hotel. The rooms are quite small but better than other Japan hotels. The staffs at tourist desk are quite helpful ..they even gave us a map and explained to us the mode of travel. Language in the hotel is not an issue. All can speak English and there are also quite a number of staffs from other countries and they speak well. It's little pricey but it's Hilton...

Great location in Tokyo, we loved the hotel for it's ease of basically everything.Staff were so lovely and helpful with everything we asked for, we received so much help with reservations for various things in Tokyo.Hotel is lovely and modern, simple rooms, nothing over the top but very sufficient for our needs and great value for Tokyo.Breakfast in the club lounge is great if you can get it included.We basically walked everywhere from the Hotel, if not walk a short taxi ride, it was a wonderful location from Shinjuku.Thank you Hilton Tokyo.

I’ve stayed at this hotel frequently when coming to Tokyo, and I have to commend them on a nearly flawless service standard and impeccable response to an issue we had. The newly renovated rooms have a bizarre shower / tub setup that creates lots of space for mold growth. Once I brought it to managements attention, they were quick to move us into a room without the new bathroom, solving our issue. One of the things I appreciate most is that the hotel’s GM really made me feel like he took our problem seriously and wanted to make it right. Often, hotel staff will respond with suspicion to guest complaints about room issues, but not this time. As per my previous experiences, food was excellent and the hotel was very clean. If you’re eligible, the exec lounge has some nice amenities but it gets VERY crowded, especially in the evenings or at breakfast. This is a great location if Shinjuku is a good home base.

Just spent 1 week in this great Hilton in Shinjuku.Surprising modern and spacious room. Great restaurants.Must get a club room with great club lounge benefits!I drive in Tokyo and found this one of the most convenient hotel in any city around the world for a driver accessible hotel. Great underground parking and reasonable prices as well.A pleasure to stay in for 1 week

If you are going to Tokyo definitely you need to stay here. I have been in Japan 3 times and I stayed here all 3. It has everything right there for you. Not only room, services and staff but also access to a convenience store and easy access to the subway

Due to change in Airbnb policies we had to find accommodations in Tokyo at the last minute. So glad we decided to stay at the Hilton Tokyo. We are Hilton Diamond members, we weren't given a room upgrade but room and facility far exceeded our expectations. The hotel concierge were all so helpful every day providing recommendations, maps and directions that helped us navigate our way around the city. The shuttle to the Shinjuku station was very convenient. Although we preferred to take the metro back to the local station which was connected to the hotel. The Executive lounge staff were so welcoming and attentive, there was a wide variety of Japanese and Western food. We ate breakfast at the executive lounge most of the days, we did eat at the hotel's restaurant breakfast buffet for 1 morning because our children wanted pancakes. Our family of 4 stayed in an executive king bedroom with roll away bed. We would definitely stay again if we return to Japan.

This is my top 10 favorite Hilton property I have been to and I will be back if I visit Tokyo. The friendly staffs especially executive lounge are the main reasons, they are always there for you whenever you need them. The hotel is centrally located in Shinjuku. It provides shuttle service to JR Shinjuku station although it is just a short 15 minutes walk away. Other 2 subway lines stations are connected via underground walkways as well. All these make you connected to anywhere in Tokyo easily. The airport limousine bus also make stop in front of hotel. There is a 24 hours convenience store down there in the Hilltop arcade which is our favorite place to get Japanese snack, drink and even souvenirs. Surprisingly the price is cheap compared to other stores. I am diamond member and has access to the executive lounge and this is my favorite place in the hotel as well. We can see Mt Fuji if weather is nice and we see it indeed. The food and drink option is excellent. However it could get really busy especially dinner time.

Highly recommend this hotel. We stayed (4 adults) for 4 nights. We are diamond members and were treated extremely well. The rooms are large, beds are very comfortable and the executive lounge is the best. Great breakfast every morning, alcoholic drinks delicious, and fantastic service. Will definitely stay here again.

We had two nights stay at Hilton Tokyo. The hotel has free shuttle bus running between Shinjuku station and the hotel every 30 minutes. The staff welcomes us very nicely and explained all the benefits we entitle. The room is extremely clean with great comfort. The executive lounge on 37 floor is gorgeous, we had our breakfast there and enjoyed the wonderful view. Staffs are very kind and always with kindness and patience for our request. I like this hotel a lot and will come back again to visit Tokyo.

Very nice clean, modern property. Extensive breakfast buffet. Excellent restaurants although on the pricey side. Friendly efficient staff.Shuttle bus to the Shinjuku train station runs every 15 minutes.

They have tunnel access to the subway Nishi Shinjuku. A short walk then we will find the subway easily. That is actually the reason why I chose this hotel during my stay in Tokyo. The room in my opinion is just ordinary just like other hotels. Although I did expect more than that.Their service and staffs hospitality are excellent. The breakfast menu offer a lot of varieties. As I need to depart early in the morning to Narita airport, I took their airport transfer bus. Reliable and surely punctual.

This is my 3rd stay at this hotel and it is always a pleasure to stay here. The rooms are great and the hotel warm and friendly. The staff are efficient and helpful and the food in the restaurants really really good. I highly recommend this hotel which is also in a great location. You must give it a try. The love music on the second floor bar was also really good.

The staff, from the doormen to the waiters, from reception to cleaning, are all exceptionally friendly and courteous. We were well taken care of. However, I will note this, make your reservations through the Hilton site if you wish to get any Hilton Honors credit or special consideration. Our room stay was booked through Travelocity. And, while we do not see anything to complain about regarding service, not getting credit for eight nights on our HH membership ( since 2009 ), was disappointing. Calling HH customer service doesn’t help as they can only quote policy.Our room was very comfortable and clean. We had a wonderful west side view of the city. The room amenities were excellent. There should be a “clean the room” sign for the door. Only a do not disturb and a breakfast room service menu were available.There are several choices within the hotel for meals. The Marble Lounge has the buffet meals for all three. Pricey. But then, you’re at the Hilton. This was a very pleasant stay. I recommend this to individuals as well as families. Tours of the city and day trips to Mt. Fuji can be arranged at the concierge desk within the main lobby where is always someone waiting to help you as a guest. Extremely clean and very elegant.Lots of food choices within walking distance as the hotel is very centrally located. A small park sits across the nearby intersection. Metro access from the shopping area below the hotel in the basement can keep you dry during a rainy day. There is also a 24/7 convenience store there too. Shopping area is accessed via stairs between Marbles and lobby doors.

Our family 5 (mom & dad and 3 adult children) had the opportunity to stay at the Executive Level of the Tokyo Hilton and found every aspect of this hotel - from the rooms to the food to the service - to be outstanding. The hotel was conveniently located in the heart of Shinjuku and offered a free bus to Shinjuku station - the perfect location from which to explore Tokyo. Of special note was the service provided by the staff of the executive lounge, especially the Brasilian gentleman (sorry, I lost his name!) was amazing in offering advise on things to do and see. Following his excellent advice, the concierge staff was fantastic making sure that we had the reservations and directions to accomplish our goals. All-in-all, we couldn't have been happier with our Tokyo Hilton stay.

Very good Hilton property with a dedicated lounge for Diamond members, all staff are very friendly and service minded, complimentary shuttle bus 3 times an hour to nearby Shinjuku station access to the underground from inside the hotel (long wealk in tunnels to reach the station though)

Truely wonderful stay. Every day was a wonderful experience. Staff attentive. Very clean. Shuttle to subway station every 20 minutes for most travel times. Nice views. We traveled as a Make a Wish family. Thanks to Hilton and anyone who donated points or donated to Make a Wish to make our sons dream come true!

It is a well kept standard Hilton hotels chain; Strategically located at Shinjuku with the shuttle facilities to station as well. Staffs speak English well and are very attentive to our needs, however the hotel is overcrowded since the second we arrived until we left, making us don’t wanna stay in hotel area (except our room) for too long. Because of this, some staff are in rush in answering questions as well (but they still serve everyone though).Room wise is comfortable and spacious enough compare to Tokyo’s usual standard. Good view of Shinjuku skyscrapers from the window. Bathroom is very tiny and quite disappointing though.Shuttle to and from Shinjuku Station is useful, but it’s quite challenge alone to find the correct bus stop at the enormous Shinjuku Station. Would recommend other guests to take the bus ride from hotel first to learn where exactly the stop is. One last thing is: before our arrival, we had an enquiry and tried to reach the hotel via phone-call. We called internationally, in hoping to receive a solution but the staff barely understand English at all so we got nothing done during the 10 mins expensive call.But again then , when we arrived in here, we later learned that all staffs speak English perfectly. So that make us wonder though, why can’t you assist us well at that time like you serve at the hotel directly (in terms of communicating)? really disappointed about that

Located in the Shinjuku area - a neighborhood full of business and government buildings - this hotel is business oriented. I was there for a conference and liked it well enough but it’s not going to win any awards for excitement. Although the 4 or 5 restaurants are expensive they offer a good variety. The elevators will drive you crazy because they are slow and always full like sardines. I went to the bar area for a beer one night and paid nearly 15$ for a craft beer so I never went back but I hear pricey beer in Japan is not unusual.

I’ve always enjoyed my stays at Hiltons and the one at Shinjuku lived up to past experiences. The room was actually quite well spaced although the bathroom was quite tiny by comparison. The room felt that it had a recent renovation although the tiny bathroom looked like it only got a facelift.It was an extremely comfortable room though, quiet and the beds were certainly some of the best that we’ve slept in. The views were also pretty cool, ours overlooked the park and the concrete jungle of Shinjuku.The hotel is actually walking distance to Shinjuku Station. Although they had a shuttle service, we never really found the need to use it. All in all, a very nice stay.

I have gone to Japan twice a year for the past 5 years - once for business and once with family on vacation - and always stay at the Hilton Shinjuku. The service is outstanding, everyone super friendly, the breakfast amazing, and location perfect.

Our stay at this hotel was awesome. The hotel is modern and our room was spacious and clean. The bed was more comfortable than I anticipated. The staff was always helpful and courteous. We loved the breakfast in the Executive lounge - a vast variety of food options, including an omelet bar. If we return we will definitely stay at this locat again.

Left Kyoto and road Bullet train in Tokyo and transfer by tram to hotel. Walked right up into Lobby. Nice location and close to the hot spots. 15 to 20 min walk to all the great shops and noodle shops. Service and attention you get here is first class, gave us room upgrades at check-in. Misplaced my wife's phone and had several staff looking for it.Breakfast is mainly western style, great selection and fresh.

After our stay in 2012 we were so looking forward to our return visit in May for two nights before our cruise sailing out from Yokohama. We were rushing to a dinner appointment on our arrival so we just dropped our luggage with the hotel as soon as we arrived on the airport limousine and went off on the hotel shuttle. Check-in was done after we came back from dinner. Unfortunately, we were not able to get any kind of upgrades as HH Gold members. Not to the lounge level, no lounge access, not even drink coupons provided as last time but just a small box of chocolate to compensate. Our room remained a regular room and we had to pay $60 extra per night for the third person which did not happen last time when they put us in a junior suite with the extra bed. Hmmm.....Seems like the benefits for HH are declining here. Maybe they are more in favor of their tour groups now since the breakfast buffet was VERY crowded in the morning.

We stayed at the Hilton Tokyo for seven nights in April (in a executive king room) and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Its' a large and busy hotel, which can sometimes make you feel like just another guest / number but the staff were very friendly. The hotel is the business district of Shinjuku, it was a quiet area in comparison to other areas of Shinjuku. The room was spacious for Tokyo standards, clean, and with a lovely view over the business district of Shinjuku. The bathroom was a little odd, and the basin area was small with very little storage, but still functional. Housekeeping did an exceptional job each day.There were great food options at the executive lounge, but it did close a little earlier than we would have liked. It was always busy so I would suggest getting in early. The location was great, there is a train station directly underneath the hotel which was convenient and easy to get around. We used the shuttle service to Shinjuku station on a couple of occasions but the station is so huge, we felt less overwhelmed (and easier to find our way) by accessing the station below the hotel. Overall we had a wonderful stay and the service was very good.

Super awesome hotel. Love the Executive Lounge. Staff is pretty cool. The hotel is very close to the Shijunku station. There are a ton of things to do around the hotel. .. great restaurants nearby. Metro is less than 5 minutes away.

One week is definitely not enough in Tokyo, let alone the Hilton. The staff really make this hotel. Everyone is extremely friendly and attentive. The room was perfect, and we had access to the executive lounge which offers a good selection of drinks and bites. A great place to chill before going out. Hilton will be seeing us again!

This is the second time we have stayed here and we still think it was the best place to stay in Tokyo. It is very convenient to the Shinjuku rail station and all parts of Tokyo. We tried a massage this time. It was very good and reasonably priced. The spa/workout facility also has a hot tub, cold pool and hot sauna. Very nice. The kids liked swimming in the indoor pool. The workout equipment was very good and plentiful. We also had the buffet breakfast everyday which has Japanese and American style food. The buffet at night has mostly American food. It is expensive but convenient.

The family stayed at Hilton Tokyo for 2 nights on 13th April and it was an excellent experience.Coming back from Lake Kawaguchiko via Highway bus, we arrived directly at Shinjuku station and it was very convenient to take the black Hilton complimentary shuttle bus straight to Hilton Tokyo.I would like to thank Anastasia (reservations) and Rai (front desk) for delivering an excellent booking and check in process. As a Hilton Diamond member, we were upgraded nicely to a Suite (approx. 60 sqm) which is relatively larger than most other hotels in Tokyo, and this is considering that the hotel was literally fully packed. We were very appreciative of this.The room was clean and had nice views of the Shinjuku CBD. The Executive lounge was separated into two sections (facing two sides of the hotel) , spacious and contained a nice array of snacks/drinks.The Breakfast at Hilton Tokyo was absolutely fantastic. We went to Junisoh for a 3 course Japanese style on the first morning (must pre-book). Food was stylishly prepared, very delicious and contained a balanced mixture of rice, vege, meat, fish and miso soup. The second morning we went for the buffet and again, there were an excellent variety of food to choose from.We also enjoyed two drinks served on the house and was kindly allowed to bring them back to our room. Overall, a very nice hotel, centrally located in Shinjuku, with warm polite staff and excellent food.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights , the hotel is conveniently located 15 mins away from central Shinjuku and faced a beautiful park. The rooms had been renovated and most of the friendly staff speak good English , service was usually attentive and warm. The hotel provided a frequent shuttle service to the Shinjuku station , which was most convenient. The executive lounge on the 37th floor had a panoramic view of the surrounding city and park , it was highly popular with HH members. Overall , it was a great stay and we will return in the future!

A well managed and functional hotel with shuttle service to Shinjuku station.Nice lounge with stunning views and tasty food.Good breakfast and cozy pub (with a smoking section).Staff very proffesional and friendly.

The title of this review says it all. The Hilton Tokyo is indeed our second hotel in Japan and we never have to look elsewhere when we are visiting Tokyo. This hotel has an excellent service culture which makes it so different! The service culture runs deep ... straight down from the general manager to the concierge team who are probably the first people you will encounter during your visit. Everybody is ready to help, offer advice and it always comes with a smile. :-)We have thoroughly enjoyed ourselves in your hotel and the excellent customer oriented service approach will always exceed your expectations.I am truly inspired by the experiences we had at the Hilton Tokyo and always look forward to our next visit! :-)Keep it up! You are already the best!

Stayed here for 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay. The room was large, modern and very comfortable. Some of the quietest AC ever in a room!! The breakfast was outstanding. Nice park across the street to enjoy a nice walk and the metro is just steps away.

We stayed 5 nights here and it was quite enjoyable The hotel is what you would expect from Hilton and the staff are excellent The shuttle to the railway station and shopping centre is a bonusWe had a good time and it is easy to get to anything by the underground which is very close

A huge hotel, well they all are there.This one had 37 floors.We had a room on the 35 .Lifts very quick to get you to your room.Very large comfortable room .Large bed ,tea & coffe in rooms’&hairdryerGreat breakfast, every thing you could want.Staff fantastic , so very helpful all the time.Not to far from all the goings on down townIt was excellent,I loved my stay here.A most wonderful experience for my trip to Tokyo.

The good things: great location in a clean environment, shuttle bus to take you to the main Shinjuku train station, attentive staff, fantastic buffet breakfast, subway located directly underneath the Hotel. The average things: beds were a little hard (I know the Japanese prefer hard beads but there needs to be a laytex overlay which can be used for foreigners who prefer softer beds), the concierge needs to be a little more helpful and not just give out the standard recommendations. The Hotel restaurants are ridiculously expensive. Three very average cappuccinos cost me approx $AUD55 in the coffee lounge. what a waste of money and don't make this mistake.... Overall though a very pleasant hotel to stay at.

We really enjoyed our stay at this Hilton hotel. It is in a very beautiful neighborhood with many convenient and close subway and bus connections. It was very easy to get to whatever we wanted to see. This includes the shuttle bus to/from Shinjuku station...although it’s not a very long walk. The close by subway stations took us everywhere very smoothly. Once you figure out the subway system, it’s a breeze. People at the hotel will cheerfully help you in Excellent English.It’s true what others have said...that the lobby/reception area is a busy and hectic place. But the service was always thoughtful, efficient, and superb.We had a room on the executive floor. The service in the executive lounge was outstanding. The staff was extremely kind and helpful. The breakfasts there were excellent. The staff was so helpful at breakfast. Eggs and omelettes cooked to order. We enjoyed the time we got to relax in this lounge. The set up here was friendly and relaxing. We also had a great view of Mt. Fuji from the executive lounge. What a precious view at breakfast!!Our room was beautiful and it excellent condition with a great view of Tokyo. Bedding was very comfortable and the towels were super. Also excellent shower.We ate at 3 of the restaurants...all excellent food and service. We especially liked the buffet which included so many choices each done so well. Also the Chinese restaurant was excellent and we loved the Peking Duck served by the chef at the table. My highest praise is for the ENTIRE staff and Management at every level. Despite this being a large and busy hotel, the service was extremely personalized, helpful, and attentive. We were entirely pleased and wouldn’t hesitate to return. They do a great job handling a large number of people with such care and expertise.

I stayed 7 nights in Hilton Tokyo during my vacation on February 2018. I booked corner king tower executive suite and the setup was amazing. The executive lounge breakfast was crowded and I did not really enjoyed it. But since I am in Tokyo then i spent all my time dining on Tokyo amazing restaurants. Nishishinjuku station entrance located in basement floor. Overall it was an amazing stay and looking forward my next visit.
