We stayed for 5 nights in April. It was our first time visiting Japan, and we were a little nervous not knowing what to expect! The Hilton Tokyo was perfect for us. The location was convenient, with stations within a short walking distance. The rooms were clean and comfortable; breakfast each morning offered a wide variety of delicious foods - best hotel breakfast we had in Japan; and the staff were always friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend staying here, and wouldn't hesitate to return if we're lucky enough to travel to Japan again.

We spent 3 nights in the hotel. It was very clean and rooms were nice. Here is a warning; the food is very expensive, however if you go down below the hotel or outside, there are many reasonably priced places to eat.

We stayed at the Hilton Tokyo in late April. We were upgraded to a junior suite and we had access to the Executive Lounge using Hilton Honors membership. The room was lovely and more than fit our needs. The window on the bathroom is odd, with the blinds in the bedroom, not the bathroom, but we just kept them closed. Breakfast in the Lounge each morning was great. There was a wide variety of western and eastern food and drinks, and we left satisfied each day. Cocktail hour in the afternoon was busy, but we always found a seat to enjoy champagne. Service in the restaurants and bar downstairs was good and we enjoyed our meal and drinks. Check-in went swiftly and any questions asked during our stay were answered easily. The shuttle to Shinjuki Station was great, but finding the shuttle stop when we arrived the first night was a challenge that we gave up on and ended up walking to the hotel. The directions to find the shuttle station should be updated to be more clear that it is on an upper road level and on the side of the shopping center. An added map would make it even more clear. Once we knew where it was, we had no trouble using the shuttle each day. When we are back in Tokyo, we'll certainly stay at the Hilton again.

Executive suites are truly perfect.lovely staff always friendly well trained!Lovely stay. very easy to access local shops and train station is under the hotel! taxis right outside when you need them bus stops in vision!Men Only sauna and showersfemale only sauna and showers.Food offered at breakfast is brilliant for a Hilton!Highly recommended. I will be booking again (again I went in 2015, does not allow me to choose option)

Not knowing what to expect, I chose to stay at the Hilton hoping the staff could speak English, most staff can. So that's a relief. It is 10 minutes walk to shopping area with lots of eatery around the hotels vicinity too. Check in was smooth and their check out was also pleasant. They will assist you with the luggage and transportation. However I feel the concierge needs to be more friendly or helpful with directions or recommendation and not assume Asian people know everything about Japan more than westerners. Not all Asian country speaks Japanese and by telling me there... Where is THERE? It's my 1st hour arriving in this foreign soil. Hotel is very large with swimming pool and tennis court. Lobby area and Breakfast lounge can be very crowded but NOT chaotic at times. The Hilton Shinjuku is a safe bet to stay in for first timer in Tokyo. It has a hotel bus which stops at the hotel from Narita, so forget about the complicated train ride and just take the bus.

We loved our stay here. It was luxurious accommodations and most importantly convenient location to the trains and subways. They also offered a complimentary shuttle to and from Shinjuku Station which added to the experience. The concierge was very helpful as was the front desk. English speaking staff. The authentic Japanese food on site was some of the best we had on our trip. Highly recommend!

If you are looking for class service and friendly staff, this is the place. Location is great. Worth every penny. You can get to the subway from the hotel and from there to Tokyo and surrounding. Helpful concierge.

The Tokyo Hilton is in Shinjuku, about 15 walk to the station or a 5-10 min complimentary shuttle bus ride.We caught the Airport Limousine directly from Haneda to the hotel. As Hilton members we were afforded an early check in (a reason to join). The room was large, clean, quiet and very comfortable. The sleep quality of the bed and room was magnificent. Check in and check out was efficient.The hotel is within easy walking distance of Shinjuku station, though it does take 15min. There is street level and then there is the pedestrian subway, which we mostly used as it was still quite cold. The complimentary shuttle is very convenient, but doesn't start early. The location in Shinjuku is magnificent.We did not try the hotel's dining options, but given the location that simply wasn't necessary.This is a highly recommended hotel.

An upscale hotel in Shinjuku neighborhood. Spacious and comfortable rooms, helpful staff. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel and hope to come back someday. Close to Shinjuku station (10 min walk) or take hotel shuttle.

It's Hilton, so it could not be too far off from your expectation. That said, I must commit that there was no big surprise too - or am I spoiled by the brand Hilton?The room is nice and neat, though a little bit small (this is expected in Tokyo right?). Reception staff was very very polite and nice, and allow us to checked in earlier since we had an early flight.We arrived late November so could see the X'mas lighting as well - which is beautiful but not stunning. Hotel location is great though, it's just walking distance to stations/shopping malls.I will still choose Hilton next time I visit Tokyo

Fabulous stay at Hilton Tokyo. Executive lounge made even more amazing by Waki for the breakfast serve. Very attentive and went beyond to make my stay of such a high standard with his welcome at the lounge. Evening staff were also very friendly. Too marks

Have stayed at this Hilton many times. Convenient to our office. Nice rooms that are small but very functional. The problem with is hotel is that it is super crowded. I suspect there is not enough Hilton’s in Tokyo so I’ve always found this hotel to be very busy.Don’t expect a nice relaxing breakfast before a busy day in the office. Breakfast is chaotic. Expect to line up to get in.... and then to line up for the toaster or any other part of the breakfast offering. Certainly not a calming experience. All the common areas including the lifts are like this. Perhaps a victim of its own success as it’s occupancy rates are obviously very high.

Just a Hilton, so never disappointing.Rooms are ok, and most are freshly refurbished.Locationwise is great for being a tourist: 2 underground stations connected directly with the hotel can easily take you to any Tokyo neighborhood.Breakfast is absolutely impressive: way above average! Great food, very fresh. Recommended!

Stayed Hilton Tokyo in May 2018 for 10 days. This is my “go to” hotel in Tokyo. Easy access to subway, JR, Odakyu, Keio trains make it very convenient for business meetings. Good restaurants, and shops are nearby. Yet just away enough from noisy Shinjuku neighborhood. I have noticed that more snack/food options at the Executive Lounge throughout the day/evening. The shuttle bus between the hotel and Shinjuku station is new also. Less seats to sit down, but more space for luggage, and lower body for easier access. As always, the lounge staff was extremely helpful for dinner reservation, etc. Housekeeping staff did great job to keep the room clean also. Another great stay at Hilton Tokyo.

Breakfast and check in were overwhelming and quite full on. Busy and chaotic. However the staff were friendly. They tried to give us a queen room even though we had booked and paid for a king. But once this was resolved, everything went really well. The bed was comfy, the room spacious, and the hotel clean and well located.

A very good hotel with excellent sized rooms. A good choice of restaurants and bars on site. It’s not particularly convenient for the subway / train station but the hotel does offer a free shuttle bus every 20 minutes that takes 10 mins to get to Shinjuku Station.

My husband and I spent a full week at this Hilton. We are diamond members so we were given free breakfast every day. Let me say that their buffet breakfast is awesome! Everything was fresh and delicious. The gym is also good and the rooms are clean. Not very spacious, but that is the norm in any big city. The toilets are awesome! They are heated and have spraying apparatuses to clean you. Another great thing about the hotel is its location. We were able to take the metro most places. Don't hesitate to book this hotel if staying in Tokyo.

Last time we were in Tokyo we stayed at the Tokyo Station Hotel right in the heart of Maranouchi CBD. So we were a little apprehensive about heading out to the western side and quieter side of Shinjuku.. need not have worried. There's an easy ten minute walk into Shinjuku and the hotel as three shuttle buses each hour running in an out.We opted for a Junior suite (an inexpensive add on to an Executive room... plenty of room but with limited views it being on the 10th of a 38 storey hotel. Views from the Club floor (37) were great with even glimpses of the distant Mt Fuji in the late afternoons.Room facilities were good without being knockout. Despite the suite having plenty of room the bathroom set up was strange with the glass door to the bath/shower area swinging back and compromising space in the remainder of the bathroom/toilet. The Club staff were pleasant and efficient, a wide choice of drinks available between the 6.00 and 8.00pm (precisely!!!) period. Food choices were limited (three hot dishes) and some cheeses mainly.One tip... we discovered that the Nishi Shinjuku station is just a few hundred metres away (above or below ground) and that it is much more convenient that using the massive station at Shinkuku itself. We came in from a cruise... you will find that the taxi fare from the port is about Y7000.The Tokyo HIlton is a quality hotel and don't hesitate to use it.

We stayed here four nights. Breakfast buffet is to die for....unbelievable! Evening buffet just ok in our opinion. Room was quiet and clean, carpet is tired. The location is perfect, its literally less than 30 minuets by cab to any tourist site in the city. Now, if trains are your preference you are a 10 minute walk to the station. Staff were very helpful. However the hidden gem is the steakhouse on the second floor. We couldn’t take a second night at the evening buffet so we by chance drifted up to the second floor and started chatting with Niko the chef at the Steakhouse. He sold us on trying the steak that is cooked on a wooden plank. OMG, it ain’t cheap but it’s the best steak my wife and I have ever eaten. We returned two more times and tried trout and the veggie burger...all the food was excellent! We would highly recommend it. Overall this hotel is a Rolodex keeper....

Hilton TokyoPros: Reservations was very helpful Had free shuttle pick-upConcierge assisted with luggage deliveryCons: We spoke to the Front desk advising that we have reserved the higher floor from our App. Upon check-in, she requested for a picture (I have taken note to be careful now and take a picture). Without a picture she put us in room 1013 (13 is considered bad in Japanese) and she told us that it was Park View but it was facing some ugly building. The standard room was also small - there was only me and my young son. I have always enjoyed staying at the Hilton. But Hilton Tokyo is a Far Cry from Hilton Odaiba where we got the room we selected on the App.

We were upgraded on arrival to a junior suite which was more spacious and provided us access to the Executive Lounge which I felt was worthwhile. Excellent breakfast buffet selection. This hotel offered an excellent base for us to explore Tokyo. It offers a free shuttle to the nearby Shinjuku station (lots of shops and restaurants) and the Tokyo metro is easily accessible if you prefer to walk. I would definitely return....

We arrived at the hotel after the long flight from Los Angeles, and the check in went smoothly. As a diamond member of Hilton, they upgraded us to a junior suite but they were sold out of those suites so offered a paid upgrade to the next sized (full) suite. i found the up sale pitch odd for a diamond member but chose to pay the extra money. The suite was spacious and lovely and was a good choice. We found the bathroom to be large, and the shower a bit odd (Essentially a large wet room) but quite efficient. The decor was lovely. For the club floor, it was large and the staff efficient The fare was excellent for breakfast. There was an omelet station with any egg dish you want, some Japanese options, wonderful fresh juice, a coffee machine with the usual options, fruit, breads and water. They also offer the option of a traditional bento box Japanese breakfast on the 2nd floor, with reservations required. The meal was unique, lovely, and worth the visit. There are 3 seatings a day at 8, 9 and 10 am. For evening appetizers, the fare was not novel but adequate. The alcohol choices were abundant, none close to top shelf. But this is a club floor and the room was crowded each evening (packed) with no tables left within 30 minutes of opening. The staff did do all in their power to seat people and serve them. The staff was mixed in their attitude, with some incredibly friendly and welcoming and others tolerant of foreigners at best. Compared to the Conrad hotels in Bangkok and Hong Kong it was a step down. But compared to most Hiltons it was a step up. Overall, it added an excellent element to the stay. The location of this hotel is wonderful, close to the subway and much of the city action.There are multiple restaurants one serving a massive breakfast buffet. Music at the 2nd floor bar was lovely, with drinks poured not an iota over an ounce. For the price, the pour was stingy. The atmosphere was lovely. The health club is awesome with a great jacuzzi and steam in the locker room. The staff there was phenomenal. Finally, the concierge staff pre check in was top notch. They were both helpful and responsive and should be commended. Overall I was impressed with this property. I would stay there again.

We had a wonderful 12 nights stay in Hilton Tokyo. The location is very convenience to get to different parts of the city by subways. The breakfast in the executive lounge and downstairs has plenty of selection and delicious. The evening reception in the lounge is a must do if you can get access to it. We highly recommend this Hilton.

Great Location in Tokyo. The executive lounge has great views of the city and a great selection of food and beverages. The rooms were just above average, not great, but nothing to complain about. When you are in Tokyo... you are not in the room that often anyway! We will stay there again on our next visit to Tokyo.

A big modern hotel near the crowded and fun Shinjuku center (you can walk to the train station and many shops in about fifteen minutes, all through covered and underground passages). The rooms are comfortable, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the location is good. If there is a drawback, it is that the restaurants and general hotel prices are high (but not higher than similar hotels in the area).

We chose the Hilton Tokyo for the first leg of our three week journey. We could not have chosen a better hotel and I wish I could pack it in my bag and take it with us. The hotel is along the Airport Limo route which makes it an easy transition from any airport. They have a separate executive lounge area where you can check in instead of having to stand in line at the desk. We arrived very early in the morning and were able to get checked into our room right away. The staff was super friendly the entire time we were in the lounge and made sure we were comfortable while we waited.We had an executive tower suite and the room was gorgeous. The view from the 35th floor is perfect and I would suggest requesting a high floor when possible. The bed is super comfortable and the bathroom is quite fancy. The Toto toilet took a little getting used to, but now I want one in our house back in the states. My only complaint would be the lights in the bathroom are all on one switch, which means if you go to the bathroom in the dark, there isn’t a way to do so without turning on all the lights.our favorite part of our room was the view we got of Mt. Fuji a few times during our stay.The executive lounge takes up most of the 37th floor and is quite comfortable. There is also a separate lounge they open for elite members during the cocktail hours. The staff is super friendly, they all speak English and are able to guide you about local attractions and food options. The spreads at each of the events we went to was tasty, fresh and well prepared. We took advantage of the shuttle to the train station a couple of times and it made for an easy journey any time that we wanted to explore Tokyo. Overall, great hotel. You won’t regret staying here.

Stayed 5 nights at Hilton Tokyo, April 2018. Have to say it met all of our expectations of the Hilton name...from check in to checkout, also the staffs were very courteous and professional. We had a deluxe double with 2 twin beds, and we also added a roll away bed that’s the size of a twin bed in the room. With 3 beds in the room, there was still a lot of space to allow us to move around comfortably and with our luggage spread out. The decor of the room is very classic yet modern, and of course with Japanese theme. We had breakfast at the hotel, and they have a very nice varieties of western and asian food selections.The location of the hotel is a little more than 5 minutes walk from the nearest metro station. One can walk to Shinjuku station in 15-20 minutes. There’s also direct bus service to the airport from the hotel.

As a long time Diamond member I have to say this hotel truly knows how to recognize and treat Diamond members. The hotel has the best trained staff of any Hilton I have been to. The bed was so comfortable I want to buy the same mattress when I get home. The food and service was excellent. The location is convenient to two subway stations and the main train station.

Arrived at this spectacular hotel jet lagged having travelled for 18 hours from the UK. Found this hotel to be a joy and a feast for the eyes. We stayed there for two nights prior to our Japanese cruise. Our room was on the 36th floor which gave us a spectacular view all around the Shinjuku area. This hotel is ideally placed for walking access to Shinjuku rail station and the memorable area all around. Restaurants was on the first floor and offered a wide range for all palates.

I had stayed in Hilton Tokyo Nishi Shinjuku during my recent trip to Japan. I am writing this review in all sincerity and based on my personal experience. Since I don’t have much time writing, I will break my points into three aspect. I hope that someone planning to visit this part of the world will find it informative when deciding on the choice of hotel. First and foremost is the location, the hotel is rightly located at the major hub of Tokyo and 5-10min walk to one of the major Metro line. Truly, if you are looking for convenience and plan to get around as often as possible, you must stay at this hotel because of its great proximity. They have a shuttle bus to the station, but I recommend that you walk especially if you are visiting for the first time. I find it very interesting to walk around. Also the city is very safe, and general Japanese people are nice in case you ever get lost. Secondly, the service, without a doubt I will give the hotel 5* star plus plus for an exceptional service. I mean how else can someone have a memorable stay in a busy city without choosing the right place to stay?! I have stayed in many luxury hotels and I can tell you that the service at Hilton Tokyo is top notch. The staffs are very helpful, they always go out of their way to assist immediately. Whenever, I call the room service for something to be deliver to my room, I receive knock on my door literally within 2-5minutes. Also, the check-in & check-out process is spot on. I have strong opinion that the front office is the first impression of any hotel, and Hilton Tokyo nailed it. No long queue (despite the fact that it’s a busy hotel), all the staffs speak fluent English, and the employees are very welcoming. Oh, I must comment on their overall uniform, its very presentable, suitable color for each departments and the staffs are well dressed ( e.g, I have noticed that the female staff have nice clean nails).I must also applaud the concierge team, I don’t want to mention names here because it will not be fair to others as I believe they all work similarly. Seriously these guys/ladies are very knowledgeable about directions around the city and beyond. They can also assist you to plan your stay, where to visit around the city and outside etc. Believe it or not, they provide accurate direction and information that any help desk around the Metro stations. Moving forward, the food and beverage department. Please bear in mind that when I mentioned F&B, I am referring to all the departments within in general, that is, the restaurants, executive lounge, bars and breakfast. Let start with the breakfast, Wow! what a great selections of food, from healthy meal to Japanese, and western cuisines. Their breakfast is tailored to everyone from all walk of life, they also have several life cooking stations, 100% Freshly squeezes juices (I love the kale), infusion water, soya milk for people with diary allergy and name it all, you will certain find it there. If you like to experience Japanese cuisine exclusively for your breakfast, you can reserve a table before 9pm (please find out the eligibility). I love Zatta bar most especially because its very contemporary and the great selections of music entertainment. I love the fact that they switch different singers at least twice a week. The ambience is also very nice, and never overcrowded because of the space and design. The staffs are excellent and very professional. Florian is a great host and asset to the Bar (I think is very relaxing and home feel when one can chat with the staffs at any bar while sipping drink). The Executive lounge is another great part of the hotel because it’s very relaxing, very exclusive and don’t forget to carry your camera with you, you might be lucky to capture the view of majesty Mt. Fuji from there, and intact the overall city view. You can be rest assured that Waki will always keep you entertained while at lounge (amazing host)Finally, they have great numbers of restaurants to dine and wine (make sure to book ahead or immediately you arrive at the hotel because it’s always busy). I love the overall designs of the restaurants; very exquisite.

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Well pleased with the accommodation and the Breakfasts. Remarkably this hotel sells the Tourist Subway Tickets (well worth buying as they give very cheap travel) without any mark ujp in price.The hotel is reasonably close to the large shopping area Shinjuku and has a subway station very close.

We stayed at Hilton Tokyo for 3 nights and it was good stay. Checkin and checkin out Wes smooth. The location of the hotel is good in walking distance to Shinjuku area which has plenty of shops and restaurants. The room was nice with a great city view. Bathroom also nice. This hotel is what we expected from Hilton standard.

Took my annual trip to Tokyo from 27 Apr to 1 May. Was met by Sasaki-san who checked me in. She was cheerful and friendly and this was refreshing after traveling for more than 12 hours to Tokyo.Special thanks to Concierge Nakamura-san for his initiative & assistance in reserving bus tickets for my trips to Taisekiji near Mt Fuji.My appreciation to the executive lounge team for their attentiveness and services, especially Waki-san who took the trouble to pre-heat my lemon in the microwave oven so that I get more juice out if it. I have learnt something new from him :-)The only downside was that I could not get a room equipped with a TV that has a HDMI connection. I was told that the hotel was under renovation and all rooms should have type of TV soon. Was offered one but it was a non-smoking room so I chose smoking over the TV :-)Overall, it was a pleasure staying in Hilton Tokyo and I am looking forward to my next trip in 2019. There is also a metro station (Nishi-Shinjuku) at the basement and this is so convenient to get around.RegardsLee (551587016)

We spent three nights at the Hilton before going on a cruise around Japan. Everything was excellent especially the breakfast buffet which had a huge selection on food items. The rooms were large and very clean and comfortable.The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is close to a train station so you are able to visit lots of different places. We would certainly recommend the Hilton as a great place to stay if you are visiting Tokyo.

Had 5 nights at the Hilton Tokyo, and what a experience. The hotel was large, clean and easy to navigate. The rooms were large compared to some other hotels that I checked out online. Bed was a delight, could not get over the heated toilet seat. Staff were friendly, helpful and willing to assist in any way they could. Breakfast was included in our deal and would suit all tastes, the variety of food was excellent. Located in a good area, close to shops and restaurants, with a number of shops below the hotel. A shuttle service from the hotel to Shinjuku station and return was provided.

I have been travelling to Japan for business over the last 2 years and have used the Hilton Tokyo in Shinjuku my base of operations during my visits. I visit many factories throughout Japan during the week and return to Tokyo each weekend. Words do not do justice to the way I am treated each time I arrive! I am a Diamond Member but they treat me more like family! After a week on the road a

I had booked 2 executive level rooms for my mother ( her first visit to Japan) and my self from 19th to 25th AprilDespite arriving at 1130 am from the Hilton Tokyo Bay, the lounge staff advised that 1 room was ready so we had our bags delivered there before exploring the Shinjuku Goyen park ( beautiful azaleas ) and returning in mid afternoon for afternoon tea and collecting the 2nd room key. The rooms were large, well appointed with good a/c , a large bath and separate shower in a wet room, good coffee and very quiet despite my room being across the hall from the elevator lobby.We found the lounge to be excellent as we came back to the hotel every afternoon around 3pm for afternoon tea as my mother began to feel tired after a long morning of sightseeing then we relaxed and had evening snacks before going out again in the evening to see some of the tokyo neon lights in Shinjuku and Shibuya as well as tokyo towerThe lounge offered excellent breakfast with made to order omelets and a fresh orange juice machine, a large variety of afternoon snacks and cakes and a large range of drinks and snacks in the evening. The lounge offers good views over shinjuku but it was too hazy to see Mt Fuji on this trip The staff were excellent and friendly, remembering us as we came back,keeping the food and drinks stocked up and clearing the tables quickly despite the lounge being busy. We were able to get a seat quickly in the evening despite the lounge being busy and one night the lounge staff invited us to use another lounge ( in a suite down the corridor due to the volume of guests that evening)The lounge opening at 6am was greatly appreciated on our departure day as we were able to get a quick drink and snack before getting the limousine bus to Narita airport ( Y3100 and around 2hours allowing for picking up at other hotels.The fitness centre and swimming pool were excellent with friendly and welcoming staff.The hiltopia shopping arcade at lower level of the hotel is very good with a good convenience store ( where we also got some bandaids for my mother)The location is excellent being 5 mins walk from the tokyo metropolitan government buildings with 2 free observation decks, the shinjuku city park , 2 metro stations close by and a 10-15min walk to Shinjuku station ( with the JR Yamanote line able to take you around Tokyo and the nightlife on the eastern side of the station but the hotel is in a peaceful area.Overall it was an excellent stay with fantastic and friendly service from all of the lounge staff.

This is my third stay in this Shinjuku property, so I wouldnt do much discussion on the stay, except to includ some highlights. 1. The stay, from check-in to check-out was exceptional and the hotel really takes great care of the HHilton members.2. We had negotiated a paid upgrade to the Junior Suite with club access, and the extra space it affords for 4 nights is well worth the price we paid. As we had previously stayed at a nonrenovated junior suite last year, we chose a renovated one this stay.3. The club breakfast has an amazing spread for an executive lounge, with a cook-to-order egg station. The service from the associates and the chefs was professional, yet friendly as always. 4. Perhaps the only blemish of this stay was the overcrowding in the lounge during happy hours everyday. We did not avail ourselves to the evening lounge as it was overcrowded every night though the club associates tried their best to manage the situation.In all, this property is a solid 5 star property and we hope to visit it again.

Hilton , just my favorite brand ! Not a surprise ! Big rooms super good breakfast buffet ! Nice design and super friendly staff ! I was suggested by friends and I’ll decently come back ! Thanks everyone .

It was a pleasure staying at this hotel. I had emailed the hotel a couple of months prior to our trip regarding transport from the airport and sending our luggage to another city; they replied the very next day. It was easy enough getting the limousine bus from Nartita Airport (around 70mins). We were welcomed by Kawaji at reception who was extremely polite and friendly. She even organised for sweets to be delivered to our room when she found out it was our honeymoon! The room was spacious and had a great view of the skyscrapers. Rooms were very clean. Breakfast was delicious with a variety of western and Japanese dishes. As the hotel is slightly out from the centre of Shinjuku(only a 20mins walk) they provide a shuttle bus to and from Shinjuku station from around 8am -2130ish and runs every 20 minutes. Sasaki at reception was very efficient at checking us out and again very friendly and polite. We would definitely stay here again.

Went on my birthday trip and arrived on the day of my birthday! Not as if I am looking for anything for my birthday however the person whom checked me in asked for my passport and didn’t even greeted me with a “happy birthday “ yes it might sound as if I wanted to take advantage of my birthday for the hotel to give me an birthday amenities or even an upgrade which I also would not ask. On the next counter the person whom is checking in is also celebrating her birthday and gotten the recognition! It makes me think that the hotel has many different standard and treat guests differently due to they way they booked the hotel! Be careful if you do not book directly with them as you might be second class! Other than this! We were asked to be an Hilton Honor member so we can have free WiFi which is norm for most hotels worldwide but after filling in the forms we are told again because we didn’t book directly and we cannot be extended the free WiFi. Second class again! So why ask us to be when they know we cannot get it???? Maybe because they all have a quota to achieve so they use the same technique to achieve it. Felt very cheated! Hotel otherwise is ok! Staff are like robots maybe because of the standards set out to be achieve! Nonetheless in the industry of hospitality I feel they need to treat everyone the same. Location is not bad rooms are also good size for Tokyo standard. Just don’t be robots but look after everyone the same as all of us pay the same only through different channels booked which the hotel makes the call to sell the rooms!!!! If you want to be just anyone in this factory stay they. The person whom checked us in is not a normal staff. Ps it is not just wanting more or pinpointing at anyone however the overall experience is way below average of even a 3 star howver for the price paid!

We stayed at the Tokyo Hilton located in Shinjuku for 4 nights. We chose this hotel because of its location to Shinjuku Station and the shopping and restaurant districts that surround it and weren’t disappointed.The drive from Narita airport to the hotel took approximately 1.5 hours. Good motorway conditions existed, but there was a lot of traffic as we got closer to the city.Our checking experience was good due to the team speaking excellent English and due to them being so friendly and efficient. The hotel has a number of really fabulous restaurants on the second level (ground is called level 1). We ate at the Grill on the first night and the Chinese on the second and have to say that while they are expansive, the service and quality of the food was simply excellent. Our third night, we ate out at a little (tiny) restaurant in the ‘Alley’, which was lovely and the fourth night we booked in at the Italian restaurant located in the basement shopping area below the hotel. This Italian restaurant ( Ristorante Carriera Italiana) is super friendly, not quite as good with their English, but has the most amazing quality and flavour in each dish we had. We highly recommend this restaurant.The breakfast restaurant is located on the ground level and has a wonderfully comprehensive buffet, with Egg Station and Coffee shop. The team are very attentive and help guide you if needed. We enjoyed a relaxed breakfast here each day.The hotel is located approximately 15 minutes walk from Shinjuku Station and from there you can access their amazing rail system. Above and around the station are an enormous number of shops, shopping centres and restaurants. Something for everyone.We arranged for 4 hour introductory tour of the area with a private guide (Yuki) through City Unscripted. This was a great was to get a local to show us how to get the rail card, how to use the rail system and to be comfortable with walking the area. Yuki was just great and took us for a comfortable walk around the area.In essence, our stay at Hilton Tokyo was very enjoyable and we we were very happy with everything. ( Hint: probably good to check that your room is not alongside the elevators).

The Tokyo Hilton is a great hotel in an excellent location. We recently had a 7 night stay and enjoyed every minute. The staff were great and the concierge and bell desk very helpful and accommodating.The hotel is close to the main Shinjuku area however there is also a shuttle bus which runs every 20 minutes to the front of Shinjuku station which is very handy.The room size is quite large which great amenities and very comfortable. We had a great view over the Shinjuku area. There is also a good gym and a pool which is free to use.Make sure you book in for the psychedelic desert buffet if you have the time, absolutely delicious.

We stayed 2 nights at the end of April, 2018. Overall the stay was excellent. A front desk attendant took personal care of us, including arranging an airport shuttle transfer, making dinner reservations and other assistance. The room was large, clean and attractive and the location in the Shinjuku neighborhood was excellent. We also took advantage of the free shuttle between the hotel and the shinjuku train station. We highly recommend this hotel.

Wow what a plush palatial palace like hotel. This glorious magnificent hotel is just fabulous. Service with smiles they even had an adapter at desk for all our gadgets. Tip pay a bit extra for the executive club you won’t be disappointed. They have a chef to cook poached eggs, omelettes etc at breakfast time, and you can can choose a typical European or more Asian both delicious. in the evening they have cocktails, champagne and a good strong choice of different hors d’oueuvres which were a tastebud teaser every bite. This room had seperate bath and shower, the toilets had heated seat, bidet, spry and other bits, now I want one. The bed was comfortable with plush snugly pillows, like sleeping on a cloud. Not too far from shops they have a courtesy bus that drops you off in middle of town centre and also return for free too. The views are spectacular. We had absolutely wonderful time yes we would re turn I highly, highly recommend.

Stayed here in April with my wife as part of our honeymoon. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful and let us check in early after a long flight. Even had a bottle of wine and fruit waiting for us in our room. The room itself was large, stylish and had a fantastic view of the city. The hotel is in Shinjuku which is a great place to stay if you’re in Tokyo, has everything you would want to see and do. It’s about a 15 minute walk to Shinjuku station but the hotel provides a free shuttle bus every 30 mins or so which was very useful. Highly recommend visiting Memory Lane and the Golden Gai in the evening for drinks and food, both walkable from the hotel. Tokyo feels very safe so recommend walking around to see the sights. The Meiji shrine is around a half an hour walk and was a very pleasant one.We didn’t eat at the hotel but the food looked great. I believe the hotel offers a shuttle bus to the airport but we arrived by train. Took around and hour to get there from Narita airport. Overall this is a brilliant hotel, well located and I would definitely recommend staying here when in Tokyo.

We stayed in an executive floor twin with beautiful views over Central Park, Shinjuku and on a clear day...Mt Fuji was in the distance. We checked in on the 37th floor as we had booked an exec. room and we were warmly received and so well looked after. Our room was ready at 12 noon after a short and very helpful discussion from staff on the vicinity, the metro and great places to see. We had a buffet breakfast, afternoon tea as well as nightly beer, wine, spirits and canapés included in our room rate which was amazing!Loved the area, easy to get around being in the middle of two metro stations. Staff were so lovely, we felt very welcomed indeed. Thank you Hilton Tokyo!

The rooms are large and clean. Hilton does it again! The Strawberry desserts are out of this world. The restaurants provide you with delicious foods to satisfy all of your desires. It is centrally located neatr many other stoors, restaurants, Jazz Clubs and all of Tokyo.

We stayed at the Hilton Tokyo for three nights. Although we enjoyed our stay here, I definitely do not consider this to be a 5-star hotel, or even a 4-star hotel, as some online travel sources suggest. The standard guests rooms are small (not unusual by Tokyo standards) and quite dated - the bathrooms in particular. Our bathroom was quite small and sad with none of the details that elevate a hotel into luxury status. Our tub/shower had one of those partial tub doors where the water splashes out when you take a shower. The bathrooms could definitely use a face-lift. That said, we still had a very nice stay here, due in large part, to Japan's elevated service standards. The hotel staff was quite gracious and helpful. The breakfast buffet is quite good, with a broad range of fresh fruit and juices, Japanese breakfast, omelette station, and freshly baked pastries. The hotel is located in a quieter part of Tokyo but just a few blocks from several metro stations and the lively areas of Shinjuku.

We stayed in four Hilton hotels in Japan. On one level, this was the least attractive. Our upgraded room, while comfortable enough, was smaller than any of the the others but that is probably to be expected in Tokyo. The lobby is often crowded with groups and has almost no places to sit. Indeed, when our room was cleaned -- usually in mid-afternoon -- we were hard pressed to find a comfortable place to wait. The lounge areas on floors 3-4, where the meeting rooms are, were roped off (we had to ignore the robes, I confess). But, on the plus side, the hotel is conveniently located in Shinjuku -- not a bad walk to Shinjuku station (it did take us three days to figure out where the hotel's shuttle bus stopped there) and connected via underground passageways to the subway. This is an upscale part of town, but also close to a wide variety of restaurants and shopping. The most attractive feature of the hotel is its excellent breakfast buffet.

This Hilton fully respect their Diamond members. Free room upgrade, exclusive Lounge, a welcome drink, and absolutely fresh squeezed oj.The stakehouse on the 2nd floor offered fantastic food and service.Definitely a please to visit again.

Stayed here for 3nights and a delightful place to return to at night after the madness of Tokyo city. Easy check in from what appeared to be a constantly busy lobby area. Nicely situated for easy access to the metro. We had a 33rd floor room with wonderful views. Didn't eat here as too much choice in the city. Highly recommend here for a city base.

The Tokyo Hilton is a place that allows you to feel immediately comfortable in Tokyo. Competent staff from check in to check out is a pleasure. If you can enjoy the Executive lounge on the 37th Floor for a drink or food it gives you a breathtaking view of a major world class city and you're above it all.

We stayed at this hotel on route to a cruise, the concierge was very helpful & offered an upgrade when I asked about breakfast, he suggested that we would be better off as it would give us greater use of the facilities that the hotel has on offer. The overall comfort is just what you would expect from this class of hotel, nothing was to much bother, I know that you pay for it but it is certainly worth the extra & a great place to help you relax & explore the city. I fully recommend this hotel, food was good at least what we had was, comfortable and relaxing a very enjoyable experience!!

The location of Hilton Shinjuku is superb, especially with the convenient shuttle bus service connecting the hotel and Shinjuku station, where big department stores and good restaurants can be found within walking distance. Rooms are considered big and comfortable as compared to typical rooms managed by other Japanese hotels. Executive Lounge is spacious for breakfast and evening cocktails with outstanding service. However, our experience for breakfast in coffee house at Lobby level was unpleasant with big crowd fighting for food and space which looked confused and messy due to too many guests taking breakfast during morning peak hours.

This is our third two week stay at this hotel and we have been impressed every time by the hotel, rooms, staff and location. Being close to Shinjuku station(15 min walk, 5 min free bus) and two Tokyo Metro stops (5 and 7 mins walk) means that pretty much all of Tokyo is easily accessible by the Metro and JR lines.The room we had this time was a City View Executive room and, like the other rooms we have had before was spotlessly clean and without fault. The view, of course, is incredible, and musch time was spent on the seats by the windows looking out over the city. The staff are friendly, helpful and polite without exception. Whether you are dealing with them directly or just passing them in the corridor, they always have a genuine smile and greeting for you.The Executive lounge is worth every penny of the additional room cost with consistantly high quality breakfasts, afternoon teas and canapes - not to mention the free drinks. Hilton have a

Those reviews that talk about “shortcomings at this 5-star property” just don’t know better. Hilton doesn’t position itself as 5-star; it is a 4-star brand (in the Hilton group, only the Waldorf-Astoria, makes 5-star, and barely, like Ritz-Carlton or Sofitel - and clearly below the luxury standards (or pricing!) of Four Seasons, Shangri-La, Mandarin Oriental, Peninsula, Aman, etc). The property is 4-star through and through: kitschy lobby which, at times, is almost as crowded as a train station; no security when entering lifts (although Japan is a low-crime country); extremely dated furniture in rooms (the rooms’ design is thoughtful and efficient, though); minuscule bathrooms with basic amenities; insufficient noise insulation when you have rowdy nocturnal neighbours; winding queues for buffets (even for the Happy Hour at the Executive Lounge). However, it is well located in Shinjuku: convenient limousine bus from/to Haneda and Narita airports, atop a metro station served by two lines. The gym, swimming pool, and hot bath are small for the property, but clean and adequate; they even have two rooftop tennis courts. WiFi (free for HH members) is fast when it works. Most importantly, service is friendly and excellent throughout the hotel, from reception, to concierge, housekeeping, gym, restaurants, room service, executive lounge - a sign of an exemplary customer-oriented corporate culture. A very solid 4-star hotel indeed - in fact, one of the better Hiltons in the world.

We are Hilton Diamond members and when we arrived were given an upgraded room. Although it was on the 9th floor overlooking the tennis courts it was reasonably good sized (especially for Japan) with a great bathroom. We came to Japan to visit relatives and see the cherry blossoms and just below our window was a few cherry trees in full bloom.The room was nice and clean. We stopped at the Executive lounge each night for some food and drinks, both the normal lounge and the upgrade lounge were very nice with great views.The special Japanese breakfast was nice but after the first day we opted for the big buffet breakfast which featured Japanese, Chinese, Korean, European and American dishes. We were here 7 nights and although the breakfast offerings were the same you had so much variety it did not matter.Location was great with access to Shinjuku Station or just use the subway stop under the hotel (short walk underground). Very handy using the complimentary shuttle bus from the hotel to Shinjuku. Next time I need to see if the Airport Bus from Hanada Airport makes a direct stop at the Hilton instead of transferring at Shinjuku Station.We took a taxi from the Hilton to the Tokyo Station to catch a Shinkasen to Kyoto was we did not want to battle with luggage on the subway.The staff was excellent from check-in to check-out. Most accommodating in the Executive Lounges as well. Definitely would stay here again.

Beautiful hotel with spacious rooms, great city views, walking distance from main attractions in Shinjuku with shuttle service to Shinjuku Station. Hotel staff were excellent. Great continental breakfast buffet. We are a walking family, we walked on our first day to Meiji Jingu, Shibuya crossing and Ometusande. 24 hr convenience store at the basement of hotel with access to local subway line from there. Overall great experience. Would definitely stay here when we come back.

I have prepaid for the 3 rooms ( 1 jr suite 2 king executive rooms) more than half a year ago. At the moment of booking i have emailed the room reservations team/conceirge to request for rooms on a high floor with views and all 3 rooms to be on the same floor.I have repeated the request via email about 2 weeks ago once again after attaining hilton diamond status.This process of requesting room allocation was repeated again 1 and 2 days prior to our stay in hilton tokyo.I clearly remember emails being sent to my email account every single day prior to checking into the hotel about paying for upgrades to the next category room.From the hilton hotel app I was able to check in to rooms on the 37th floor the day before. I emailed the reservation team regarding the situation and did not check in as we were on a family trip and needed rooms on the same floor.Upon checkin our request that dated more than 6 months ago were unable to acceded to. We were given 2 rooms on 24th floor and 1 room on the 23rd.The 23rd floor room was directly facing someones office and the office staff could even look at me and wave to us. I am not sure if this is the "room with view" or "highfloor" that is as our request.I subsequently called frontdesk to get a better room but was told room is at 100pct occupancy, first offered a same room view 4 floor above us followed by a 31st floor room 3129. With the exact same kind of view.I am not sure if i deserved less as a hilton diamond member but i do remember checking into the room 3129 (after shifting from room 2329) seeing gifts and mineral water prepare in the room with a card welcoming a european named couple. I am not sure if it was 100pct occupancy what made our request less a "priority" than others. Not to mention diamond members were suppose to get room upgrades with preferred view. We came from intercontinental osaka and were upgraded to executive suite upon arrival despite a full occupancy.We were only given a change of room at 830pm after writing in to the gm.There is almost 0 staff available except for a lady at the hotel entrance to help with the luggage. Imagine the taxis , private cars and the airport shuttle coming in and only 1 small sized lady to help with luggages despite the rain? After shifting our luggage ourselves to the hotel lobby, no porters was keen to help even looking at us hands all filled with luggages and bags with a baby stroller, we had to call 1 porter on our own. (Speak about initiative from a 5 star hotel)The shuttle to the shinjuku station was horrendous, filled with office ladies that obviously do not seem to stay at the hotel. No verification was needed to board the bus and so the bus is filled leaving the hotel guest at a disadvantage.Hotel buffet breakfast at marble lounge starts at 6am, when we went down at 625, the entire cooked food section was empty and not ready. Only breads and pancakes were displayed.Dined in at dynasty hotel and food was extremely slow, we had to asked numerous time before a fish was served more than 45mins after ordering leaving our toddler wailing as she was hungry.The hotel manager which replied to our email *samuel peter, was MIA and it seemed no communication was done with the exex lounge staff to inform them of our change of rooms when we returned at 8pm. Subsequently, no efforts to reply our emails after we checkedout of the hotel. Only gived this review a 2 star instead of 1 because of a staff at the exec lounge (didnt get his name but he mentioned he was chi/kor/jap mixed and from hawaii) who was very friendly and helped us with the change of rooms making our stay a little more pleasant after the terrible start at the hotel.

Visited the Hilton in Shinjuku most recently in April 2018 with my partner to celebrate our engagement. We stayed for 5 nights on points and in a room facing the city.By far the best part of the experience was my interactions with the hotel concierge team prior to our arrival. I needed some assistance with fine dining options in Tokyo and the team were able to both recommend and secure reservations for us at some of the best restaurants in the city.The front desk check-in experience was also top notch, as while they weren't able to offer me a complimentary upgrade per my status, they did provide a number of extra amenities to make up for the inconvenience.Everything else was not so 5-star.The rooms, while comfortable, did feel a bit dated. There's the option of city view vs park view and there's really not much of a difference as I've had different views in two separate stays and hadn't had a preference.Even though the hotel has 5 elevators, it seems they only keep one or two running at any time. One night we arrived back around 11pm on a week night and there was a huge queue for the elevators for some weird reason.Breakfast is similarly very crowded. There was always a line no matter what time it was in the morning and just trying to get food from the buffet could become chaotic with people all over the place. Even though we had breakfast included in our stay, we didn't even go down the final few days because of the crowds and the repetitiveness in the food.The hotel has direct access to an underground tunnel system that takes you to two different subway stations so that was fairly convenient for travel. However, getting there from Shinjuku station is a bit far, so if you have bags, I recommend getting them shipped to the hotel from either the airport or from your previous hotel in Japan.It's not a bad place to stay overall, but I would certainly be shopping around a bit more on our next visit to Tokyo.

We stayed 2 nights here. Front staffs are friendly and helpful. Hotel location is connected with subway underpass and it is about 10 minutes walk to Shinjuku Station. Hotel has shuttle bus service between hotel and shinjuku station which is very convenient. Room is spacious compare to japanese standard. Breakfast here is good but I expected hotel should have more japanese food rather than western style. I recommended to stay here if you enjoy shopping in Shinjuku.

Stayed here a couple of weeks ago during cherry blossom season. 2 adults and a 9 year old. had a room with 3 beds which was great, nice view. Beautiful hotel with nice clean rooms. Nice lobby area with the usual buffet breakfast area, with a good selection of western and asian breakfast, juice stations etc. Staff were helpful. We were picked up by the complimentary bus from Shinjuku station, however we quickly discovered it is a relatively quick walk to that area, with great shops, transport etc. There is a line below the hotel and some small shops, convenience store if you need anything. This area is much quieter than staying in places like Shibuya etc, which can be nice, depending on what your after. Nice close walk to the government tower with it's free observation decks. We got there early in the morning and the line was short, but was quickly building. Once you have the subway worked out, you can get anywhere from here.I would have no hesitation staying here again, but for us would probably stay closer to Shibuya to be in the hustle and bustle as it's a bit novel for us.

This place was absolutely crazy full. I felt like they were very under staffed which made for long waits and at times when there wasn't a line to talk to someone there was no one at the desk to talk to. Very average to me.

Warm welcome, nice room on upper floor with City views. Concierge and Club Lounge staff very helpful and going out of their way. Only downside some loud American Groups occupying the Longe and sharing their experiences in a way not to be overheard.

I have stayed at Hilton Tokyo quite a few times and always book a room with Executive Lounge Access.This visit I am very disappointed to report that it has gone downhill.The Executive Lounge is crammed full of tables with no space between them, to try and meet the demand at UNhappy hour which goes from 6 to 8pm.From 7:30 or even earlier you will be greeted by empty dishes previously occupied by hot food and that are never replenished.Every night there has been a version of fried rice, and some cheap concoction with sweet chilli sauce. Salad is also provided, pieces of apple and a repetitive duo of cheese, and if you are quick a few crackers.There is an open bar with a wide range of spirits which seems to be one of the big attractions, plus cheap red and white wine and Chandon, and the usual soft drinks.The worst feature is the fact that small children are allowed to scream ,squeal and generally run riot as they become increasingly tetchy as the night wears on.Staff weave around them in very cramped conditions and nothing is said.While the Lounge has a no visible tattoos rule, misbehaving kids are fine.So now to the room, ours was unrenovated on the to 38th (top) floor and was very comfortable, clean and serviced nicely. It had both a sleeping and lounge area, however the bathroom was cramped with a shower over the bath.Perhaps they will fix this in the next makeover.Towels were fluffy and large, so top marks for this.As for the location, that is what keeps me coming back, walk to 2 different underground stations, a great shuttle bus service to Shinjuku for those who don’t want to walk , on the Limousine Bus route to both Haneda and Narita airports.Taxis are always available too.All very convenient.

This hotel needs to re-establish itself and start competing with its peers in the 5 star market. The service at reception was dire both at checkin and checkout. A prebooked room confirmed by email by the hotel 24 hours earlier was not available. Apparently the booking system can't be accessed after 7pm. Time to upgrade the system then.When I eventually got a room half an hour later, the down pillows which had been offered were missing. After 2 days they had still not arrived.The room lacked any remarkable amenity I expect in a five star hotel. Apart from the large room which is uncommon in Japan I was very unimpressed.Concierge was efficient and helpful.On checkout I couldn't persuade the reception to provide me with a proper invoice. All they could provide was an account for the balance I owed, not what I have paid already. That is of no use for a business expense. Did being a hhonors member make any difference; no

Recently stayed here for 2 nights after a 2 week cruise and it was a fantastic stay in every way.The staff are all very friendly and very willing to accommodate your every need.The hotel grounds and interior are immaculate.We ate at the traditional Japanese restaurant and what a great experience.The food was outstanding and expensive but very well worth it.Highly recommend this place if staying in Tokyo.

Room is a great size for tokyo. Location good with access to 3 subway stations albeit a walk away. Was a bit disappointed that it is not located where the main Shinjuku action is but stay was very comfortable, staff was great especially the concierge who can give great advice and directions.

We were upgraded to an executive lounge king room due to my gold status. The room was huge as v Tokyo standards. The breakfast in the lounge was lovely but doesn’t of course compare with the regular buffet on first level-which was fabulous. Ernesto the Guest Relations Manger is terrific and adds a special and professional touch to his work. Many thanks to all at this hotel.

I couldn’t recommend the Hilton Tokyo Hotel enough. Great sized rooms, incredible staff. It’s location in Shinjuku is perfect and the hotel offers a shuttle to Shinjuku station and back which is fantastic.

The hotel is located at a great location close to several businesses! Beautiful views from the room! Best Breakfast buffet I ever had! The hotel offers free shuttle to the train station/shopping! Also it’s close to several subway lines!

The location of this hotel is excellent and also the Narita limosine bus stops here. The concierge desk was extremely helpful. The room was comfortable and had everything we needed. My only criticism would be that the staff are very "Americanised".

We booked 7 nights here at the peak of Cherry Blossom season. I was surprised to be able to get an HHonors award redemption over this period which was a great use of points.We had a standard room which is much bigger than most other rooms we had stayed in across Japan.Room was clean and spacious, bathroom was of a good size with a shower head very well positioned for someone of my height (6’2”) which was pleasant.The gym was very good, with plenty of cardio machines and the weights machines whilst limited were new and in good condition.Location was a 5 min walk from Shinjuku station which is very convenient and the hotel has underground paths to two different subway lines.The only negative I had was around the price of breakfast buffets and other dining. Compared with other hotels in Japan it seemed excessive and we didn’t partake. The hotel is very close to Royal Host, Sizzler and numerous cafes that make coffee to a good standard so this wasn’t an issue.We would stay here again, most likely outside of Cherry Blossom season when rates would be lower.

Good size rooms and a touch of luxury. We even had a cherry blossom view from our window. Hilton does well here to shine above other hotels that are well just a bit small.Staff were polite. Our only complaint was maybe misunderstanding with what upgrades and meals etc were on offer.

I spent three nights there. It is a pleasant, clean, modern, well-run hotel in a good location. Staff are very helpful - reception, concierge, housekeeping. Rooms are quite large and the bathrooms well equipped. There is a free shuttle bus to Shinjuku station.

I stayed first time at this Hotel in Nishi Shijuku. It's Hilton, but already a little tired. Part of the staff was very atentive but some others were "cold" which is below Japanese standard. As a Hilton Honor member, I was a little disappointed.

Thanks also to the considerable propensity to respect others and to details of Japan culture, this large and rather anonymous hotel in terms of architecture, offers a higher quality experience and a great comfort related to the already good Hilton's standards. The recently renovated rooms, with a style that is able (in part) to deviate from the reassuring but boring aesthetics of the Hiltons around the world, thanks to some references to the colors and Japanese details, are pleasant and bright. The bathroom with a very spacious floor-level shower and bathtub offers the possibility to open a picture window on the room and enjoy the view of the beautiful city. Equipped with several restaurants (Japanese, Grill, Western) and two lounge bars with different live musical accompaniment, it is certainly the right place for those planning a stay in Tokyo for business reasons. Excellent both in terms of quantity and quality of the breakfast offer with express made dishes and wide range of alternatives on Continental, Asian, American traditions. Located in the Shinjuku business district and at 15 minutes taxi from Shybuya e Omotesando it if you have to work and focus in these areas. All personnel very kind and able to satisfy every request. I ate both at the Japanese restaurant (twice) and once at the Grill. Excellent food and preparation in both places but with high prices also compared to Tokyo standards: do not expect to spend less than 15.000/20.000 Yen for a main course a glass of wine and a dessert... Price of the rooms aligned to the Tokyo 5 stars hotels.

Had a 4 night stay at Hilton Tokyo with family. Rooms were spacious and very comfortable. Bathrooms are tiny in comparison to the bedroom, but very nice. Rooms were well serviced, modern and very clean. Its a very busy hotel, and not really in the middle of Shinjuku district as it seems online. To get to station is a bit of a walk, or there is a hotel shuttle bus that takes you to Shinjuku Station which is close to all the action. Overall we had a nice stay.

It was a great experience. I arrived at the hotel at midnight, and the front desk helped me upgraded my room type. Also, he helped me book the next day's airport shuttle to Narita Airport. Awesome experience.

just back from a trip to tokyo and kyoto for cherry blossoms...my first time back to nippon in 20 years. the hilton's a lovely hotel. clean, professional staff, very nice rooms, and located close by to a couple of metro lines...you'll especially enjoy the peace and calm of this section of shinjuku after experiencing (or steering clear of) the hub-bub of shibuya and other neighborhoods in tokyo. we hit the metropolitan grill for our last dinner...food tasty and the service superb. the head waiter, odatsu-san, was marvelous and a classy pro!!do stay at the hilton...you'll love it! :)

The positive:Well-trained staff. I thought I lost my mobile phone at the gym and went back to look for it, I didn't loose my phone there but the staff went out of his way to ask what my phone looked like and remembered my room number just in case he found it later.Things that didn't live up to expectations:1. We were there as part of a big group and had breakfast at a dedicated area on 1/fl, they were severely under staff with many tables uncleared after people left and have to wait a long time just to get utensils. 2. The taste of the group breakfast was just so so and the bread is not fresh.3. Room: the shower curtain only cover 1/3 of the tub so it will always get the floor / floor mat wet4. The toilet seat is just a basic version and missing some of the features like oscillating spray, (expectation is higher because of the high room rate)5. No brand hair dryer. Some other lower-priced hotels have Panasonic hair dryer that gives out ions6. No free smart phone (handy)7. There is no channel guide (English) for TV and instruction on how to select English nicam

The hotel has large rooms and ours had a view of the city. The hotel had lots of restaurants and bars. We went to the Metropolitan Grill for dinner one night and had their set menu as it seemed the least expensive way to go, but was very expensive. The food was very good and the service was excellent with our waiter having a good sense of humour. Less expensive restaurants close with a variety of food, across the street is a nice park and the government building with a free observation deck on the 45th floor is only a 5 minute walk away. We were with a large group and the check in was so well organized that it only took us about 5 minutes, if that.

We had a reservation for 3 nights. We reached the hotel by 8:00 AM which was too early then the check in time. But the hotel has a place where one can have a shower and get dressed and leave for their scheduled itenary.Also the staff is very helpful and supportive and since the rooms are pretty decent too. We had a good experience here.

I am stay this hotel for my first trip to Japan. This is the best hotel in Shinjuku. I booked with Executive floors so we have the benefit to go to the club lounge. can do check in and check out from this lounge too. You can do both for your work and leisure. Staff very friendly and hotel also provide the free shuttle bus to Shinjuku station where you can do lots of shopping

This is the best hotel i have stayed so far in my travels. Every staff member was warm, friendly, efficient, and welcoming (Take note Hilton Sydney), their buffet breakfast at the Marble Lounge was sensational (I love the waffles !) though it gets very crowded. The hotel is also connected underground with two subway stations, so getting around Tokyo is super easy. The room and general facade of the building are very clean, modern and inviting too. Hilton Tokyo will definitely be my first choice for future Tokyo trips.

We loved our stay here and would definitely return. We were upgraded to a suite upon arrival and had a great view. The breakfast buffet had an amazing spread of American and Japanese foods. It is connected underground to the subway station and in a great location close to Shinjuku station (big hub) and easy to explore all of Tokyo. The concierge was extremely helpful when it came to helping us make restaurant reservations. The only negative I can think of is the elevators get a bit crowded at peak hours. Can't wait to return. Still dreaming about the breakfast buffet.

Great location in the center of everything. The room was nice and clean. The service was above and beyond. Especially, the guest service table for sending packages and booking airport bus ticket. The gentleman who helped me sending my package back to the US was very very helpful. He packed my stuff perfectly and was very polite. The executive lounge had plenty of food and always refill. The staff at this Hilton is definitely better than the Conrad Bangkok in my home country that I stayed few days later. What a difference!

The service was great especially considering the holiday and that the hotel was booked to capacity. We had executive lounge access and the staff was wonderful. The front desk we great as well. CONS: I was disappointed that some things seemed a bit dated and as mentioned the elevators were a nightmare - packed and stoped at every floor. Additionally it was impossible to reach the concierge desk from the room phone - they were so busy. Given that this is a known peak time and they were booked to capacity, I would have expected they would be prepared for the crowd. Also, not really the hotel's fault but a note to travelers - we booked the Limousine Bus to Narita airport through the hotel for $30 ea adult without realizing it made several other stops in the area before heading off to Narita - we spent a nauseating 45 minutes driving around Shinjuku picking up other passengers (2 hour total trip). Had I known, I might have opted to take the subway to the airport - cheaper and quicker.

This hotel was amazing. It's located close to the subway and train station, but not very close to many of the major tourist sites. Despite that slight downside this hotel was the best we stayed in during our time in Japan. The service was impeccable. The room was spacious for Japan standards and the beds were amazingly comfortable.We took advantage of the executive lounge for breakfast and an afternoon snack (available for Diamond members). The food and service were great and the view from the 37th floor was beautiful.The front desk helped us arrange the bus back to the airport (there was a fee for the bus).All in all I would happily stay here again.

I was here with my husband and I am truly amazed how smooth our vacation went. The people around us are so accommodating and everything is superb. they have great but a little bit weird of food,but you know, the country itself is known for this. all in all it was a blast!

Nothing to fear here if you only speak English. The door person, the front desk & the consigliere were all very courteous & helpful. There are taxis available right out front & trains nearby. The hotel has a few restaurants to choose from including Japanese, Chinese, steak & a convenience store with numerous items. There is a gift shop & a book store. The pool & gym were well maintained. The lobby area, the bar & the rooms were all plessantly decorated with an upscale feel. The bar itself also featured either a dj or a singer during the course of the night. The buffets had a large selection of food, both Asian & Western. I also like the fact that it did not feel like it was overrun with tourists. I absolutely would return!

It was a great place to stay and was pleasant on the overall. Rooms were nice and location was appropriate wherein we can see lots of places just by walk of max 1 km. Lots of places to see around the hotel. Great facilities to add to your pleasant stay. you can enjoy leisurely and have nice fun in this hotel.

Stayed for nine nights in March 2017. Made full use of complimentary breakfast and lounge access. Loved the free hotel shuttle to the shopping and trains. Staff is very efficient and friendly. Rooms are spacious. My teenage son loved the great food with room service. I thought the breakfast buffet to be really scrumptious and really enjoyed the hotel's grill restaurant.

The awe of being in another country was exciting enough. Unable to speak the language was a concern. Upon arrival that fear was removed. The greeting was comfortable, words were understood. The bags were taken to the room and any help was offered. The next morning, the breakfast was like none I have had. The variety of foods was amazing. A mix of country and cultures with fresh and beautifully displayed treats that you felt you needed some of everything. Several different stations, eggs, fruits and juices, rice, noodles and vegetables, meats, pastry and.... The staff was ready to remove plates without even being seen.The other amazing thing about the hotel worth mentioning was the handling of the bags. The need to store bags for a couple of days was one of the other note worthy things. When left tags were given to collect bags on the return. The bags were waiting and the tags were very carefully checked prior to even being able to touch them. With that security there was no need for concern. That to me was very important and my belongings were there and well protected. I would return and recommend the Hilton Tokyo at any time to anyone!

A very nice decorated restaurant to match the theme of strawberry The atmosphere is fun The food varieties are great Steak sushi sashimi hot dishes drinks are all on the table The focus is strawberry It’s great to have all you can eat Japanese strawberry The strawberries are sweet and all the desserts are served with heart

Having experienced the warm hospitality of Hilton Tokyo Bay, this place is no exception. The staff were quite warm and friendly too. The food at the breakfast area was quite good although it tends to get too crowded. I would suggest that you get in early to get a good table. Aside Friday m that, the place is absolutely great! There is a shuttle service leaving the hotel to take you to the Shinjuku rail station where shopping is excellent. The hotel is centrally located and great for touring Tokyo..

I am a Hilton Gold, SPG Gold, and Marriott Gold member. I did a lot of research before deciding on Hilton Nishishinjuku because this hotel seems to be generous to gold member according to most Trip Advisor members. However, that was not the case with me. The limousine bus took two and a half hours to reach Hilton from the airport due to Shinjuku traffic. I begin to doubt if I made the right decision when I was stuck in traffic and when I got to the hotel, they told me they are fully booked and cannot offer more to a gold member. They did offer an upgrade on our 3rd night that we accepted. We were then assign to room 3005. The room was clean and of decent size. However, the bathtub door only covers 40% of the tub. What normally is a relaxing moment for me has became stressful as I tried to move my body and maneuver the shower head to try to avoid water leaking out the tub. The first three days of my stay, there were a lot of people so elevators were very slow and jam packed regardless if I was going up or going down. It stopped at almost every other floors. I would advise management to look into the possibility of assigning express elevators. On our last day, we waited for our shuttle at the lobby. We tried to find a seat but the 10 seats were all occupied. We witnessed an elderly lady with her daughter trying to find a seat but none were available so they proceed to walk to the concierge area and stood there to wait for their son/brother to pick them up. When we spotted a vacant seat, I went ahead and took it while my husband went over to retrieve the lady so she can sit down. I think it is unreasonable for a hotel this size to only have 10 seats in the lobby area. Tourist are tired people, it would be nice that there are more seats available. The hotel is about 7 minutes walk to the Oedo line or Marunouchi Line. If you plan to take the subway quite a bit, you may want to consider purchasing a Tokyo Subway Ticket from concierge. However, the Tokyo Subway Ticket is NOT valid on JR line.

Was fortunate to have booked the Hilton Tokyo for our first two nights of our japan adventure - arriving at 7am we expected to shower in the fitness centre and go exploring but were checked straight away into an upgraded suite. Facilities were top notch and having executiveLounge access made the stay so much more pleasant ... all in all a great stay ... very easy access to shinjuku ...

A typical business hotel, in Shinjuku perfect for the subway which takes you to downtown and to our offices, conveniently linked to the hotel via underground walkway. The hotel is clean very comfortable and the service was impeccable. The buffet breakfast was a feast of anything and everything you could possibly want.Not grand in any way but a very enjoyable and comfortable stay

The Tokyo Hilton generally meets all expectations commensurate with its 5-star (or at worst high 4-star) ratings. It is expansive and immaculate with fantastic restaurants, bars, attached shopping plaza, and convenient Shinjuku location. Relative to other options in Tokyo as highly rated, the prices are quite competitive. Still, I found it somewhat impersonal, though this might be expected given the sheer size (and number of guests) it must accommodate. They do try: the taxi valets and concierge are very helpful and speak fluent English, as does the front desk whose staff was equally pleasant. As a first timer to Asia, these conveniences were quite welcome. I would recommend and return, but might also consider a smaller, more focused property.

I made two reservations under my name for our stay on June 4 2018, I emailed the Hilton Tokyo reservation department to confirm my reservations, however, they insisted that their system is only showing one reservation (one room). So I decided to make a long distance call to Hilton Tokyo reservation department to sort it out. Spoke to this lady (I will keep her name anonymous), after about 10 minutes, finally she was able to locate my other reservation and confirmed that I have two reservations indeed.Few days later, I decided to email Hilton Tokyo again just to be sure and I wanted to have them confirm it by email so that I have proof to show in case something goes wrong upon check-in. Guess what, now they are saying their system is only show one reservation (one room) again! And the person who replied email is the lady who I spoke with on the phone! It's going back and forth many times and it can go on and on.....It's been a few weeks already and I'm still not able to get an email confirmation from Hilton Tokyo that I have two rooms/reservations booked. The Intercontinental Hotel is far better on responding guests and resolving issues, I should've just went with Intercontinental or Conrad.I am hoping this review can get the management attention and contact/email me regarding my reservation issue.

We recently spent 4 nights in Tokyo ... and found it's not enough!!! Our travel agent booked us into the Hilton as part of our holiday in Japan. It is a lovely hotel, beautifully appointed, and the staff are excellent.We checked out the hotel restaurants, which seemed to be very expensive - even by Tokyo standards, so we didn't eat there. We did have breakfast included. This was fabulous. So much choice and so many different cuisines.We are hoping to return to Japan some day and will certainly consider the Hilton.

Linked underground walkway from Shinjuku main station but about 30 minutes walk. Hotel do provide shuttle bus service to Shinjuku main station (15 minutes ride) throughout the day. Room is standard and typical of the hotel group, is good that there are no surprises here. Lobby is always busy and crowded. Service is still outstanding. Airport Bus stops here so that’s one of the reason to stay too (many timings a day). One unexpected was the toilet can be slightly more spacious for a 5 star property.

My partner and I stayed in the King deluxe room for 9 nights. We were lucky enough to be on the top floor and had a great view of the city. The location of the hotel was very good, the subway was just downstairs while the train station was about 15 minute walk away.
