The room itself was noticeably older compared to Hilton Osaka, lacking enough usb ports to charge all the devices needed. There was not bedside usb ports making the phone charging more of a hassle. It was definitely a business hotel room with a work table in the middle of the lounge area, however it was not too much of an issue.Like the Hilton in Osaka, the bathroom was crowded even with only one person in the room. The gym and training facilities were lacking in my opinion with only a small amount of dumb bells and squat rack, however there were plenty of treadmills. The service of the hotel was excellent as to be expected. Having stayed this long was not an issue but the hotel is definitely business orientated.

Exclusive location right on the heart of Shinjuku, specially the the Subway just under the hotel. I means "under" precisely that you just walk down feel steps from the hotel lobby to catch the metro.The room is excellent with all conditions like bath, bed stuffs and the extra bed also nice. The most comfortable warm pool and breakfast buffet with abundant of cuisine options that even make you hard to choose.High class service and very hospitality.Sure will be back soon.

LocationWe always take the airport limousine for which there’s a stop directly at the hotel. The hotel is not really located in the heart of Shinjuku, most people make use of the free shuttle bus to Shinjuku station Keio department store. However, if you’re out past 10pm, there’s no more shuttle, expect a lot of walking!Hotel and roomThe hotel is spotless. We were a party of 3, we added a single bed on top of a King; there was still plenty of space to move around. All the staff speak good English. OverallTokyo Hilton is expensive but I guess it’s worth the price. There’s a tradeoff between ease of commute to and from the airport versus the distance from central Shinjuku.

This hotel was wonderful, the workers are very nice and they all spoke English. When we were there it was extremely busy, the elevators were always full and sometimes we had to wait for the next one. But, it was ok because everything else was excellent. We would stay there again!

Good and busy hotel with very decent rooms for a Hilton and great location for business. The executive lounge on the top floor is great for breakfast (great service there) and the gym is very big with several modern treadmills, ellipticals, bikes, plus a pool. It also has a range of bars and restaurants to cater for a variety of tastes.

First visit to Tokyo. Familiar brand. Great overall experience. Took the limo bus from Haneda and was at the front door of the Hilton in 45 minutes. Got to the hotel at 6:30am and was able to get early check-in for ¥7k which reasonable and very very handy. Great location, about 10-15 minutes walk from the hustle and bustle of Shinjuku and right above Nishi-Shinjuku and Tochomae stations. You can pretty much get to any corner of Tokyo from here within 45 minutes on the subway, and some great places like the Tsukiji Fish Market are on these lines so really easy to get to. Basic King room (2621 - view from room in photo) was very comfortable and super clean. My only negative on the room was that (n.b. first world problem and not really “room” related) the selection of TV channels for a non-Japanese speaker was very poor. Basically you can’t watch TV in English unless it’s CNN or Discovery, and forget about any European languages. I like to watch for a while at night before falling asleep so it was slightly annoying on a personal level.Breakfast was great. Can get quite busy at 9am but good an hour before or after. Terrific selection, and if something was not on display you just ask for it and the staff went out of their way to get it. Generally the staff were great, and especially the Concierge were very helpful, knowledgeable and all multi-lingual.So overall a terrific hotel experience and good value. Would highly recommend.

Tokyo is one of the worlds most expensive city to live in. So the hotel prices reflect that, also at the Hilton Tokyo. Nonetheless, you will not be disappointed with the top notch services. You are welcomed from the first moment by the very professional and friendly staff. The room is spacious enough for two persons and you will be able to find all you need in the room. Super clean and you can see that the room is newly painted and the team did a great job maintaining the room standards. Kudos to the team for a brilliant job! Try it and you will not be disappointed. I will definitely return again.

Having stayed at the Tokyo Hilton 3 times in the last 3 years I have enough first hand experience and plenty of other hotels to compare to, that I can honestly say this is my favorite hotel on the planet. The staff at the Shinjuku Hilton are some of the most helpful, kind and gracious people I have had the pleasure of meeting while on my worldly travels. The staff in the executive lounge in particular were so helpful in finding restaurants, bars and activities for myself and my colleagues to do while staying at the hotel. The food, from the breakfast buffet to the Metropolitan grill were all five stars. The concierge(s) were always extremely helpful. The front desk staff was attentive. The house cleaning and facilities staff were some of the best that I have experienced.In summary - the Tokyo Hilton at Shinjuku is the one hotel that I will never forget; it is the one hotel that has a smell all it's own; it is the one hotel that is so well staffed that it's inhabitants will never be left wanting for more or asking for better service. This has been, is and will likely continue to be my favorite hotel on the planet.

Off the bat I can tell you I loved the hotel. The service was impecable and would have rated it 5 stars if only the location for me would have been better. If you need to stay in the Shinjuku area I would definitely recommend it but it is a bit far from the main tourist attractions. The upside it that there are 2 subway stations in the basement of the hotel. There are several great restaurants in site including a Chinese, Japanese and Meat place . The breakfast buffet was the best one if had in Tokyo so far. They offer both american and Japanese options. Our room was a bit small taking into account it was a jr suite but with a great view. It had a coffee machine and hot water pitcher for tea. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom had a separate shower and tub but what I didn’t like is that if you turn on the light in the bathroom the whole room lights up because the separation is frosted glass.

Definitely pay for the upgrade to the Executive level. We found that to be worth it because of the quality of the breakfast and the evening food and drinks in the Executive Lounge. The staff was very patient and friendly even though we did not speak their language.

What a hotel! Staff are extremely polite and courteous! The breakfast buffet is AWESOME! The basement level has a 24hr mini store that has everything you need. There are other shops there selling anything from small souvenirs to dining tables! Would definitely recommend!

Just finished up a 5-night stay on points for my 50th birthday. I am a Diamond Honors memberVery happy with the Hilton Tokyo. My room was on one of the curves of the hotel, so the entry part of the king room was much larger than the window area, but it worked well. Nice living area near the window was used a lot, and the bathroom was exceptional. Perhaps the best hotel shower I have ever had!On my birthday, I came back to the room to a card, some fruit and candies. I still have no idea how they knew it was my birthday!Really enjoyed the Executive Lounge as well. Breakfasts were done well (make sure to ask for your omelette well done if you don't like nearly-liquid inside your omelette!). The evening apps were plentiful, and provided an impromptu dinner one night -- the dumplings were incredible! the lounge also makes for a great mid-day break area for coffee and snacks!Arrived at NRT and took the Limosine Bus in, and used the same system for the outbound to HND. Could not have been easier.My transport plan was to use the closest metro station - Nishi-Shinjuku, and we did - was a cinch, and all underground from the entry in the Hilton lobby. The free observation tower in the Tokyo Gov't Center was an easy walk as well.I will definitely be back!

We arrived to Hilton Tokyo late evenining and that was the first hotel for our 10 days long Japan trip. Stayed at hotel for the fisrt 3 nights. As Gold member we were upgraded to executive floor with access to lounge. The room itself is was outdated and needs modernization, especially the bathroom area. Lounge is probably one of the best that we ever visited in Hilton chain: very good breakfast, attentive staff and variety of choice. There is orange squzing mashine located which is great for fresh juice lovers. Shinjuku area is one of the best districts in Tokyo where you may find a lot of best restaurants in walking distance. Please also note the subway station nearby if you are planning explore Tokyo.

There’s nothing particularly great or bad about this hotel. Much better for business travelers than for couples. The surrounding area is flooded with business people during the day. Room was spacious. It’s a 15 minute walk from any (non business) action/restaurants/bars, so you may love that or hate it. Very convenient to a couple of subway stops. We found the check-in process and concierge service to be quick and friendly.

Our trip to tokyo was amazing! It is quite difficult to communicate to locals because of the language barrier, sometimes my husband and I cannot really understand even though it's english. Concierge helped us a lot by making reservations and guided us on where to go. Worth it!

The Hilton Shinjuku provided excellent service. Staff was friendly and prompt at check-in. The executive lounge offered a full breakfast with no crowds or noise. They also offer a variety of food and drink services during the day and evening. Try to get a room on the city side, where you can see the skyscraper district of Shinjuku. View from the 31st floor was excellent.Late checkout was a huge help due to my crazy business schedule.Every employee that I dealt with was extremely friendly and courteous and helpful. Hotel is conveniently located. I recommend the hotel.

Stayed in October 2017 for 6 nights. Managed to book one of the largest suite.Hotel lobby was always crowded, so is the restaurant serving daily breakfast. Nevertheless, the service is always prompt and the staff would be more than willing to help. As I stayed in a suite, the room size was huge and more than sufficient and comfortable. A good gesture that the hotel provides regular shuttle bus service to the train station.

We stayed there for 6 nights. At the check in we told them that our wedding anniversary is within our stay, and they offered up an upgrade to executive room for low price.The service was great. Its close to Nishi-Shinjuku metro station. 10 minutes on foot to Shinjuku station. There is a complementary shuttle bus to Shinjuku Station. Over all we loved it

we only had a 19 hour layover in Tokyo we just booked the Hilton Toky. It’s definitely not an aspirational property.Check-in was efficient and the staff is friendly, but my HHonors status was not acknowledged:). By Japanese standards the room was pretty big.The Hilton Tokyo runs regular shuttle services to Shinjuku (including the train station) but if you don't mind walking, it will take you approximately 15 minutes to get to the fringe of Shinjuku

A truly remarkable Hilton experience! From check-in until departure, the staff supported any request I had.Staff is excellent, facilities are excellent, they anticipate your needs, and stay very well organized for any requirements. They are well rated, and they should be and they obviously are very focused on their guests. Special thanks to Mr Ernesto Bressan for the lovely birthday treat surprise! Also thanks to Mr Sasaki for providing precise information for Tokyo Hard Rock Café. To Ms Miki of the reception, you have such a lovely smile. Thank you all for the hospitality! I've stayed at hundreds of hotels globally, and Hilton Tokyo is definitely in the top tier of that list. If I have a chance to visit Tokyo in the near future, I will definitely stay here again. If you're looking for excellent customer service and top amenities, the Hilton Tokyo is the right choice.

The Tokyo Hilton is one of our favorite hotels in Japan. My husband and I travel to Japan from Hawaii a lot. We go to the Ryokans and explore the beaches and mountains. Whenever we get a chance to visit Tokyo, we stay at the Hilton! The Conrad was nice, but didn’t come close to our experience at the Tokyo Hilton. From it’s incredibly lavash breakfast buffet, to it’s top notch service, this hotel is the “creme’de la creme” part of our trip. I usually don’t like large cities and crowds, so we come to Tokyo mainly to enjoy our relaxing stay here. It’s like our oasis in the bustling city.All the personnel here that we have encountered have been courteous, professional, and treated us like very special guests. Concierge Keynon, Guest Service Ernesto and Lounge attendant Waki, all made us feel welcome and “appreciated guests”. The rooms are clean, comfortable and very well laid out. The bar here has combined luxury, comfort and excitement all into one, with live entertainment in the evenings. It is also very close to so many shops and restaurants. There is also an underground passageway which links to other parts of the district, and great to use if it’s raining. Tokyo Hilton will remain a favorite for us, as well as to our friends and family who we have brought here.

We stayed for 5 nights for a tourist visit. Hotel had everything we needed - well appointed rooms (good beds, spotless, good shower, minibar/fridge). We enjoyed the buffet breakfast and also had the served Japanese breakfast one morning which was a nice experience.We were lucky to have executive lounge access and the evening drinks and food came in handy on a couple of evenings.Location is great for sightseeing - 5 mins walk to two subway stations (Nishi-Shinjuku and Tochomae), both with direct tunnel connections to the hotel in case of rain.Staff were unfailingly courteous and friendly.Can't think of any cons - would happily return.

The staff is friendly and welcoming. The restaurants are all top notch. The rooms are spacious by Japanese standards and impeccably clean and well appointed. It's in the heart of Shinjuku and has access to the Tokyo Metro.

It is very convenient. The hotel is big and busy, especially during afternoon tea, you will see the queue outside the restaurant. Service at the executive lounge is amazing and the Japanese bento breakfast is something not to be missed.The room is specious even after fitting in a roll-in bed. I would definitely return in my next visit.

I have stayed at this hotel a few times, including most recently in Feb/March 2018. It's a nice hotel. It's a little dated but not bad. It still has fantastic toilets - like most decent Japanese hotels - with all the gizmos!! My rate came with breakfast but OMG it was so busy. Really busy. Luckily we didn't have to queue, but if you're the kind of person that gets nervous in crowds - not for you. I am a bit that way. But the breakfast buffet is great - western and Asian breakfast items. Really nice. Just busy. There are also some great restaurants in the hotel but OMG SO expensive. Really pricey. But very nice indeed. You can walk to the subway and it's convenient for Shinjuku. Overall I recommend but just note the above!Oh yes, one more thing -- we booked through a third party agency so they gave us no points or upgrades for our HHonors status. Disgraceful in my view! I would not have stayed with Hilton if I'd known. But overall it was still good. But no more Hilton for me.

A great place to stay in Tokyo, in Shinjuku area, near subway stop, easy to get around. Concierge was very helpful enabling me to get around. Now Tokyo is not the cheapest city, taxis are pricey and so was the room service. My room was huge. Toilet was entertaining with the heated seat, and various washes.

Everything at Hilton Tokyo is magnificent ! It's my holiday home in TokyoThe guest relations team here are the absolute top of the game, Ernesto, Rima, Alberto - HILTON & TOKYO Ambassadors. Accessible knowledgeable and simply beautiful people. I hope you have the pleasure that they provide me at Tokyo Hilton.The Executive Lounge team Keynon Okomoto Yasuda Waki Tomoko Saeki Sugihara & many more are warm friendly accessible hard working people that illuminate this special space. As guest Respect them like the Gold that they are ! The food and beverage is consistently delicious and plentiful. My favourite place to relax and strategize my day .... I'm sure you will too.Hilton rooms - Splurge on your room don't penny pinch you will regret it! The executive suites are ultra comfortable warm with every luxury you would imagine. Combine this with the wide array of Food and beverage options and Hilton Tokyo is a destination in itself.Marble lounge breakfasts are what dream breakfasts are made of.... Omelettes Salmon Smoothies plenty of high fibre and everything that's good for your start to an exciting day out in the most spectacular & breathtaking city on the planet. Congratulations Tokyo Hilton Management & Staff, & Thankyou. Its absolutely no wonder so many people keep coming back to your hotel.

You cant really go wrong with the Hilton, we stayed in large family room that provided access to the exec lounge, that made the stay much more relaxing, being able to pop up their and look over the city at different times without the feeling of being stuck in the room. The hotel is new and well kept, the staff are very helpful, but be prepared naturally it is very busy. There is plenty of different places to eat both inside the hotel and out, if you eat in then again be prepared for an expensive bill, but the quality does match the price.All in all a very enjoyable stay, I would go back again.

I love this place. The rooms are pristine, the gym is good, the executive lounge has great food but even better than all this is the people. They make the experience fantastic and make you feel important at every step of the way. Superior location, too!

My family stayed 3 nights in Hilton Tokyo. We all love the spacious room and great location for Hilton Tokyo. Shuttle bus to Shinjuku station is convenient and on its schedule. Easy to walk to nearby subway station. Staff are friendly and helpful. Room is clear, spacious. We can see spectacular city view from windows. Breakfast quality is good.We definitely stay here again when next trip to Tokyo.

I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, on my way back from Asia to North America.The location is very convenient, and while they do offer a complimentary shuttle bus to Shinjuku station, it is also an easy walk. As a diamond member, I was upgraded from a standard room to a premium room, and received access to the executive lounge as well as one complimentary cocktail at the bar downstairs. I thought the service at this hotel was excellent (of course this typically occurs in Japan), the hotel room was in very good shape, and everything worked properly. The executive lounge offers nice alcoholic beverages and snacks in the evening, a limited but lovely breakfast in the morning, and a pleasant atmosphere with attentive staff all day. Everyone at the hotel spoke fluent English. I was also offered the option of the breakfast buffet at the restaurant downstairs, and it was an elaborate breakfast with extensive choices.I have read some criticisms of this hotel, around location, standard of the rooms and service, but personally, I found everything to be of a high standard.There is one issue with the extent of Diamond recognition, that has been raised in the past. In my experience, with most hotel chains in Japan, one will receive the level of recognition that is exactly specified in the membership programme but typically, no more than that. That was indeed the case at this hotel and so I do not see this as a problem at the Hilton in Tokyo. Of course, it would have been nice to have received a big upgrade to a capacious suite with sweeping views of the city, but the diamond membership level entitles one to a preferred room or suite subject to availability (and technically if a room is available that represents an upgrade from what you have booked, there is no specific obligation to give you a suite). In some other countries like Thailand, quite often huge upgrades are given to diamond members, but this is not typically done in Japan, in my experience. (and I have experience with numerous chains) Therefore, I would say that the Hilton Tokyo is in line with other hotels in this country. The price point for everything is very high at this hotel, but not out of line with typical Japanese prices. Tokyo, in particular, is an expensive city.Overall, I was very happy and would be pleased to stay here again in the future or to recommend it to friends.

With several stays at the Tokyo Hilton under my belt, it continues to be one of my favorite hotels in Tokyo. It is close walking distance to Shinjuku Station and a perfect place to call home base while staying in Tokyo. The breakfast is amazing and the Executive Lounge gives you some of the best views in the city.

I've stayed here several times and enjoy it each time. The restaurants and bar in the hotel are great. The executive lounge is very nice but can get crowded at times. St. George's bar is nice and sells very nice cigars (Cuban Monte Cristos, Cohibas, etc) as well. So if you don't like some smoke in a bar you should be aware that people can smoke there.The rooms are very nice and I always love the showers. The rooms are a decent size and the beds and pillows are comfortable. The cleaning staff is very efficient and the rooms are well maintained.The metro line is very close, and you can walk underground if the weather is bad.All in all an excellent choice in Tokyo.

I´m not usually a fan of chain hotels, and I certainly wouldn´t call myself a Hilton fan, but this property was surprisingly great.Mainly due to the club lounge - one of the best I´ve found in the whole HH network. As much as I wanted to eat things like breakfast and lunch outside, the quality of F and B inside was a huge distraction (for better or worse!).Room product was an 8/10 (would have loved a bigger bathroom and not such a sterile bedroom, but I´m nitpìcking) and everything else was a 10/10, especially service.Highly recommend and I´d stay here again for sure.

I recently stayed here for Tokyo marathon with a running group. I had to book my room through a tour company. I didn't expect to earn point or a room upgrade as a diamond member. However, I was not allowed access to executive lounge. I spoke with management and still was not given access and found the interaction less than satisfactory. No gift, no note in my room, no checking in throughout stay. I spend over 2 months a year at Hilton hotels and was very surprised with lack of attention to detail and satisfaction from management. It certainly hasn't been my experience at other Hilton properties. Housekeeping and other staff were great but I won't choose to stay here again. Tokyo is a great city, and I can't wait to come back. I'll just be at Conrad next time.

We stayed here for 4 nights foe the tokyo Marathon and a few days after. For the race this was perfect for the start of the race. 4th floor view of the start was amazing. We had breakfast included and it was a very nice buffet. The restaurants were nice but very expensive as are most things in Tokyo. The hotel was busy and they were not always flexible or accomadating in the restaurants when there was obvious space to seat people. The area if Shinjuku is nice but a little too sterile and all about business and financial district. The train station was close for subway access. Our floor was suppose to be non smoking but one could smell a Smokey smell in the hallway.

This is a well maintained property in the heart of Tokyo city. Well connected by train and other modes of transportation. The coffee shop and other restaurants make you feel at ease. The rooms are spacious and the staff are courteous, speak good English.

This hotel has considered everything. Pleased will all aspects of our stay here. The executive lounge serves great food and drinks. Staff are super friendly and helpful. My first choice for stays in Tokyo.

In Japan, you are pretty much automatically get great service every where you go. I have the Hilton Gold Membership and was offered an upgrade to a junior suite the moment we arrived. We opt for the regular room (which is huge) at a higher level so the checking staff simply gave us free access to the private dining for suite guests. The facility is incredibly clean and the food is simply awesome. As a vegan, fresh fruits, plenty of vegetables available to choose from. I’d definitely will stay at this location again whenever I visit Shinjuku Japan.

We visited this luxurious 5-star hotel located at central West Shinjuku, next to the magnificent City Hall. The Concierge lady was nice to us and let us park our rental car in front. Great! The aroma at lobby was very pleasant and elegant. While waiting for checking-in, a very polite front-desk manager (Mr. Toshiki Shimada嶋田寿樹) approached us and helped us to finish it efficiently. His introduction was very clear and fluent in English. Very impressive! Our room was Executive King Junior suite, quite spacious, even for 3 adults. They gave us an extra-bed for compliments. GREAT! The toilet was very small instead. It seems that the toilet was not renovated together with the room, a bit odd with such a stylish room. There were no chargers besides bed. The breakfast, though appraised by many guests, was ordinary and no surprise to me. The executive lounge was a bit crowded, though descent in decoration, and closed too early, 9 pm. The business center was plain. In summary, the Hilton Tokyo impressed us by its high-quality service, spacious, bright, and enjoyable room, and very convenient location. A good choice for family trip.

I stayed at Hitlon Tokyo in January, 2017. This hotel offers consistently excellent service, and to make it even better, they have updated breakfast buffet. They now have a noodle bar, similar to Cathay Pacific lounge offers. Executive lounge breakfast offers more items now also, although it's not as many as the breakfast restaurant on the first floor. I tried the Japanese breakfast on the second floor once also, but I needed to make a reservation (it's a reservation only breakfast restaurant) before 9 PM the day before. So it's not always easy to make prior arrangement. As always, staff at the Executive Lounge was very helpful for making dinner reservation, airport shuttle reservation, etc. Another great stay in Tokyo.

Hilton Tokyo has the best concierge service out of the many 5 star hotels I've ever stayed in worldwide. They have been replying my requests efficiently, making restaurant reservations, transport reservations and even giving directions to places in Hokkaido which was part of my itinerary. Our stay was great as well, as we had a quiet and cosy room away from the elevators and we were warmly welcomed at the front desk by Ernesto (I hope I got his name right) , who was kind enough to check on us during checkout too. Will definitely be back the next time I drop by Tokyo !

The hotels offer good foods (Japanese food is better than Chinese restaurant). Massage service is better and cheaper than other brand. It is easy to take a bus from Hotel to Airport. The front desk and concierge is excellent to handle to your request.Hotel is also offer very good breakfast.

駅からは無料のシャトルバスが一時間に三本（20分おき）部屋の方は大きな窓で外光が差し込みとても明るい雰囲気。エグゼクティブジュニアスイートで開放的な部屋はラグジュアリー感満載で満足。9割以上の方が外国？か、まさにグローバルホテル。トータルで感じたのは、やはりワンランク上のサービスで東京のホテルの中でもコスパが高いと思ってます。ホテルまではJR・京王・小田急・地下鉄「新宿駅」西口から徒歩約10分、車で約5分。「新宿駅」西口、京王百貨店前21番バス乗り場からは無料シャトルバスがあり。地下鉄丸の内線「西新宿駅」（C8出口）からは徒歩約2分、地下鉄大江戸線「都庁前駅」からは徒歩約3分From the station three complimentary shuttle buses (every 20 minutes)The room is big window with external light and it is very bright atmosphere. The executive junior suite and an open room are satisfied with a feeling of luxury.Is over 90% foreign? Or, it is a global hotel.I felt total, I think that COSPA is expensive even among hotels in Tokyo with a notch service.It is approximately ten minutes on foot from the west entrance of JR · Keio · Odakyu · subway "Shinjuku station" west entrance to the hotel, approximately five minutes by car.There is a free shuttle bus from "Shinjuku station" west entrance, the 21st bus stop from Keio Department store.It is about 2 minutes on foot from Marunouchi Subway Line "Nishin Shinjuku Station" (C8 exit), about 3 minutes on foot from the Oedo line "Tokyo Metropolitan Eki Station"

I stayed 5 nights recently and was extremely pleased. The rooms were spacious and clean. The bedding and towels were of good quality. The sliding screen over the window is a nice feature. It prevented glare on the TV and computer while still allowing natural light in the room. The front desk staff were accommodating and spoke excellent English. The basement level has numerous stores and a convenience shop. The hotel food was good; however a little pricey. There is a Starbucks on the next block which is a short walk. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here for 3 nights. as a Diamond member we were upgraded to a loverly suite with city view and access to the executive lounge for cocktails.Breakfast was very good with a lot of asian and continental options.We also tried the bar and one of the restaurants. Both very good. Service at the bar (Florian?) was really good. Special thanks to the concierge who helped us to book a Special restaurant as well.

In my memory, most of the Japanese hotel rooms are very small (quite understandable), so for many years when I travelled for leisure, I have opted for private accommodation. This time I visited Tokyo for a short business trip and stayed in this Hilton. The room was very big, sizeable even by non-Japanese standards. It’s clean and comfy. The staff could speak very good English and helpful. There’s a free and frequent shuttle bus to Shinjuku Station which I believe can be handy for most travellers. There are a few restaurants and convenience stores within walking distance from the hotel. I however didn’t have time to use the hotel facilities.

The Hilton Tokyo has large rooms, comfortable beds and fast elevators. It is among the nicest hotels, that I have stayed in around the world. They have great wait staff and they know how make you feel comfortable.

This hotel lives up to all of the 5 star reviews it had received. Location, decor, service, staff. Everything was outstanding. I travel every week on business and I'm quite critical of hotels. I remember when Hilton was one of the best names in the hotel business in the 1960s and 1970s. Well, this property brings it back to the top.I LOVED IT.

Was really pleased with the upgraded room and I would say it was one of the most pleasant Hilton that I’ve stayed. Staff were friendly and hotel rooms were clean. I have no complaints. The good thing about it was the free and frequent shuttle to Shinjuku Station. It was really convenient though there wasn’t any entertainment, shops or eatery around the vicinity of the hotel. There was also a underground walkway to different lines of another underground train station. The airport limousine also stopped here both to and from Narita and Haneda.I would stay here again but the hotel is pretty on the high side compare to other hotels in Tokyo.

After a 14 hour plane ride then a 90 minute bus ride I arrived at the Hilton Tokyo,. I was warmly greeted at the door. The front desk informed me I was upgraded to executive lounge access. My room was one of the recently renovated premium rooms; spacious, comfortable bed, walk in shower, 10 function toilet seat. The only problem was for 3 straight nights the fellow directly upstairs would stomp around like a baby elephant until 5am. I asked the front desk how many more nights he was staying. I was informed 10 more, same as me. So I requested a room change. I was happily accommodated and moved to the 37th floor later that day. While the new room was not renovated it was very quiet in spite of the fact it was on the same floor as the executive lounge. An added bonus was that it had a view of Mt Fuji. The executive lounge has a wonderful staff, always warm, friendly and conversant no matter how busy or crowded it was. And it too had glorious views of both Mt Fuji to the southwest and the city towards the north. While the breakfast in the lounge was not as extensive as in lobby restaurant, ready made omelets and limited buffet food was standard as was fresh squeezed orange juice. The evening snack had wine, beer, champagne and liquor. The food was salad, cheese, apples and couple of hot entrees like dumplings, yakatori, or noodles. Breakfast in lobby restaurant, the Marble Lounge, was included in the room rate as was typical at other Asian hotels in which I have stayed. The cost of drinks and lunch/dinner however were quite pricey. Lunch buffet cost about $55. A pizza and pint of Guinness cost about $60. With so many options to eat just a short walk away there was no real reason to eat at the hotel often.The location is fantastic. It's a short walk to two subway station or a bit longer to Shinjuku Station. You don't even need to go out side to get to them. There's a staircase at the entrance to the Marble Lounge that goes down to the tunnels which lead to either Tochomae or Nishi-Shinjuku stations. You can also very easily walk 10/15 minutes to Shinjuku - Golden Gai, Piss Alley, and Kabukicho. The Tokyo Metropolitan Building is a 3 minute walk away as well. There is also a 24 hr market across the street. I can't wait for a return trip.

I did a very short trip and was based in Hilton Tokyo Shinjuku for three nights.The room we took ( my Daughter and I ) was the Premium room that came with breakfast. Got a promotional room at around USD300 with breakfast but it was only for me the Hilton member and did not include accompanying guest which kind of sucks .Room is nicely furnished and modern albeit small size wise. Location was very good and there are direct limousine bus from Narita and Haneda to Hilton Tokyo. It is good if you have lots of luggages as it stopped right in front of hotel. Downside if to Narita airport is 2 hours journey. Haneda is around 1 hour journey.The hotel staff is good and speaks good English by Japanese standard . The best part is truly it is near to Shinjuku Station and there is a hotel shuttle there. We have no problem traveling to Shibuya and Tokyo Skytree and other places !

Location was great, Room exquisitely cleaned, service was amazingly helpful and bed was outrageously comfortable. Extra cherry on top was the perfect water pressure in the bathroom. Can’t wait to make it back to this comfortably convenient property.

This hotel is located in shinjuku area and and ShinJuku station is just 10 minutes walk. There is also ametro underground station in about 50 meter away. The goverment building is also just around the corner. The hotel rooms are quite small especially if You are taking the standard room However its better than other hotels. The service is good .. and the staffs are very friendly. The conceirge team is excellent ...they provide us with Maps and direction to the tourist destinations. Thes also a baggage delivery service right in the ground floor of the hotel. Just drop Your bags at the bell service area and they Will make arrangements to deliver them to Your next destination. But the best of All is the AirPort limousine stop right at the door Step of the hotel. This is so convenient. There is also a shuttle bus to shinjuku station . So if You dont want to walk then can opt for the shuttle.

We recently stayed at hilton tokyo for 6 nights at the end of a 3 week holiday in Japan. Each of our previous hotel rooms around the country had been quite small, but our room at the hilton was large, airy and beautifully modern.The lady who checked us in was so helpful and friendly. When i booked online i was only able to get a king bed room, which was ok, but not my first choice as i was travelling with my teenage son, however at check in we were offered a change to a twin room, which was perfect. We were also provided with all the options for dining and the hotels facilites, rather than us just having to read it out of a book.The location of the hotel is brilliant, right on top of an underpass walkway to 2 subway lines and only one stop away from shinjuku station. Three are hundreds (literally) of restaurants in the area around the hotel, there is also a park only a couple of minutes walk away..The facilities in the hotel were great, wtih lots of eating options,shops, gym, pool, however there are a couple of reasons that i have not given this hotel 5 stars.....in this day and age not having free wifi is ludicrous and the only way to get free wifi is to join the hilton club. we ate breakfast each morning at the marble lounge, which was quite lovley, but several mornigns there really as quite a logn wait to get a table. Most of the staff in the lounge were great and apologetic about the wati, but there were a few staff who really needed to learn how to smile and show some courtesy. We were in an executive room, so could have had breakfast in the executive lounge, however breakfast there finished at 9am which was deftinitely too early for us on holidays. the only other negative for us was that we had our luggage forwarded to the hotel from a ski location, but on the third day when it has still not arrived i went asking if anyone had seen it, and it had been sitting in a store room since the day before and no one had bothered to let us know or bring it to our room, which was quite disappointingover all, despite the coupld of neagtives, this was a lovely hotel in a great area with great rooms and fantastic views. I would definitely recommend it

Things got off to a good start the moment I disembarked from the airport limousine bus. I hadn't even touched my bag before being offered assistance by a smiling young woman who escorted me to the front desk, luggage in tow. Her vivacious nature was a positive indication of the type of stay I would come to experience. Although it was two hours before official check-in, I was immediately accommodated by the equally welcoming front desk associate, and assigned an upgraded room on a high floor with sweeping city views. Executive Lounge access was provided due to my Hilton Honors Diamond status, and I was even given a drink voucher for the St. George's Bar in the lobby, which I gifted to a surprised guest I encountered in the elevator. My room was comfortable and well appointed. I loved the sliding Japanese screens that added a degree of privacy to both the exterior windows and the interior bathroom shower. All furnishings were in excellent repair and the room was immaculately clean, and kept that way for the duration of my three night stay. Housekeeping was performed efficiently and discreetly without the incessant knocking and repetitive announcing of, "housekeeping," so prevalent in many hotels around the world. Tips left on the bed pillow for the housekeeper were neatly removed to the adjacent nightstand, left unpocketed, an occurrence one sees only in Japan. The unusual shower setup was quite interesting, and the flooding I anticipated never occurred due to the ingenious drainage system. Water pressure was very strong, and I never encountered a shortage of hot water. Toiletries were Crabtree and Evelyn, and replaced as needed. A minibar fridge was fully stocked, and complimentary bottled water replenished daily. The bedding, pillows and mattress were of a high standard and most comfortable. I slept very well. My only criticism is that my neighbors on the other side of the connecting door would occasionally get a bit animated, and the ensuing noise would filter into my room. If you have a choice, ask for a room without such a door. The Executive Lounge was very busy at times during the weekend, but quieted down during the weekdays. No matter, it was well run with typical Japanese efficiency and grace. Despite this having been my first time visiting this property, I was continually addressed by name and made to feel like royalty. Drinks were proactively refilled, dishes quickly cleared and preferential seating offered. Kudos to Keynon-san and all the team members for making guests feel so valued. The breakfast, afternoon and evening offerings were of a high caliber, rotated daily and kept replenished before they ran out, no matter how busy. Not an easy task, given the number of guests during peak periods. In my many years of travel, there are many pleasant experienes that remain memorable, but none so personal and satisfying as mine at this Hilton. I will go out of my way to stay here at every opportunity.

We have a spacious room with city view (king jr suite). The staff was very friendly. There was a food-court level with some restaurant. We tried one of them (the meat-restaurant) and the food was superb. Positive that the that the airport bus stops outside the hotel. The shuttle to Shinjuku station was also convinient. I think the main negative item was the executive lounge that seemed a bit out-dated.

Service: Excellent Room: Corner Suite was amazing with view of Mount Fuji!!! Super clean! Slept like a baby.Second room was premium room - great tub and size!Location: Convenient - 10 min walk to Shinjuku Station, 24 hr convenient store.Hilton Diamond Recognition: Yes!! Gym: Great equipment - free weights room, stretching area, they have my a rower too!Lounge: great selection of food and wonderful service!Thank you for a wonderful stay!!!

Never had a better hotel experience anywhere in Asia. Stayed on one of the Executive Floors which I'm certain added to the experience. Fabulous view from so far up. Nice! Breakfast was memorable both from the standpoint of service and food. The Asian and Western offerings were plentiful and delicious. The servers were beyond good. They were all great!This was unfortunately a quick business trip but we are planning to return later in the year for a more leisurely visit. No question where we'll stay.Highly Recommended

We are a family of five, so took 2 rooms at the Hilton mid-January. The rooms were big, the service was excellent, the sheets and pillows soft and luxurious, the onsen and pool area very well received, esp just before a long-haul flight. We didn't eat in the hotel, as we find the food far too exciting in Tokyo to not venture out. We also found the location handy for exploring Shinjuku and beyon. We will def consider staying there in the future.

spacious and comfortable rooms (what is not a standard in Tokyo), perfect view for Tokyo city center, extremely gentle staff, very good restaurant, close to business center and shinjuku train station,

I've routinely chosen to stay in Hilton Tokyo for quite a few years for my trips to Tokyo. It is still a very pleasant experience except that this time round, my room is right next to the lift.. it was XX04. We can hear the sound of the lift going up and down. Otherwise, the location, service breakfast, size of room etc were all good.

The breakfast is nice with many choices. The free shuttle service is good and frequent enough. The service of the staff is good. But if you booked for a room for three people, the room may be too small for you.

Our family stayed here over the New Year's holiday and we had such a great time! The hotel staff was great and accommodated our request for adjoining rooms; the breakfast buffet is amazing and has something for everyone; and the rooms were super clean with comfortable beds and really great toiletries (and a really good shower). There's a bus available from Narita airport directly to the hotel that takes about 1.25 hours -- it's not a hotel shuttle but it was cheap and convenient to get a ride directly to our destination and not have to navigate the train system, especially after a long flight. The hotel's location was convenient and we would definitely stay here again.

I have been critical of Hilton’s in the past, as being a bit predictable and complacent, trading on the name rather than tying to exceed expectations. At this Hilton they exceeded my expectations and some. From the outside looks a bit dated, inside not, well appointees very very clean friendly welcome good original food. I only had one night to enjoy the hotel but I would return and would recommend. Room was small but to be expected from a big city hotel, the area is safe, more business like but the rest of the city is in easy reach. Taxis are good clean and reliable.

We stayed at the Hilton for 4 nights in December 2017 and had a great experience. The staff was amazing and everything was so conveniently located close by. If you arrive into Narita, the Airport Limousine bus drops you off right at the hotel, making it convenient to get to. We checked into our room, only to find that the room was slightly different than the pictures on the website. When we asked the front desk, they noted that some of the rooms are not renovated and the pictures on the website are of the renovated rooms. The staff mentioned that only some rooms below the 21st floor have renovated rooms, making it a challenge to locate one. The staff was able to locate a renovated room for us, but unfortunately, the room type was slightly different than the one we reserved, therefore there was a difference in price. We decided to splurge and I'm glad we did because the renovated room was spacious and had more light. I can't speak enough of the service of the staff. They were so accommodating. We utilized the concierge for day trips and other recommendations and they were very patient with us, even though there was a line behind us and they took as much time that was needed to help us. You could sense that the staff truly wanted to make our staff the best possible and we really appreciated it. Additionally, the house cleaning staff was amazing. We don't speak any Japanese and our cleaning person didn't speak any English. To ensure she was able to provide is with what we needed, she came to our room and had us point to what we needed and she came with a little box of supplies to replenish our room with. Outstanding service and would definitely recommend this hotel. I will definitely return here when staying in Shinjuku again.

This hotel was amazing. Situated in Shinjuku, it was real convenient to walk to train stations and shopping hubs. Staff were splendid, restaurant quality was top notch, this hotel really surpasses the image and values of the Hilton brand.5/5

Great location - very close the the train that gets you all around Japan. The rooms were beautiful. We were in a junior suite which was super spacious, had a beautiful bathroom and comfortable beds. We travelled with our 6 month old and the cot was great - it was an actual wooden cot on wheels, not a portacot so it was really comfortable. Fantastic lounge on the executive level, which serves finger food for dinner each night (that was delicious and substantial) as well as alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. The breakfast buffet downstairs was excellent - there was almost nothing it didn’t have. We booked this hotel during a Hilton 50% off sale and it was worth every cent. The staff are extremely attentive and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. We would love to come back!

We stayed at the Hilton Tokyo in the Junior Executive Suite. It was a spacious bedroom with a king size bem and a sofa, that could be used as a bed.The bed was very comfortable, soft linens and pillows. The bathroom was very good, with a nice shower and a bathtube, but it was a little small, compared to the bedroom. Very modern decoration and beautiful. As we stayed at a Executive Suite, we could use the executive lounge, that was very nice and worth it. There was an excellent breakfast, with a great variety and very tasteful. There was also an afternoon tea, with sandwiches and a variety of sweets and cakes. And at 6pm there was a small meal, with many types of alcoholic drinks and appetizers, including cheese, charcuteries and some hot dishes. Everybody was so gentle, but there was one person in special - Mr Waki - that was very kind to our family and helped us a lot. The executive lounge was at the 37th floor and we had the greatest view of Mountain Fuji, that was something very special.As we stayed at Executive Suite, we could also have the buffet breakfast that was served at one of the restaurants of the hotel: The Marble Lounge. It was one of the best breakfasts I've ever had: ocidental and japanese food, everything so beautiful and tasty, it was delicious!!!!The hotel is located at Shinjuku, one of the most busy parts of Tokyo. There was a shuttle bus from the hotel to the Shinjuku Station (where you could take metro, JR line trains and shinkansen), the ride takes 5-10 minutes. If you prefer going walking to Shinjuku Staion it would take 15 minutes. Or you could use the metro, that was 8-10 minutes walking from the hotel. The Shinjuku Station is close to a lot of stores and department stores. The localization of the hotel couldn't be better.The staff of the hotel was impeccable, always kind and gentle, specially the front desk and the concierge. I would like to thank also Mr Ernesto from the Front desk, who helped us with a difficult situation we had.This was the third time we stayed at this hotel, and I do recommend it for family and friends. And I hope we can go back again very soon.

I stayed in the Hilton Tokyo for a family trip 01/09-01/13. We were very impressed with our stay last year so we decided to come back again. We were not disappointed at all. Nice staff, clean room and great services. We will be back.

We stayed at the Hilton for four nights during January and the experience was amazing. Super friendly staff, great rooms, delicious food. The location is perfect too, close to many fun options in the city.

My husband and I stayed at Hilton Tokyo (Shinjuku) for five nights. The room was a bit more spacious compared to standard Japanese hotels. Their breakfast buffet is excellent - great varieties and simply delicious. They run free shuttle bus between the hotel to Shinjuku JR station (in front of Keio Department Store) every 20 min, so that was convenient. There are restaurants and shops in close walking distance.

First hotel we stayed at on arrival for our Japanese holiday. Very fast and efficient service on check in, Being Hilton honours guest we were also treated to a free upgrade upon arrival. Very nice and spacious hotel room with great window views of the city, Easy to get around having a subway beneath the hotel too. I quite enjoyed the traditional Japanese breakfast and would have no hesitation rating it a 5/5

One of the most common review you'll read about Tokyo hotels is how small the rooms are. Hilton Tokyo is an exception. You may be paying a premium price, but you'll get the value of what you pay for. For our trip last August, I actually got the hotel at 50% off due to a running promotion in the Hilton website. I could not resist and immediately booked the hotel for our last stop in Japan. The hotel room is spacious and you get to walk around the room. The King room we got also had a Japanese window (which I really liked) as an accent to its modern design. Despite not paying the full price, we got the full benefit of staying in a high class hotel. Their service was impeccable - they helped us in booking some restaurants, we hitched on the free shuttle to Shinjuku station, they kept our luggages in the lobby, etc. It was definitely a great stay. P.S. They can help you book an airport shuttle which is very convenient after your long trip.

Spend few days with the family in the new year. friendly staff and Amazing Strewbarry buffet. Bit expensive food within the hotel but a range of restaurants are few steps away. Access to Subway is within the hotel and Airport Limo Bus stops at this hotel. Higher floors provide a view of greater Tokyo area.

Located in the business district, just by the metro station, this is the most modern, accommodating and busy hotel in the area. Even if we arrived in the same time with some large groups, the duty manager jumped and helped with our check-in, as well as giving us great Concierge tips. Once arrived in the room, what really delights the visitor, are the amenities: traditional kimonos on arrival and pyjamas on turn-down, grounding you in the local culture.

Loved this place, stayed for 6 nights as the first stop on a Far East tour, first time at this particular Tokyo hotel. Great location, direct access to the metro via the basement,(2 minute walk - we timed it!) easy stroll to Shinjuku station and countless bars, restaurants and entertainment options around Shinjuku. Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building with its free 45th floor observation deck is just two blocks from the hotel. Fabulous breakfasts, one of the best fitness/spa facilities we’ve experienced at a city hotel for a while. Very helpful and friendly staff, Sato on the concierge desk was particularly informative and helpful. It’s a big hotel and at times the exec lounge is very busy. However, a nice touch was the provision of an “overflow” lounge reserved for Diamond members when things were too busy. Really nice place to unwind in a very relaxing environment after a full day sightseeing.

I stayed here with my family for a week, the hotel was in a good location and close to public transport. The rooms were a good size and very clean. The buffet breakfast was fantastic and great for fussy children, there is plenty to choose from. Definitely come back to stay when next in Tokyo.

We stayed in an executive king room for 2 nights. On arrival we had good service and check in was quick. Our room wasn’t ready (we were a little early), and were invited to the executive floor to wait. The executive floor had a wide range of beverages and some light treats (fruit & cakes).Our room was a good size. Decent size bathroom. Very comfortable bed. The good:Service was great. Can’t fault. The Buffet was really good quality. Lots of variety. Included in the room rate so can’t fault. The average:The hotel is not the most convenient location. It’s about a 15 minute walk to the closest subway. However taxis are reasonably inexpensive if you’re feeling lazy or it’s just too cold. The bad:Nothing. Had a great time. Would recommend this hotel.

We had a wonderful stay at the Hilton Tokyo. The hotel is lovely and elegant with excellent customer service. We traveled as a family with our 2 college aged children and would stay here again! The CONCIERGE STAFF IS THE BEST WE HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED!!! They speak fluent English and provided us with personalized detailed maps of every location we were interested in visiting. One time when we could not make it back to the desk to follow up on one of the sites, a detailed letter was left for us in our room with all of the pertinent information. They WOWED us! They also made our reservations home through Narita airport. The Hotel/Location: The hotel is lovely and elegant and the rooms are spacious. As a Gold member, both of our rooms were easily upgraded. The hotel is located in Shinjuku and offers a free shuttle (a large bus) to and from the Shinjuku train station every 20 minutes - see picture (last bus from station at 9:40 pm). There are also 2 train lines walkable and directly under the hotel. The only negatives are 1. In the room there was a combo bathtub next to the shower and the shower heads did not quite properly fit the shower even if adjusted. It was a little awkward to use the shower, and 2. House keeping generally cleaned later in the day which was inconvenient. We came back to our room a couple of times, early afternoon after sight seeing and wanted to relax but our rooms had not been cleaned. Buffet Breakfast: The buffet breakfast in (Marble Lounge Restaurant) was fantastic with many choices ($40 per person or free if your are a Gold HH member. You can eat breakfast in the Marble Restaurant in lieu of the Executive Lounge.). The only negative, which was minor, was that the coffee and cappuccino were not very good. Executive Lounge: The lounge is lovely with a great view including of Mt Fuji. It is large in size with many choices especially at breakfast. There is also a chef to make omelettes. Waki (staff) had so much personality and offered so many travel suggestions. There was an issue accommodating guests for cocktail hours (6-9 pm) and we had to wait on line to actually get into the lounge. A couple of times, we left our name on the "list" and they called us when a table became available. Staff: Overall the staff was super friendly, helpful, eager to please and most spoke fluent English. The only issue we had was at checkout when our bill was completely wrong. It still has not been resolved but I cannot fault the Hilton Tokyo. This is a Hilton Honors issue.

Great hotel, near to two different subway lines and an efficient free shuttle to and from Shinjuku station. Rooms were spacious, clean and up to hilton global standards.I couldn’t give it five stars due to the avaricious prices within the hotel however.My bill for 6 chicken wings, hummus & bread and 2 beers was ¥8,800 (€65.98). In my almost 15 years of legally purchasing alcohol, this was the most I’ve ever paid for a pint of standard beer - €16.49. That put a dampener on my stay and I would be reluctant to stay there again because of it.

This was my first time staying in Hilton Tokyo. Hotel locates in Shinjuku, where it is at a walkable distance from Shinjuku station or there is free shuttle to & fro Shinjuku stat at every 20-mins. Also, you can walk underground from Nishi-Shinjuku or Tochomae station. The housekeeping of room, the service from front desk & the lounge are at Hilton standard. The buffet breakfast is the best among all the Hiltons I accommodated. The view from the executive lounge is also amazing, you can see the Mount Fuji when the weather is clear.

We visited few different hilton hotels. My partner and I both surprised the quality and service level from Hilton Tokyo. Best friendly staffs ever from our stays. The room is tidy and spacious compares to other accomendation in Tokyo. Prime location to most of the popular places in Shinjuku. Highly Recommended to anyone if you prepare to stay around Shinjuku for couple of days.

It is winter in Tokyo and though it is not snowing, it is very cold. We have stayed at the Hilton for 5 nights and it has been lovely to return to this warm hotel after a busy day sightseeing.The hotel is right above the Nishishinjuku Train station which makes it really convenient to get around.The rooms are very nice and the staff were very accommodating to make sure we had an interconnecting room with our sons.The beds are very comfortable, and our bathroom had a lovely deep bath, not to mention state of the art top of the range heated toilet with about 20 buttons!The bar has a nice 3 piece band performing most nights and was also a very relaxing place after dinner.The restaurants are expensive, especially for a family of 4, however there are alternatives in a round building next door, and some under the Hilton.

The most impressive part of Hilton Tokyo to me was, the property indeed possesses qualities and styles that classic hotels all have, which sometimes often difficult to find from hotels in in Tokyo. Tokyo being very populous and expensive city, many hotels including top notch ones, only occupies top floors of skyscrapers, sharing mid and bottom parts with business offices. However this hotel has its building solely for its own uses, making the hotel feel more like comfortable instant home away from home. This hotel utilizes huge area for executive club lounge which offer panoramic views of Japan including Mt. Fuji and other famous landmarks (I wasn’t very interested much except the Mountain Fuji view but I could definitely tell one of the most valuable assets for the hotel is, good location which provides such good panoramic views in the heart of bustling city)I heard the lounge is always so full, but I was lucky to enjoy good time without crowd, and I took breakfast at lounge all the time despite I heard breakfast restaurants on 1st and 2nd floors provides much more menus.One bad thing was, restaurants the concierge recommended – classic Japanese deep fries course restaurants, wasn’t much to my satisfaction personally. The restaurants had many good reviews from tripadvisor I saw, but my own perception is, anything can taste good if fried and there are too many good stuffs to enjoy with the price of the deep fries course meal- I heard deep fries are one of the high-end meals in Japan, but hope concierge offers more options for the guests who ask for good recommendation.The location is, I wouldn’t say, it is too perfect, because it requires hotel shuttle bus or quick taxi ride from Shinjuku and nearby stations, but the hotel has very good access from both Haneda & Narita airport. I usually do not like taking subways but in Japan, there are almost no options. However, you can take airport limousines from both airports (but it takes bit more than then taking subways), and hotel can book your return bus to airport. The hotel is also easy to go to Ginza, Omotesando, and other popular areas by subway (connected to hotel ground floor). As i heard, the hotel rarely gives gold benefit- anyway, I booked executive rooms because I wanted access to executive lounge as I ways do. The hotel say they are always full so I recommend to book the types of rooms you want even if you are a diamond or gold member. The hotel seems busy all the time indeed. I would definitely consider being there again. (some of reviews I studied before my trip had, some staffs are not very nice but for my stay, most staffs were very professional and nice, and provided excellent service with feeling of hospitality).

Simply a phenomenal Hilton property, the property is maintained to the highest standards and is immaculate. The suites are large, wonderfully designed, great showers, overall a five star experience. The exec lounge is one of the best on the globe, excellent assortment and best in class. Stay here with confidence.

We just spent 5 nights at the hotel in two rooms and it was excellent. The location and shuttle service to Shinjuku really makes the place special. Breakfast in the marble lounge is a real treat with a massive variety of items to chose from. The executive lounge is outstanding and I felt like they really respected my diamond status with Hilton and I would like to personally thank all of the staff in the executive lounge for such incredible service and providing us with wonderful rooms. They remember your name when you walk in and even remember how you like your coffee. The main concierges are also very helpful and kind. Even the staff working the motor court and shuttle are so friendly and helpful.

We stayed at the Hilton for 5 days over the New Year period, the busiest tourist sean in Japan. Arriving on an early morning flight from Sydney we were offered an early room at 8am (not the room we booked but happy to take a room with twin beds to get early access at no cost). The hotel was booked out but managed very well to deal with the high volume. We had access to the lounge (being diamond members) which had good food and drinks and an amazing view of Mt Fuji.We used their shuttle bus to Shinkuju station but its an easy walk (we bused it due to the cold).We were offerred a traditional Japanese breakfast in a small room on the 2nd floor which was lovely.There are a number of dining options in the hotel, we ate in the buffet once (ok, not brilliant) and the St George's bar (warning- they smoke in the bar) which had live jazz music each night. They have a gorgeous patisserie to buy take away cakes, highly recommended.Didn't use the fitness centre or pool but both looked good.Room was a good size (more than enough room for two large suitcases). Has a fridge and coffee making. Very quiet, didn't hear any noise from adjoining rooms. We used our Hilton Honors points so this wonderful stay was free other than food and incidentals. Have stsyed before and would stay again.

I had stayed at Hilton Tokyo for 3 nights and I must say it was truly a pleasure.The staff are extremely friendly and most of them can speak English fluently.The rooms are quite large and absolutely spotless.Their restaurants provide mouthwatering food that makes you come back crawling for more and don't get me started on their Strawberry Buffet it has everything from cakes to chocolate fountains.It was truly a extraordinary experience and would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants a comfortable stay.100% confident I'm coming back.

This hotel is very well located, the rooms are spacious and clean and the staff is just great. In particular, Mr Yuhsuke Kasano, Duty Manager, was very accommodating and wanted to make sure that we were satisfied with our stay and that our room and experience met our expectations. Our experience could have been very different but this gentleman took good care of us. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Tokyo for the first time or repeat visitors. The concierge staff was also pleasant and accommodating. Overall great experience.

First time in Tokyo and this was aGreat place to explore the city from. Convenient to subways, shopping, and food! The rooms were very clean and the hotel has nice amenities as well as a really cool view!

This hotel was more suitable for business oriented people than for a family of 5 like us. Apart from the awkward location, we still like the hotel for their people and service. They are so polite and nice.

Spent 5 evenings during Christmas at Hilton Shinjuku. Overall it was a good experience with efficient check-in/check-out process, convenient location to main shopping areas / restaurants / subway stations. Staff was friendly and speaks good English. The only improvement point was the housekeeping service. The daily make-up room service was rather late (usually came around 3pm to 4pm) and the cleaning was not thorough. Used utilities and vanity kits were sometimes not refilled and the bathroom could be cleaner (especially the floor).

A great hotel to stay in Tokyo.Very well appointed rooms with an excellent club lounge.Stay in the higher rooms but it is a very close mfortable hotel for a family in a very handy location.We stayed in the newer rooms so ask for them when booking.

This is a huge hotel and we were there at an incredibly busy time over new year. There were issues we faced and they brought my rating down. The physical hotel is nice. Standard rooms are comfortable and whilst bathrooms are small with showers in the tub, they certainky worked well and were clean.Service is where it becomes hit and miss and it seems the excuse is "It's a big hotel". Gold upgrade not provided. I can understand during busy periods however I believe the reason why they couldn't accomodate us was simply that they don't plan properly and advised me they totally ignore the online check in. Why ask guests to check in, what time they will arrive and also confirm that early check in which provides room assignment automatically (and gave me no choice) will not impact upgrades. When i arrived I was offered a twin upgrade after booking a king with a confirmed kids bed. I was told that I had selected a room already (complete contradiction to the online system), I was told one cannot book extra beds (it in facts states you must when booking) and when I challenged this I was asked to prove it which I did. I was then told if we keep the standard king room then we wouldn't be entitled to lounge access and breakfast. All in all not a good start. Basically in the end they "generously" offered "something they never do" which was lounge access. What I feel is a gold card entitlement. After all this they then said they were moving us to a different room which was a little more spacious. What I don't understand is how then they managed to get the extra bed into the room in the minutes it took us to get upstairs. Something was off. They had said they would send up amenities For the extra person with the bed. We waited 2.5 hours until 10pm to get a bath towel. The whole thing felt sordid.This was followed by concierge failing to assist effectively with restaurant reservations leaving us stranded and forced to eat in a smokey Hilton restaurant that was like a zoo with very average food and highly over priced.There were too many dropped balls and the underlying issue seemed to be that everyone wanted to argue about everything rather than take responsibility and make it right, as the promised. Room service was awful with poorly cooked food. Cold fries and 90 minutes to eventually recieve over priced but edible food. Again they new there were issues as they had to replace food twice yet no one made it right.They tried on check out but that's too late.I have had too many sub par experiences with Hilton who it seems are struggling world wide to compete in terms of service and the "make it right" philosophy is great if delivered on.It's a shame as the hotel has all the makings of a great experience but in all honesty the team need to stand up and be responsible for the short comings.

Stayed here for business. The staff was friendly. The breakfast was one of the best I have had. The food options were amazing. The rooms were clean and plush, although a tad small by American standards. The bathroom shower/tub/steam combo was lovely. Suggest reserving rooms well in advance. I had one small hiccup where I tried to extend my stay by 1 night. After checking with hotel front desk staff numerous times, and being told hotel was sold out, I discovered rooms were available online. When I checked with the front desk, they confirmed I could stay one additional night at DOUBLE my nightly rate. I had to switch hotels to the Westin, which was amazing but across town. The hotel is in a nice neighborhood, has close access to the subway system and is walking distance to parks, etc. Great stay.

I had tried to call in earlier and requested to have a higher floor for my junior suite. Was told it was subjected to availability. On my arrival, I was told that there are no rooms on higher floor available as I’ve book for a week and they don’t have any room on a high floor. Instead I was put on a very low floor with no privacy. It was obvious that the room was not used for a long time, my sensitive nose was sneezing all the way when I was in the room. Had to resort to wearing mask in the room. Terrible experience.

I simply loved this hotel . We stayed here for the New Years this year and we had a great time . The staff are really friendly and helpful and the hotel really clean and spacious . Our room was amazing with an amazing view . I really recommend this hotel for your visit to Tokyo great place and great location .

Excellent location. Beautiful views of the cities. Great staffs service. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else when I visit Tokyo. Thank you Hilton Honor Members service. Hilton has done a great job in this facility.

Fantastic all round. Will go back. Shuttle fabulous although the walk to Shinjuku is about the same - great location. Happy, dedicated staff who are professional and lovely people. For the high prices you pay anywhere in this area of Tokyo, the Hilton was definitely the best choice.

With so many great options to choose from in a massive city like Tokyo, this hotel is a great option. From its newly remodeled rooms, to its convenient location to vibrant Shinjuku, and direct train access, it’s a winner for sure!My opinion is also based on the fact that we had a lovely good sized suite with a decent view and nicely appointed. While the bathtub was small and deep the shower made up for it. The sliding door between the bedroom and living room also made it comfortable and more private for us traveling with our kid.We had access to the Executive Lounge which always proves useful for less crowded breakfasts, lunch snacks (which we were never around for) and pre-dinner drinks and light food which was great though we were rarely back early enough to truly utilize this.The amenities were all good including the pool, spa and gym.There is one absolutely massive downside to the hotel and that is undoubtedly it restaurants, which while they seem to be very nice, the prices are simply outrageous and unjustifiable. We ended up eating outside of the hotel and on several occasions at competing properties which offered equally good options and normal prices. An extra appreciation to Kasano the duty manager when we checked in who was exceptional, accommodating and went the extra mile to ensure we had a great stay.

The room was clean. Bathroom was really small. I stayed with my family ( 2 Adult,1 Youth, 1 6yr old ). We were given 2 single beds. Housekeeping took 58 seconds to respond to my call. The front desk people could speak fluent English.

Their japanese breakfast was amazing. The hotel staff were all very accommodating and attentive. Convenient location. Overall it's a very nice hotel but the bathrooms need a bit of upgrade. Would come back again.

Hilton Tokyo is always great! It was greater X'mas season than always. Also, in winter, we can see the beautiful Mt. Fuji from the executive lounge. I was very satisfied with this stay of Hilton Tokyo.

I just got back from a wonderful 5 nights stay at Hilton Tokyo. This was our first time and it will not be our last! Every thing from check-in to check-out was top-notch, the restaurants are some of the best I have seen in any hotel. We invaded the counter at the Zatta bar and the Frenchie bartender handled our group of twenty perfectly, Good job !Ken F.

I stayed here for two nights on business. First impression was “uh oh - this is a zoo” as the lobby was very busy. However, don’t worry as soon as you approach the desk, calm, friendliness and efficiency take over and from then on the experience was completely perfect.The front desk was helpful and friendly. I was upgraded to a room with executive lounge access (Hilton Honors) and allowed to check in early. The executive lounge was perfect with a great view of Fuji San. It was a lovely place to work, with nice food. I noticed that it was also great with kids.If you are able to get Executive Lounge access, breakfast is stunning - either a nice buffet or an incredible full Japanese breakfast.If you don’t get Executive Lounge access no matter as there is a very nice lobby lounge (good hot chocolate) and a wide number of very good restaurants and bar. I visited the cocktail bar, which was cozy and stylish. There is a good gym, with the usual equipment and some I hadn’t seen before.The hotel is in the Skyscraper district of Shinjuku. I got lost in Shinjuku the first time, although there is a free shuttle to the hotel that I could have used. Shinjuku is crazy .... but amazing. The hotel is in the “relatively quiet” part.Excellent hotel in Tokyo. Good place to stay on business but would be more than happy to stay there on vacation too.

Went with family and stayed 3 nights. Overall was happy with hotel and would recommend. Location for the hotel is good and you can access the Maranouchi underground line from hotel. Shinjuku station is a short walk away. Lots to see an do around the station especially on the east side. Added bonus is shuttle that runs from the station to the hotel - very handy when hauling baggage. Facilities in the hotel are good and the buffet breakfast is good with a mixture of western and local dishes. Recommended

Great place to stay if you want a western-style hotel. Spacious rooms, great staff service and concierge service. After staying in some smallish rooms, it was a nice break to have the room to spread out. Restaurants are expensive for average food.

The hotel offers spacious room with good amenity. The location is a bit away from city center of Shinjuku but within walking distance. Staff are quite nice but there are also room for improvement especially in the Bell Area.

We stayed there right before Christmas and it was very busy. As Gold members we where upgraded to an Executive floor and had access to the lounge.Very friendly service and they went our of their way to make our stay great!Rooms are very nicely done and the lounge is very good.Great hotel not quite at the luxury level of Park Hyatt, Andaz and Conrad but at a much better price point.Highly recommended!!

We were given a twin room for our family of four with children. The room given was spacious, new or at least very well maintained. The check-in process was smooth and courteous. The concierge service was pleasant. Please keep it up.

A very pleasant stay in Hilton Hotel Tokyo. This was a honeymoon stay in Hilton Hotel Tokyo's King Deluxe stay. Upon arrival we were greeted by the hotel manager Ernesto Bressan and Rinna Kato and they have made special arrangement for us to celebrate our honeymoon. The overall experience during the stay is excellent and we are looking for our next trip to Tokyo to stay in the same hotel again.

Everything was to the expectations or above. The airport limousine (bus) is an easy and affordable way to make the journey from Narita to the hotel (prepare for 2 hour trip). Jr suite on 36th floor was superb - excellent cleanliness/decor. Also the bed & linen were second to none. Breakfast included and of really good quality. Would highly recommend.

You can't beat Japanese hospitality and this hotel lives up to it's reputation. Wonderful views, perfect service, exceptional rooms and a central location. Attention to every detail is applied from when you check in to when you leave. Will definitely return back in the future

We stayed 3 nights for holidays, Hilton is busy hotel but check in and check out is smooth on my stay.The room size is average but the cleanliness is excellent. The bed is comfortable and we can sleep very well.I like the amenities and the vanity kit come with rubber band is very thoughtful. The shuttle bus that operate 20 minutes per trip to Shinjuku station is very convenience and the driver is very helpful and in good manner.The LF restaurant provides many variety and good breakfast from Japanese food, congee and western bacon, many types of dessert and beverages too.The gym operate 24 hours is a plus point for my hubby .We definitely will come back!

The hotel is lovely with beautiful decorations and nice, clean rooms. Everything is available for you and should you need to call upon the staff, I found them all to be very helpful. The gym isn't very large but there's also a pool (which I'm not sure is open year round). It's certainly a popular hotel, especially around the holidays, and one of the managers told me they are booked almost full through 2020 (as per the upcoming sports events and Olympics). So as it is recommended, know that you'll need to book in advance (including one of the dining rooms, seems to be a popular place for locals to have a nice meal).
